You	O
have	O
undefined	O
behavior	O
in	O
your	O
code	O
:	O
You	O
haven	O
an	O
uninitialized	O
pointer	O
input	O
in	O
getinput	O
.	O

Uninitialized	O
(	O
non-static	O
)	O
local	O
variables	O
have	O
an	O
indeterminate	O
value	O
,	O
and	O
it	O
will	O
seem	O
to	O
be	O
random	O
.	O

As	O
the	O
value	O
is	O
indeterminate	O
(	O
and	O
seemingly	O
random	O
)	O
the	O
scanf	O
call	O
will	O
write	O
to	O
some	O
unknown	O
place	O
in	O
memory	O
,	O
overwriting	O
whatever	O
was	O
there	O
.	O

You	O
could	O
easily	O
solve	O
this	O
by	O
making	O
input	O
an	O
array	B-Data_Structure
.	O

we	O

's	O

,	O

to	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
Q_3770	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block

)	I-Code_Block

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
31336417	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/31336417/	O

actually	O
super()	O
is	O
not	O
syntactic	O
sugar	O
,	O
its	O
purpose	O
is	O
to	O
invoke	O
parent	O
implementation	O
of	O
a	O
certain	O
method	O
.	O

You	O
have	O
to	O
use	O
super()	O
when	O
you	O
want	O
to	O
override	O
a	O
parent	O
method	O
,	O
you	O
do	O
n't	O
have	O
to	O
use	O
super()	O
when	O
instead	O
you	O
want	O
to	O
overwrite	O
a	O
method	O
.	O

The	O
difference	O
is	O
that	O
in	O
the	O
first	O
case	O
you	O
want	O
to	O
add	O
extra	O
behavior	O
(	O
aka	O
code	O
execution	O
)	O
before	O
or	O
after	O
the	O
original	O
implementation	O
,	O
in	O
the	O
second	O
you	O
want	O
a	O
completely	O
different	O
implementation	O
.	O

You	O
ca	O
n't	O
use	O
self.method_name()	O
in	O
an	O
override	O
,	O
the	O
result	O
will	O
be	O
a	O
recursion	O
error	O
!	O

Example	O
:	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_4468	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

Given	O
a	O
base	O
class	O
A	O
,	O
with	O
a	O
method	O
m	O
,	O
B	O
extends	O
A	O
by	O
overriding	O
m	O
,	O
C	O
extends	O
A	O
by	O
overwriting	O
m	O
,	O
and	O
D	O
generates	O
an	O
error	O
!	O

EDIT	O
:	O

I	O
just	O
realized	O
that	O
you	O
actually	O
have	O
2	O
different	O
methods	O
(	O
test_a	O
and	O
test_b	O
)	O
.	O

My	O
answer	O
is	O
still	O
valid	O
,	O
but	O
regarding	O
your	O
specific	O
scenario	O
:	O

you	O
should	O
use	O
self.test_a()	O
unless	O
you	O
override/overwrite	O
that	O
method	O
in	O
your	O
class	O
B	O
and	O
you	O
want	O
to	O
execute	O
the	O
original	O
implementation.	O
.	O
so	O
we	O
can	O
say	O
that	O
calling	O
super().test_a()	O
or	O
self.test_a()	O
it	O
's	O
the	O
same	O
given	O
that	O
you	O
'll	O
never	O
override/overwrite	O
the	O
original	O
test_a()	O
in	O
your	O
subclasses.	O
.	O
however	O
is	O
a	O
nonsense	O
to	O
use	O
super()	O
if	O
not	O
for	O
an	O
override/overwrite	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
31336417	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/31336417/	O

Usually	O
you	O
will	O
want	O
to	O
use	O
self.test_a()	O
to	O
call	O
an	O
inherited	O
method	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
in	O
some	O
rare	O
situations	O
you	O
might	O
want	O
to	O
use	O
super().test_a()	O
even	O
though	O
it	O
seems	O
to	O
do	O
the	O
same	O
thing	O
.	O

They	O
're	O
not	O
equivalent	O
,	O
even	O
though	O
they	O
have	O
the	O
same	O
behavior	O
in	O
your	O
example	O
.	O

To	O
explore	O
the	O
differences	O
,	O
lets	O
make	O
two	O
versions	O
of	O
your	O
B	O
class	O
,	O
one	O
with	O
each	O
kind	O
of	O
call	O
,	O
then	O
make	O
two	O
C	O
classes	O
that	O
further	O
extend	O
the	O
B	O
classes	O
and	O
override	O
test_a	O
:	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_4469	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

When	O
you	O
call	O
the	O
test_b()	O
method	O
on	O
C1	O
and	O
C2	O
instances	O
you	O
'll	O
get	O
different	O
results	O
,	O
even	O
though	O
B1	O
and	O
B2	O
behave	O
the	O
same	O
:	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_4470	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

This	O
is	O
because	O
the	O
super()	O
call	O
in	O
B2.test_b	O
tells	O
Python	O
that	O
you	O
want	O
to	O
skip	O
the	O
version	O
of	O
test_a	O
in	O
any	O
more	O
derived	O
class	O
and	O
always	O
call	O
an	O
implementation	O
from	O
a	O
parent	O
class	O
.	O

(	O
Actually	O
,	O
I	O
suppose	O
it	O
could	O
be	O
a	O
sibling	O
class	O
in	O
a	O
multiple	O
inheritance	O
situation	O
,	O
but	O
that	O
's	O
getting	O
even	O
more	O
obscure	O
.	O
)	O

Like	O
I	O
said	O
at	O
the	O
top	O
,	O
you	O
usually	O
want	O
to	O
allow	O
a	O
more-derived	O
class	O
like	O
the	O
Cs	O
to	O
override	O
the	O
behavior	O
of	O
the	O
inherited	O
methods	O
you	O
're	O
calling	O
in	O
your	O
less-derived	O
class	O
.	O

That	O
means	O
that	O
most	O
of	O
the	O
time	O
using	O
self.whatever	B-Code_Block
is	O
the	O
way	O
to	O
go	O
.	O

You	O
only	O
need	O
to	O
use	O
super	O
when	O
you	O
're	O
doing	O
something	O
fancy	O
.	O

I	O
have	O
been	O
using	O
haskell	O
for	O
a	O

now	O
.	O

I	O

of	O
the	O
concepts	O
but	O
I	O
still	O
do	O
not	O
understand	O
,	O
what	O
exactly	O
does	O
haskells	O
type	O
system	O
allow	O
me	O
to	O
do	O
that	O
I	O
cannot	O
do	O
in	O
another	O
statically	O
typed	O
language	O
.	O

I	O
just	O
intuitively	O
know	O
that	O
haskells	O
type	O
system	O
is	O
better	O
in	O
every	O
imaginable	O
way	O
compared	O
to	O
the	O
type	O
system	O
in	O
C	O
,	O
C++	O
or	O
java	O
,	O
but	O
I	O
ca	O
n't	O
explain	O
it	O
logically	O
,	O
primarily	O
because	O
of	O
a	O
lack	O
of	O
in	O
depth	O
knowledge	O
about	O
the	O
differences	O
in	O
type	O
systems	O
between	O
haskell	O
and	O
other	O

typed	O
languages	O
.	O

give	O
me	O
examples	O
of	O
how	O
haskells	O
type	O
system	O
is	O
more	O
helpful	O
compared	O
to	O
a	O
language	O
with	O
a	O
static	O
type	O
system	O
.	O

,	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
26585170	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/26585170/	O

The	O
Haskell	O
type	O
system	O
has	O
a	O
number	O
of	O
features	O
which	O
all	O
exist	O
in	O
other	O
languages	O
,	O
but	O
are	O
rarely	O
combined	O
within	O
a	O
single	O
,	O
consistent	O
language	O
:	O

it	O
is	O
a	O
sound	O
,	O
static	O
type	O
system	O
,	O
meaning	O
that	O
a	O
number	O
of	O
errors	O
are	O
guaranteed	O
not	O
to	O
happen	O
at	O
runtime	O
without	O
needing	O
runtime	O
type	O
checks	O
(	O
this	O
is	O
also	O
the	O
case	O
in	O
Caml	O
,	O
SML	O
and	O
almost	O
the	O
case	O
in	O
Java	O
,	O
but	O
not	O
in	O
,	O
say	O
,	O
Lisp	O
,	O
Python	O
,	O
C	O
,	O
or	O
C++	O
)	O
;	O

it	O
peforms	O
static	O
type	O
reconstruction	O
,	O
meaning	O
that	O
the	O
programmer	O
does	O
n't	O
need	O
to	O
write	O
types	O
unless	O
he	O
wants	O
to	O
,	O
the	O
compiler	O
will	O
reconstruct	O
them	O
on	O
its	O
own	O
(	O
this	O
is	O
also	O
the	O
case	O
in	O
Caml	O
and	O
SML	O
,	O
but	O
not	O
in	O
Java	O
or	O
C	O
)	O
;	O

it	O
supports	O
impredicative	O
polymorphism	O
(	O
type	O
variables	O
)	O
,	O
even	O
at	O
higher	O
kinds	O
(	O
unlike	O
Caml	O
and	O
SML	O
,	O
or	O
any	O
other	O
production-ready	O
language	O
known	O
to	O
me	O
)	O
;	O

it	O
has	O
good	O
support	O
for	O
overloading	O
(	O
type	O
classes	O
)	O
(	O
unlike	O
Caml	O
and	O
SML	O
)	O
.	O

Whether	O
any	O
of	O
those	O
make	O
Haskell	O
a	O
better	O
language	O
is	O
open	O
to	O
discussion	O
—	O
for	O
example	O
,	O
while	O
I	O
happen	O
to	O
like	O
type	O
classes	O
a	O
lot	O
,	O
I	O
know	O
quite	O
a	O
few	O
Caml	O
programmers	O
who	O
strongly	O
dislike	O
overloading	O
and	O
prefer	O
to	O
use	O
the	O
module	O
system	O
.	O

On	O
the	O
other	O
hand	O
,	O
the	O
Haskell	O
type	O
system	O
lacks	O
a	O
few	O
features	O
that	O
other	O
languages	O
support	O
elegantly	O
:	O

it	O
has	O
no	O
support	O
for	O
runtime	O
dispatch	O
(	O
unlike	O
Java	O
,	O
Lisp	O
,	O
and	O
Julia	O
)	O
;	O

it	O
has	O
no	O
support	O
for	O
existential	O
types	O
and	O
GADTs	O
(	O
these	O
are	O
both	O
GHC	O
extensions	O
)	O
;	O

it	O
has	O
no	O
support	O
for	O
dependent	O
types	O
(	O
unlike	O
Coq	O
,	O
Agda	O
and	O
Idris	O
)	O
.	O

Again	O
,	O
whether	O
any	O
of	O
these	O
are	O
desirable	O
features	O
in	O
a	O
general-purpose	O
programming	O
language	O
is	O
open	O
to	O
discussion	O
.	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
26585170	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/26585170/	O

One	O
major	O
difference	O
between	O
Haskell	O
's	O
type	O
system	O
and	O
that	O
of	O
most	O
OO	O
languages	O
is	O
that	O
the	O
ability	O
for	O
a	O
function	O
to	O
have	O
side	O
effects	O
is	O
represented	O
by	O
a	O
data	O
type	O
(	O
a	O
monad	O
such	O
as	O
IO	O
)	O
.	O

This	O
allows	O
you	O
to	O
write	O
pure	O
functions	O
that	O
the	O
compiler	O
can	O
verify	O
are	O
side-effect-free	O
and	O
referentially	O
transparent	O
,	O
which	O
generally	O
means	O
that	O
they	O
're	O
easier	O
to	O
understand	O
and	O
less	O
prone	O
to	O
bugs	O
.	O

It	O
's	O
possible	O
to	O
write	O
side-effect-free	O
code	O
in	O
other	O
languages	O
,	O
but	O
you	O
do	O
n't	O
have	O
the	O
compiler	O
's	O
help	O
in	O
doing	O
so	O
.	O

Haskell	O
makes	O
you	O
think	O
more	O
carefully	O
about	O
which	O
parts	O
of	O
your	O
program	O
need	O
to	O
have	O
side	O
effects	O
(	O
such	O
as	O
I/O	O
or	O
mutable	O
variables	O
)	O
and	O
which	O
parts	O
should	O
be	O
pure	O
.	O

Also	O
,	O
although	O
it	O
's	O
not	O
quite	O
part	O
of	O
the	O
type	O
system	O
itself	O
,	O
the	O
fact	O
that	O
function	O
definitions	O
in	O
Haskell	O
are	O
expressions	O
(	O
rather	O
than	O
lists	O
of	O
statements	O
)	O
means	O
that	O
more	O
of	O
the	O
code	O
is	O
subject	O
to	O
type-checking	O
.	O

In	O
languages	O
like	O
C++	O
and	O
Java	O
,	O
it	O
's	O
often	O
possible	O
to	O
introduce	O
logic	O
errors	O
by	O
writing	O
statements	O
in	O
the	O
wrong	O
order	O
,	O
since	O
the	O
compiler	O
does	O
n't	O
have	O
a	O
way	O
to	O
determine	O
that	O
one	O
statement	O
must	O
precede	O
another	O
.	O

For	O
example	O
,	O
you	O
might	O
have	O
one	O
line	O
that	O
modifies	O
an	O
object	O
's	O
state	O
,	O
and	O
another	O
line	O
that	O
does	O
something	O
important	O
based	O
on	O
that	O
state	O
,	O
and	O
it	O
's	O
up	O
to	O
you	O
to	O
ensure	O
that	O
these	O
things	O
happen	O
in	O
the	O
correct	O
order	O
.	O

In	O
Haskell	O
,	O
this	O
kind	O
of	O
ordering	O
dependency	O
tends	O
to	O
be	O
expressed	O
through	O
function	O
composition	O
—	O
e.g	O
.	O
f	O
(	O
g	O
x	O
)	O
means	O
that	O
g	O
must	O
run	O
first	O
—	O
and	O
the	O
compiler	O
can	O
check	O
the	O
return	O
type	O
of	O
g	O
against	O
the	O
argument	O
type	O
of	O
f	O
to	O
make	O
sure	O
you	O
have	O
n't	O
composed	O
them	O
the	O
wrong	O
way	O
.	O

Question_ID	O
:	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/32560750/	O

Question_ID	O
:	O
32177557	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/32177557/	O

I	O
am	O
learning	O
Collection	B-Library
Framework	I-Library
on	O
this	O
website	O
:	O
http://way2java.com/collections/hashtable-about/	O
.	O

After	O
reading	O
all	O
the	O
methods	O
of	O
Hashtable	O
I	O
see	O
two	O
methods	O
to	O
access	O
the	O
table	O
's	O
keys	O
:	O

Set	O
keys()	O
:	O
Returns	O
a	O
Set	O
object	O
containing	O
all	O
the	O
keys	O

Set	O
keySet()	O
:	O
Returns	O
a	O
Set	O
object	O
containing	O
all	O
the	O
keys	O
of	O
Hashtable	O
.	O

One	O
similarity	O
is	O
Hashtable	O
and	O
Set	O
does	O
not	O
allow	O
duplicates	O
.	O

Adding	O
and	O
removing	O
elements	O
in	O
Set	O
also	O
reflects	O
in	O
Hashtable	O

Both	O
of	O
them	O
return	O
a	O
Set	O
object	O
.	O

I	O
do	O
n't	O
see	O
the	O
different	O
between	O
them	O
.	O

Anyone	O
can	O
tell	O
me	O
about	O
this	O
?	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
32177557	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/32177557/	O

keys()	O
does	O
n't	O
return	O
a	O
Set	O
,	O
it	O
returns	O
an	O
Enumeration<K>	B-Code_Block
.	O

Hashtable	O
is	O
a	O
very	O
legacy	O
class	O
no	O
longer	O
recommended	O
for	O
use	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
replaced	O
by	O
HashMap	O
,	O
or	O
ConcurrentHashMap	O
†	O
.	O

It	O
existed	O
before	O
the	O
JCF	B-Library
did	O
,	O
therefore	O
the	O
standard	O
way	O
to	O
get	O
to	O
the	O
keys	O
at	O
the	O
start	O
was	O
through	O
an	O
Enumeration	O
-	O
the	O
original	O
Java	O
interface	O
for	O
moving	O
through	O
a	O
collection	O
of	O
objects	O
.	O

Then	O
came	O
Java	O
1.2	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
JCF	B-Library
.	O

Hashtable	O
was	O
retrofitted	O
for	O
the	O
Map	O
interface	O
with	O
the	O
keySet()	O
method	O
that	O
returned	O
a	O
Set	O
(	O
also	O
introduced	O
with	O
the	O
JCF	B-Library
)	O
.	O

keys	O
method	O
was	O
retained	O
for	O
legacy	O
compatibility	O
reasons	O
.	O

from	O

new	O

two	O
things	O
:	O

intent	O

the	O
fact	O
that	O

keys	O
of	O
a	O
Hashtable	O
are	O
a	O
mathematical	O
set	O

implements	O
Iterable	O
<T>,	O
which	O
replaces	O
Enumerable<T>	O

†	O

the	O

documentation	O
:	O

1)	O
'	O
Maps	O
'	O
has	O
no	O
layout	O
.	O

Since	O
it	O
has	O
a	O
single	O
child	O
item	O
,	O
layout	O
:	O
'	O
fit	O
'	O
would	O
be	O
appropriate	O
here	O
.	O

2)	O
Only	O
use	O
fullscreen	O
on	O
the	O
outermost	O
item	O
,	O
you	O
do	O
n't	O
want	O
the	O
other	O
items	O
to	O
be	O
fullscreen	O
since	O
they	O
are	O
child	O
items	O
of	O
other	O
containers	O
.	O

3)	O
To	O
dynamically	O
add	O
items	O
to	O
a	O
container	O
,	O
use	O
the	O
add()	O
method	O
on	O
container	O
.	O

You	O
'll	O
also	O
need	O
to	O
call	O
doLayout()	O
to	O
trigger	O
a	O
layout	O
for	O
the	O
container	O
.	O

)	I-Code_Block

how	O
it	O

.	O

My	O
use	O
case	O
:	O
I	O
have	O
a	O
kinesis	O
stream	O
with	O
just	O
one	O
shard	O
.	O

I	O

to	O

this	O
shard	O
using	O
different	O
lambda	O
function	O
,	O
each	O

them	O
independently	O
.	O

's	O
like	O
that	O
each	O
lambda	O
function	O
will	O
have	O
it	O
's	O
own	O
shard	O
iterator	O
.	O

it	O
possible	O
?	O

multiple	O
lambda	O
consumers	O
(	O
stream	O
based	O
)	O

from	O

stream/shard	O
?	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
43402715	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/43402715/	O

Yes	O
,	O
no	O
problem	O
with	O
this	O
!	O

The	O
number	O
of	O
shards	O
does	O
n't	O
limit	O
the	O
number	O
of	O
consumers	O
a	O
stream	O
can	O
have	O
.	O

In	O
you	O
case	O
,	O
it	O
will	O
just	O
limit	O
the	O
number	O
of	O
concurrent	O
invocations	O
of	O
each	O
lambda	O
.	O

This	O
means	O
that	O
for	O
each	O
consumers	O
,	O
you	O
can	O
only	O
have	O
the	O
number	O
of	O
shards	O
of	O
concurrent	O
executions	O
.	O

Seethis	O
doc	O
for	O
more	O
details	O
.	O

No	O
,	O
you	O
have	O
to	O
add	O
the	O
column	B-Data_Structure
first	O
.	O

Schema-less	O
databases	O
(	O
NoSQL	O
)	O
can	O
support	O
this	O
,	O
but	O
an	O
RDBMS	O
needs	O
to	O
have	O
its	O
scheme	O
altered	O
.	O

It	O
's	O
kind	O
of	O
like	O
saying	O
,	O
"	O
I	O
bought	O
these	O
new	O
shoes	O
and	O
I	O
need	O
a	O
bin	O
to	O
store	O
them	O
,	O
if	O
I	O
just	O
toss	O
them	O
in	O
the	O
corner	O
will	O
a	O
bin	O
appear	O
?	O
"	O

No	O
,	O
you	O
have	O
to	O
get	O
the	O
bin	O
first	O
.	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
41528707	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/41528707/	O

There	O
are	O
several	O
options	O
to	O
achieve	O
schema	O
flexibility	O
in	O
an	O
(	O
SQL	O
-	O
)	O
RDBMS	O
:	O

1	O
.	O
use	O
a	O
Entity	O
–	O
attribute	O
–	O
value	O
model	O

2	O
.	O
store	O
a	O
JSON	O
document	O

Depending	O
on	O
your	O
use	O
case	O
,	O
data	O
volume	O
etc	O
.	O

a	O
nosql	O
db	O
could	O
be	O
the	O
better	O
choice	O
.	O

But	O
sometimes	O
you	O
need	O
only	O
one	O
or	O
a	O
few	O
tables	B-Data_Structure
to	O
be	O
schema-flexible	O
and	O
your	O
other	O
data	O
is	O
relational	O
.	O

Some	O
SQL	O
RDBMS	O
support	O
schema	O
flexible	O
tables	B-Data_Structure
,	O
E.g	O
.	O
SAP	B-Code_Block
HANA	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
"	I-Code_Block
CREATE	I-Code_Block
TABLE	I-Code_Block
..	I-Code_Block
.	I-Code_Block
WITH	I-Code_Block
SCHEMA	I-Code_Block
FLEXIBILITY	I-Code_Block
..	I-Code_Block
.	I-Code_Block
"	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block
.	O

Android	O
Developers	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_4633	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

Having	O
done	O
this	O
a	O
few	O
times	O
,	O
though	O
,	O
I	O
'd	O
like	O
to	O
point	O
out	O
some	O
things	O
that	O
will	O
likely	O
bite	O
you	O
when	O
you	O
try	O
to	O
implement	O
this	O

Android	O
requires	O
you	O
to	O
do	O
anything	O
that	O
calls	O
a	O
web	O
server	O
in	O
a	O
background	O
thread	O
.	O

http://developer.android.com/training/multiple-threads/index.html	O

You	O
are	O
probably	O
going	O
to	O
need	O
some	O
kind	O
of	O
authentication	O
,	O
especially	O
if	O
PHP	O
side	O
you	O
used	O
e.g	O
.	O
Drupal	B-Library
.	O

I	O
would	O
find	O
out	O
if	O
your	O
PHP	O
framework	O
requires	O
e.g	O
.	O
Session	O
auth	O
with	O
a	O
CRLF	O
token	O
or	O
OAuth	O
or	O
a	O
similar	O
scheme	O
.	O

Authentication	O
will	O
involve	O
three	O
steps	O
:	O

**	O
Sign	O
in	O

**	O
Retrieve	O
a	O
cookie	O
or	O
token	O

**	O
Send	O
the	O
token	O
in	O
along	O
with	O
your	O
content	O
in	O
your	O
headers	O

Finally	O
you	O
are	O
going	O
to	O
need	O
some	O
sort	O
of	O
data	O
encapsulation	O
layer	O
.	O

I	O
like	O
JSON	O
,	O
some	O
folks	O
like	O
XML	O
.	O

The	O
GSON	B-Library
library	O
,	O
which	O
you	O
can	O
learn	O
more	O
about	O
here	O
,	O
https://google-gson.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/gson/docs/javadocs/com/google/gson/Gson.html	O
,	O
is	O
the	O
most	O
user	O
and	O
beginner	O
friendly	O
JSON	O
library	O
I	O
know	O
of	O
.	O

In	O
practice	O
I	O
usually	O
use	O
Android	O
's	O
built-in	O
JSONArray	O
and	O
JSONObject	O
though	O
.	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
32390491	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/32390491/	O

Here	O
is	O
good	O
example	O
for	O
the	O

http://www.androidhive.info/2012/05/how-to-connect-android-with-php-mysql/	O

Overall	O
steps	O
to	O
do	O
:	O

Create	O
Web-service	O
for	O
login	O
in	O
PHP	O

Call	O
that	O
Web-service	O
form	O
android	O
Fragment	O

Get	O
response	O
and	O
parse	O
it	O

Show	O
the	O
Result	O
to	O
User	O

see	O
this	O
link	O
for	O
working	O
with	O
Fragments	O

Question_ID	O
:	O
2476581	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/2476581/	O

am	O

Question_ID	O
:	O
25610261	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/25610261/	O

When	O
validating	O
an	O
XML	O
DOMDocument	O
with	O
a	O
scheme	O
:	O

I	O
get	O
a	O
warning	O
message	O
like	O
:	O

Warning	O
:	O
DOMDocument::schemaValidate()	O
:	O
Element	O
'	O
foo	B-Code_Block
'	O
:	O
This	O
element	O
is	O
not	O
expected	O
.	O

Expected	O
is	O
one	O
of	O
(	O
{url}foo	B-Code_Block
,	I-Code_Block
{url}bar	I-Code_Block
)	O
.	O

What	O
is	O
the	O
difference	O
between	O
'	O
foo	B-Code_Block
'	O
and	O
'{url}foo'	B-Code_Block
and	O
how	O
to	O
fix	O
this	O
warning	O
?	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
25610261	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/25610261/	O

The	O
notation	O
{url}foo	B-Code_Block
is	O
used	O
to	O
refer	O
to	O
an	O
expanded	O
name	O
whose	O
namespace	O
part	O
is	O
url	O
and	O
whose	O
local	O
name	O
part	O
is	O
foo	O
.	O

It	O
's	O
sometimes	O
referred	O
to	O
as	O
'	O
Clark	O
notation	O
'	O
for	O
James	O
Clark	O
,	O
who	O
promoted	O
it	O
.	O

When	O
this	O
notation	O
is	O
in	O
use	O
,	O
unqualified	O
names	O
are	O
sometimes	O
referred	O
to	O
using	O
the	O
notation	O
{}foo	B-Code_Block
and	O
sometimes	O
(	O
as	O
in	O
your	O
error	O
message	O
)	O
using	O
the	O
notation	O
foo	O
.	O

The	O
error	O
message	O
is	O
telling	O
you	O
that	O
it	O
has	O
found	O
an	O
element	O
with	O
the	O
unqualified	O
name	O
foo	O
,	O
at	O
a	O
location	O
where	O
it	O
was	O
expecting	O
a	O
namespace-qualfied	O
element	O
named	O
either	O
foo	O
or	O
bar	O
in	O
the	O
namespace	O
url	O
.	O

Probable	O
cause	O
:	O
the	O
XML	O
instance	O
lacks	O
a	O
required	O
namespace	O
declaration	O
.	O

all	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
12897909	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/12897909/	O

NO	O
.	O

There	O
is	O
no	O
way	O
to	O
get	O
certificate	O
out	O
of	O
Windows	O
Azure	O
.	O

Question	O
is	O
how	O
it	O
(	O
the	O
certificate	O
)	O
appeared	O
in	O
the	O
Azure	O
at	O
first	O
place	O
.	O

It	O
was	O
certainly	O
not	O
uploaded	O
by	O
Microsoft	O
people	O
or	O
some	O
magic	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
a	O
developer	O
who	O
packed	O
the	O
deployment	O
package	O
to	O
include	O
the	O
certificate	O
reference	O
(	O
thumbprint	O
)	O
and	O
service	O
administrator	O
(	O
or	O
co-admin	O
)	O
who	O
uploaded	O
the	O
original	O
certificate	O
in	O
the	O
Azure	O
.	O

So	O
contact	O
that	O
people	O
(	O
whom	O
might	O
be	O
just	O
you	O
?	O
)	O

and	O
ask	O
for	O
the	O
original	O
certificate	O
.	O

If	O
certificate	O
is	O
lost	O
,	O
contact	O
the	O
original	O
issuer	O
(	O
certification	O
authority	O
)	O
for	O
a	O
copy	O
,	O
if	O
you	O
were	O
the	O
one	O
to	O
originally	O
requested	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
did	O
not	O
originally	O
requested	O
the	O
certificate	O
,	O
there	O
might	O
have	O
been	O
a	O
reason	O
behind	O
that	O
.	O

:	O
40689342	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/40689342/	O

If	O
you	O
know	O
your	O
max	O
value	O
for	O
your	O
numbers	O
and	O
can	O
afford	O
to	O
keep	O
a	O
list	B-Data_Structure
of	O
primes	O
,	O
then	O
factoring	O
them	O
may	O
be	O
a	O
better	O
solution	O
for	O
the	O
average/random	O
case	O
.	O

Otherwise	O
,	O
worst	O
case	O
complexity	O
,	O
it	O
's	O
still	O
O(N*N)	O
-	O
think	O
"	O
all	O
of	O
them	O
are	O
primes	O
"	O
for	O
the	O
worst	O
case	O
.	O

Approach	O
:	O

factor	O
them	O
and	O
store	O
a	O
Map[N]	B-Code_Block
+	O
int	O
closestNeigh[]	O

take	O
a	O
factor	O
and	O
O(N)	O
determine	O
for	O
each	O
of	O
them	O
the	O
closest	O
that	O
contain	O
that	O
factor	O
(	O
prefix/sufix	O
sums	O
will	O
be	O
involved	O
)	O

eliminate	O
that	O
factor	O
from	O
all	O
the	O
factor	O
maps	O

take	O
the	O
next	O
factor	O
.	O

Adjust	O
the	O
closest	O
neighbor	O
index	O
only	O
if	O
new	O
one	O
is	O
closest	O
.	O

This	O
may	O
bring	O
some	O
"	O
relief	O
"	O
on	O
the	O
line	O
of	O
O	B-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
N*	I-Code_Block
<num_distict_factors>	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block
,	O
but	O
again	O
if	O
<num_distict_factors>	B-Code_Block
==	I-Code_Block
N	I-Code_Block
(	O
all	O
primes	O
)	O
,	O
then	O
it	O
is	O
still	O
O(N*N)	O

:	O
40689342	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/40689342/	O

If	O
you	O
are	O
willing	O
to	O
get	O
into	O
factorization	O
,	O
one	O
could	O
traverse	O
the	O
list	B-Data_Structure
,	O
once	O
from	O
the	O
left	O
,	O
factoring	O
each	O
number	O
,	O
hashing	O
the	O
index	O
of	O
each	O
new	O
prime	O
(	O
with	O
the	O
prime	O
as	O
the	O
key	O
)	O
,	O
updating	O
the	O
index	O
of	O
each	O
prime	O
already	O
seen	O
,	O
and	O
,	O
of	O
course	O
,	O
noting	O
the	O
nearest	O
seen	O
prime	O
.	O

Since	O
this	O
traversal	O
would	O
miss	O
the	O
nearest	O
on	O
the	O
right	O
,	O
conduct	O
another	O
traversal	O
from	O
the	O
right	O
to	O
update	O
any	O
nearer	O
shared	O
prime	O
,	O
using	O
the	O
factor	O
lists	B-Data_Structure
already	O
saved	O
.	O

24842192	O

When	O
you	O
save	O
the	O
file	O
in	O
Notepad	O
,	O
the	O
file	O
is	O
reencoded	O
to	O
be	O
saved	O
as	O
your	O
default	O
file	O
encoding	O
for	O
your	O
Windows	O
installation	O
.	O

Notepad	O
auto-detected	O
the	O
encoding	O
when	O
it	O
opened	O
the	O
file	O
,	O
however	O
.	O

Python	O
opens	O
file	O
using	O
that	O
same	O
system	O
encoding	O
,	O
by	O
default	O
,	O
which	O
is	O
why	O
you	O
can	O
now	O
open	O
the	O
file	O
.	O

Quoting	O
the	O
open()	O
function	O
documentation	O
:	O

You	O
'll	O
have	O
to	O
explicitly	O
specify	O
the	O
correct	O
encoding	O
for	O
the	O
file	O
if	O
you	O
wanted	O
to	O
open	O
it	O
directly	O
in	O
Python	O
:	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block

code	I-Code_Block

annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

I	O
used	O
'	O
utf-8-sig	O
'	O
as	O
an	O
example	O
here	O
,	O
as	O
that	O
is	O
a	O
file	O
encoding	O
that	O
Notepad	O
can	O
auto-detect	O
.	O

It	O
could	O
well	O
be	O
that	O
the	O
encoding	O
is	O
UTF-16	O
or	O
plain	O
UTF-8	O
or	O
any	O
number	O
of	O
other	O
encodings	O
,	O
however	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
think	O
that	O
the	O
page	O
is	O
encoded	O
with	O
a	O
specific	O
ANSI	O
codepage	O
you	O
still	O
have	O
to	O
name	O
the	O
exact	O
codepage	O
.	O

Your	O
system	O
is	O
configured	O
to	O
use	O
code	O
page	O
936	O
(	O
GBK	O
)	O
but	O
that	O
is	O
not	O
the	O
correct	O
encoding	O
for	O
this	O
file	O
.	O

See	O
the	O
codecs	B-Library
module	O
for	O
a	O
list	O
of	O
supported	O
encodings	O
.	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
Q_5581	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block

for	I-Code_Block

)	I-Code_Block

Clearly	O
I	O
have	O
all	O

information	O
I	O

in	O

cases	O
.	O

My	O

is	O
that	O
Scrapy	B-Library
first	O
converts	O
this	O
Request	O
into	O
Twisted	B-Library
object	O
,	O

headers	O
and	O
body	O

.	O

,	O
but	O
write	O
to	O
a	O
string	O

?	O

following	O
code	O
to	O

1.0	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
Q_5582	I-Code_Block

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
43565672	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/43565672/	O

As	O
scrapy	B-Library
is	O
open	O
source	O
and	O
also	O
has	O
plenty	O
of	O
extension	O
points	O
,	O
this	O
should	O
be	O
doable	O
.	O

The	O
requests	O
are	O
finally	O
assembled	O
and	O
sent	O
out	O
in	O
scrapy/core/downloader/handlers/http11.py	B-File_Name
in	O
ScrapyAgent.download_request	O
(	O
https://github.com/scrapy/scrapy/blob/master/scrapy/core/downloader/handlers/http11.py#L270	O
)	O

If	O
you	O
place	O
your	O
hook	O
there	O
you	O
can	O
dump	O
the	O
request	O
type	O
,	O
request	O
headers	O
,	O
and	O
request	O
body	O
.	O

To	O
place	O
your	O
code	O
there	O
you	O
can	O
either	O
try	O
monkey	O
patching	O
ScrapyAgent.download_request	O
or	O
to	O
subclass	O
ScrapyAgent	O
to	O
do	O
the	O
request	O
logging	O
,	O
then	O
subclass	O
HTTP11DownloadHandler	O
to	O
use	O
your	O
Scrapy	B-Library
Agent	O
and	O
then	O
set	O
HTTP11DownloadHandler	O
as	O
new	O
DOWNLOAD_HANDLER	O
for	O
http	O
/	O
https	O
requests	O
in	O
your	O
project	O
's	O
settings.py	B-File_Name
(	O
for	O
details	O
see	O
:	O
https://doc.scrapy.org/en/latest/topics/settings.html#download-handlers	O
)	O

In	O
my	O
opinion	O
this	O
is	O
the	O
closest	O
you	O
can	O
get	O
to	O
logging	O
the	O
requests	O
going	O
out	O
without	O
using	O
a	O
packet	O
sniffer	O
or	O
a	O
logging	O
proxy	O
(	O
which	O
might	O
be	O
a	O
bit	O
overkill	O
for	O
your	O
scenario	O
)	O
.	O

:	O

:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/36118227/	O

the	O

"	O

to	O

,	O
width	O
or	O
height	O

of	O

You	O
draw	O
the	O
circle	B-User_Interface_Element
on	O
the	O
screen	B-User_Interface_Element
surface	O
.	O

Every	O
drawing	O
function	O
then	O
returns	O
a	O
Rect	O
,	O
but	O
:	O

To	O
actually	O
change	O
the	O
circle	B-User_Interface_Element
on	O
the	O
screen	B-User_Interface_Element
,	O
you	O
have	O
to	O
erase	O
it	O
first	O
(	O
draw	O
something	O
above	O
it	O
)	O
,	O
then	O
draw	O
a	O
new	O
circle	B-User_Interface_Element
in	O
the	O
size	O
you	O
want	O
.	O

Here	O
's	O
a	O
simple	O
example	O
:	O

:	I-Code_Block

:	I-Code_Block

)	I-Code_Block

Your	O
code	O
creates	O
the	O
coordinates	O
of	O
the	O
new	O
vertices	O
in	O
V	O
such	O
that	O

vertices	O
,	O

then	O

vertices	O
.	O

the	O
indices	O
of	O
these	O
vertices	O
.	O

new	O
indices	O
start	O
from	O
size(S.vertices)+1	B-Code_Block
and	O
there	O
are	O
a	O
total	O
of	O
3*size(S.faces)	B-Code_Block
of	O
them	O
.	O

's	O
also	O
group	O
the	O
new	O
vertices	O
for	O
a	O
each	O
existing	O
face	O
together	O
.	O

say	O
your	O

a	O

:	O

:	O
6101805	O

Question_URL	O

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/6101805/	O

This	O
is	O
a	O
multi	O
threaded	O
scenario	O
.	O

The	O
main	O
thread	O
handles	O
the	O
application	O
and	O
UI	O
events	O
,	O
and	O
it	O
starts	O
up	O
a	O
new	O
thread	O
to	O
do	O
some	O
background	O
operations	O
.	O

The	O
"	O
background	O
"	O
thread	O
loads	O
the	O
data	O
from	O
files	O
into	O
a	O
data-table	O
of	O
a	O
strongly-typed	O
dataset	O
.	O

The	O
DataGridView	O
is	O
bound	O
to	O
that	O
DataTable	O
.	O

Once	O
the	O
data	O
is	O
ready	O
,	O
the	O
"	O
background	O
"	O
thread	O
invokes	O
the	O
refresh()	O
function	O
of	O
the	O
DataGridView	O
on	O
the	O
form	O
.	O

If	O
there	O
are	O
more	O
lines	O
then	O
what	O
fits	O
on	O
one	O
screen	O
and	O
the	O
vertical	B-User_Interface_Element
scrollbar	I-User_Interface_Element
is	O
to	O
appear	O
:	O
the	O
grid	B-User_Interface_Element
crashes	O
.	O

The	O
new	O
datalines	B-User_Interface_Element
are	O
always	O
displayed	O
.	O

Error	O
only	O
occurs	O
if	O
there	O
are	O
enough	O
lines	O
to	O
display	O
the	O
scrollbar	B-User_Interface_Element
(	O
see	O
image	B-User_Interface_Element
below	O
)	O
.	O

I	O
use	O
.NET	B-Library
3.5	O
.	O

In	O
Windows	O
XP	O
it	O
crashes	O
the	O
whole	O
application	O
.	O

On	O
Win	O
7	O
(	O
64	O
bit	O
)	O
only	O
the	O
grid	B-User_Interface_Element
becomes	O
unresponsive	O
,	O
but	O
once	O
I	O
resize	O
the	O
window	B-User_Interface_Element
the	O
scrollbar	B-User_Interface_Element
appears	O
and	O
all	O
is	O
fine	O
.	O

The	O
relevant	O
parts	O
of	O
the	O
code	O
are	O
attached	O
below	O
.	O

Grid	O
refresh	O
operation	O
in	O
the	O
form	O
's	O
.cs	O
file	O
:	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
6101805	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/6101805/	O

I	O
'm	O
guessing	O
the	O
problem	O
has	O
to	O
do	O
with	O
how	O
WinForms	B-Library
works	O
inside	O
the	O
STA	O
model	O
for	O
threading	O
.	O

Basically	O
,	O
the	O
DataTable	O
you	O
're	O
accessing	O
is	O
located	O
somewhere	O
,	O
and	O
that	O
is	O
probably	O
inside	O
the	O
form	O
we	O
see	O
above	O
.	O

So	O
,	O
when	O
you	O
update	O
the	O
DataTable	O
from	O
another	O
thread	O
,	O
which	O
thread	O
gets	O
the	O
events	O
needed	O
for	O
binding	O
?	O

Likely	O
the	O
thread	O
you	O
update	O
it	O
from	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
form	O
's	O
thread	O
is	O
not	O
aware	O
of	O
the	O
changes	O
being	O
made	O
.	O

So	O
,	O
you	O
simply	O
need	O
to	O
invoke	O
any	O
calls	O
to	O
DataTable	O
onto	O
the	O
form	O
itself	O
,	O
so	O
it	O
receives	O
the	O
events	O
properly	O
:	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_683	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

It	O
seems	O
backwards	O
,	O
but	O
keep	O
in	O
mind	O
in	O
an	O
"	O
enterprise	O
"	O
situation	O
,	O
you	O
'd	O
probably	O
be	O
accessing	O
that	O
dataset	O
by	O
multiple	O
adapters	O
.	O

So	O
,	O
your	O
update	O
thread	O
would	O
have	O
an	O
adapter	O
to	O
itself	O
,	O
and	O
your	O
GUI	O
would	O
have	O
its	O
own	O
also	O
.	O

The	O
other	O
solution	O
would	O
be	O
to	O
use	O
a	O
BindingList	O
,	O
which	O
I	O
believe	O
has	O
thread	O
compatibility	O
for	O
this	O
type	O
of	O
situation	O
,	O
but	O
do	O
n't	O
quote	O
me	O
on	O
that	O
.	O

For	O
extra	O
credit	O
,	O
this	O
could	O
also	O
explain	O
your	O
problem	O
before	O
with	O
crashing	O
.	O

By	O
accessing	O
the	O
DataGridView	O
from	O
the	O
background	O
thread	O
,	O
you	O
had	O
cross-thread	O
operations	O
going	O
on	O
.	O

:	O

)	I-Code_Block

will	O

longer	O

.	O

Question_ID	O

I	O
understand	O
that	O
a	O
service	O
can	O
run	O
in	O
two	O
modes	O
,	O
started	O
and	O
bound	O
.	O

What	O
I	O
do	O
n't	O
quite	O
understand	O
from	O
the	O
developer	O
docs	O
or	O
other	O
questions	O
on	O
this	O
site	O
,	O
is	O
whether	O
a	O
service	O
running	O
as	O
both	O
started	O
and	O
bound	O
will	O
exit	O
when	O
the	O
last	O
component	O
unbinds	O
from	O
it	O
?	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
5388915	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/5388915/	O

If	O
something	O
called	O
startService()	O
on	O
the	O
Service	O
,	O
it	O
will	O
remain	O
running	O
,	O
regardless	O
of	O
what	O
bindService()	O
and	O
unbindService()	O
calls	O
may	O
have	O
gone	O
on	O
.	O

Eventually	O
,	O
Android	O
will	O
stop	O
the	O
service	O
,	O
or	O
the	O
user	O
will	O
kill	O
the	O
service	O
,	O
but	O
neither	O
will	O
happen	O
immediately	O
upon	O
the	O
last	O
unbindService()	O
.	O

you	O
want	O
to	O
check	O
if	O
they	O

your	O

column	B-User_Interface_Element
from	O
editing	O

hide	O
the	O
column	B-User_Interface_Element

anyone	O
tries	O
to	O

or	O

will	O

this	O
.	O

the	O
only	O

you	O
will	O
detect	O
with	O
be	O
the	O
editing	O
of	O
a	O
cell	B-User_Interface_Element
or	O
group	O
of	O
cells	B-User_Interface_Element
.	O

this	O
there	O
is	O
specific	O
way	O
to	O
tell	O
whether	O
a	O
row	O
has	O
been	O
deleted	O
or	O
inserted	O
.	O

that	O
has	O

Alternative	O
would	O
be	O
to	O
work	O
with	O
properties	O
DataGrid	O
already	O
provides	O
to	O
you	O
and/or	O
to	O
define	O
few	O
other	O
attached	O
properties	O
supporting	O
you	O
to	O
get	O
the	O
job	O
done	O
.	O

I	O
would	O
try	O
to	O
work	O
with	O
properties	O
like	O
SelectedItem	O
,	O
SelectedValue	O
,	O
CurrentItem	O
,	O
CurrentCell	O
.	O

Futhermore	O
if	O
a	O
behavior	O
couldnt	O
be	O
handled	O
with	O
those	O
properties	O
from	O
above	O
I	O
would	O
create	O
an	O
attached	O
property	O
and	O
use	O
a	O
style	O
for	O
cells	B-User_Interface_Element
with	O
triggers	O
changing	O
the	O
attached	O
property	O
.	O

Binding	O
will	O
transmit	O
all	O
the	O
changes	O
from	O
the	O
attached	O
property	O
to	O
the	O
ViewModel	O
.	O

In	O
the	O
end	O
you	O
will	O
have	O
just	O
communication	O
between	O
ViewModel	O
and	O
View	O
.	O

Here	O
are	O
few	O
links	O
:	O

http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.windows.controls.datagrid%28v=vs.110%29.aspx	O

http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.windows.controls.datagrid.currentitem%28v=vs.110%29.aspx	O

http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.windows.controls.primitives.selector.selectedvalue%28v=vs.110%29.aspx	O

http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.windows.controls.primitives.selector.selecteditem%28v=vs.110%29.aspx	O

They	O
should	O
be	O
all	O
bindable	O

Edit	O
:	O

http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.windows.data.multibinding%28v=vs.110%29.aspx	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
20283105	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/20283105/	O

The	O
general	O
way	O
to	O
achieve	O
your	O
requirement	O
is	O
to	O
implement	O
an	O
ICommand	O
type	O
Attached	O
Property	O
for	O
each	O
event	O
that	O
you	O
want	O
to	O
replace	O
.	O

The	O
basic	O
idea	O
is	O
this.	O
.	O
add	O
an	O
ICommand	O
Attached	O
Property	O
with	O
a	O
PropertyChangedCallback	O
handler	O
.	O

In	O
this	O
handler	O
(	O
which	O
will	O
be	O
called	O
when	O
an	O
ICommand	O
is	O
data	O
bound	O
to	O
this	O
property	O
)	O
,	O
attach	O
a	O
handler	O
to	O
the	O
event	O
that	O
you	O
want	O
to	O
handle	O
.	O

Then	O
,	O
when	O
that	O
event	O
is	O
called	O
,	O
just	O
execute	O
the	O
ICommand	O
instance	O
.	O

So	O
you	O
can	O
handle	O
the	O
event	O
in	O
your	O
view	O
model	O
via	O
the	O
ICommand	O
instance	O
.	O

Here	O
is	O
an	O
example	O
using	O
the	O
PreviewKeyDown	O
event	O
:	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_2705	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

@Value	O
has	O
got	O
the	O
correct	O
value	O
when	O
used	O
in	O
insert	O
statement	O
.	O

But	O
,	O
@AID	O
(	O
which	O
is	O
set	O
to	O
@Value	O
)	O
always	O
gives	O
0	O
when	O
this	O
stored	O
procedure	O
is	O
called	O
using	O
php	O
.	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
Q_3488	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

What	O
am	O
I	O
doing	O
wrong	O
here	O

)	I-Code_Block

right	O

You	O
're	O
using	O
fancy	O
quotes	O
in	O
your	O
assignment	O
of	O
export_folder_path	B-Code_Block
.	O

These	O
slanted	O
Unicode	O
quotes	O
are	O
not	O
recognized	O
as	O
quotes	O
by	O
bash	O
,	O
and	O
are	O
therefore	O
treated	O
as	O
literals	O
.	O

This	O
is	O
usually	O
due	O
to	O
copypasting	O
from	O
blogs	O
,	O
or	O
using	O
an	O
editor	O
or	O
OS	O
not	O
intended	O
for	O
programmers	O
such	O
as	O
Word	O
or	O
macOS	O
.	O

Replace	O
them	O
with	O
regular	O
ASCII	O
double	O
quotes	O
in	O
your	O
script	O
,	O
and	O
disable	O
"	O
smart	O
quotes	O
"	O
in	O
your	O
editor	O
or	O
OS	O
.	O

Question_ID	O
:	O
10116412	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/10116412/	O

Had	O
a	O
bit	O
of	O
a	O
"	O
is	O
this	O
real	O
life	O
moment	O
"	O
.	O

Why	O
are	O
we	O
naming	O
mutators	O
with	O
get	O
and	O
set	O
prefixes	O
:	O

It	O
would	O
just	O
as	O
easy	O
and	O
understandable	O
to	O
just	O
do	O

myMember	O
(	O
myMember	O
Member	O
)	O

as	O
setMyMember	O
and	O
getMyMember	O

Is	O
there	O
a	O
historical	O
reason	O
why	O
Java	O
has	O
this	O
style	O
?	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
10116412	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/10116412/	O

The	O
get*	O
and	O
set*	O
style	O
of	O
naming	O
is	O
specified	O
in	O
the	O
JavaBeans	O
specification	O
,	O
and	O
some	O
libraries	O
using	O
reflection	O
expect	O
this	O
style	O
to	O
be	O
used	O
.	O

For	O
example	O
,	O
Jackson	O
mapper	O
can	O
serialize	O
a	O
java	O
object	O
using	O
the	O
get/setters	O
to	O
JSON	O
without	O
any	O
additional	O
annotations	O
;	O
if	O
you	O
use	O
a	O
different	O
naming	O
style	O
,	O
you	O
have	O
to	O
tell	O
it	O
where	O
your	O
properties	O
are	O
.	O

Note	O
that	O
some	O
other	O
programming	O
languages	O
use	O
different	O
styles	O
.	O

Perl	O
libraries	O
,	O
for	O
example	O
,	O
often	O
use	O
a	O
->someProperty()	O
getter	O
and	O
->someProperty($newValue)	O
setter	O
.	O

Question_ID	O
:	O
49096137	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/49096137/	O

I	O
am	O
following	O
the	O

example	O

the	O

configurations	O
and	O
tile	O
sources	O
as	O
mentioned	O
in	O
the	O
example	O
.	O

am	O
now	O

on	O

should	O

I	O

to	O

that	O

into	O

.	O

either	O

,	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block

(	I-Code_Block

for	I-Code_Block

=	I-Code_Block
"	I-Code_Block

"	I-Code_Block

Question_ID	O
:	O
22814259	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/22814259/	O

In	O
our	O
application	O
we	O
have	O
a	O
few	O
GDI+	B-Library
objects	O
that	O
are	O
used	O
often	O
in	O
many	O
different	O
contexts	O
.	O

This	O
includes	O
some	O
instances	O
of	O
Font	O
,	O
SolidBrush	O
(	O
White	O
,	O
Black.	O
.	O
)	O
,	O
some	O
Pen.	O
.	O

For	O
those	O
objects	O
our	O
strategy	O
so	O
far	O
has	O
been	O
to	O
hold	O
them	O
through	O
widely	O
visible	O
static	O
read-only	O
fields	O
.	O

This	O
avoids	O
to	O
create/dispose	O
them	O
millions	O
of	O
time	O
.	O

We	O
took	O
care	O
of	O
thread-safety	O
accesses	O
on	O
these	O
object	O
of	O
course	O
(	O
they	O
are	O
just	O
accessed	O
from	O
the	O
UI	O
thread	O
basically	O
)	O
.	O

There	O
are	O
just	O
a	O
few	O
of	O
these	O
GDI+	B-Library
objects	O
hold	O
for	O
the	O
lifetime	O
of	O
the	O
application	O
,	O
say	O
like	O
200	O
.	O

The	O
others	O
GDI+	B-Library
objects	O
(	O
the	O
ones	O
with	O
short-life	O
)	O
are	O
all	O
disposed	O
asap	O
.	O

But	O
we	O
sometime	O
get	O
unexpected	O
GDI+	B-Library
resources	O
outage	O
exception	O
,	O
hopefully	O
rarely	O
enough	O
.	O

I	O
am	O
wondering	O
if	O
these	O
exceptions	O
could	O
come	O
from	O
these	O
few	O
GDI+	B-Library
objects	O
hold	O
,	O
and	O
if	O
this	O
would	O
be	O
a	O
wiser	O
strategy	O
to	O
create/dispose	O
tons	O
of	O
short-life	O
GDI+	B-Library
objects	O
instead	O
.	O

Does	O
anybody	O
have	O
real-world	O
experience	O
and	O
relevant	O
conclusions	O
about	O
theses	O
two	O
strategies	O
?	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
22814259	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/22814259/	O

Caching	O
System.Drawing	O
objects	O
is	O
a	O
mistake	O
.	O

They	O
are	O
very	O
cheap	O
to	O
create	O
,	O
very	O
expensive	O
to	O
keep	O
around	O
.	O

They	O
are	O
allocated	O
on	O
a	O
special	O
heap	B-Data_Structure
that	O
all	O
processes	O
on	O
a	O
desktop	O
need	O
to	O
share	O
.	O

The	O
heap	B-Data_Structure
size	O
is	O
limited	O
to	O
65535	O
objects	O
.	O

Creating	O
objects	O
like	O
a	O
brush	O
or	O
a	O
pen	O
takes	O
roughly	O
a	O
microsecond	O
,	O
miniscule	O
compared	O
to	O
the	O
cost	O
of	O
the	O
operation	O
you	O
perform	O
with	O
them	O
.	O

The	O
only	O
drawing	O
object	O
that	O
is	O
expensive	O
is	O
a	O
Font	O
.	O

Creating	O
one	O
involves	O
a	O
sizable	O
chunk	O
of	O
overhead	O
taken	O
by	O
the	O
font	O
mapper	O
.	O

But	O
that	O
's	O
already	O
solved	O
by	O
.NET	B-Library
,	O
it	O
caches	O
them	O
.	O

Other	O
than	O
hogging	O
the	O
heap	B-Data_Structure
needlessly	O
,	O
the	O
programming	O
style	O
is	O
dangerous	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
far	O
too	O
easy	O
to	O
forget	O
blindly	O
applying	O
the	O
using	O
statement	O
.	O

This	O
certainly	O
can	O
get	O
you	O
into	O
trouble	O
,	O
you	O
are	O
relying	O
on	O
the	O
finalizer	O
thread	O
to	O
release	O
them	O
again	O
.	O

If	O
a	O
program	O
involves	O
lots	O
of	O
heavy	O
painting	O
but	O
not	O
enough	O
object	O
allocation	O
to	O
trigger	O
a	O
GC	O
then	O
you	O
will	O
exhaust	O
the	O
quota	O
for	O
GDI	B-Library
objects	O
.	O

Which	O
is	O
10,000	O
objects	O
for	O
a	O
process	O
by	O
default	O
.	O

This	O
will	O
crash	O
your	O
program	O
.	O

Do	O
note	O
that	O
the	O
System.Drawing	O
class	O
wrappers	O
are	O
not	O
nearly	O
big	O
enough	O
to	O
trigger	O
a	O
GC	O
by	O
themselves	O
,	O
10000	O
of	O
them	O
will	O
not	O
be	O
enough	O
to	O
get	O
the	O
finalizers	O
to	O
run	O
and	O
release	O
the	O
handles	O
again	O
.	O

The	O
problem	O
is	O
very	O
easy	O
to	O
diagnose	O
,	O
you	O
can	O
use	O
Task	O
Manager	O
.	O

Use	O
View	O
+	O
Select	O
Columns	B-User_Interface_Element
and	O
tick	O
"	O
GDI	O
Objects	O
"	O
.	O

Might	O
as	O
well	O
tick	O
"	O
USER	O
Objects	O
"	O
,	O
another	O
one	O
that	O
's	O
very	O
easily	O
leaked	O
.	O

Keep	O
an	O

on	O
the	O
displayed	O
counts	O
for	O
your	O
process	O

you	O
are	O

it	O
.	O

A	O

number	O
spells	O
doom	O
.	O

When	O

this	O

to	O
be	O
the	O
"	O
standard	O
"	O
.	O

Then	O
I	O

to	O
abstract	O
classes	O
because	O
they	O
seem	O
better	O
suited	O
to	O
the	O

at	O
hand	O
.	O

.	O

?	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
2130150	O

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/2130150/	O

If	O
your	O
interface	O
also	O
has	O
reasonable	O
default	O
behavior	O
for	O
at	O
least	O
some	O
of	O
the	O
functionality	O
,	O
you	O
may	O
want	O
to	O
use	O
an	O
abstract	O
class	O
to	O
avoid	O
common	O
boilerplate	O
code	O
in	O
all	O
of	O
the	O
concrete	O
implementations	O
.	O

Otherwise	O
,	O
use	O
an	O
interface	O
.	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
2130150	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/2130150/	O

I	O
find	O
the	O
best	O
option	O
most	O
of	O
the	O
time	O
is	O
to	O
do	O
both	O
.	O

That	O
is	O
not	O
always	O
possible	O
when	O
you	O
are	O
relying	O
on	O
something	O
happening	O
in	O
the	O
base	O
class	O
.	O

Providing	O
both	O
an	O
abstract	O
base	O
class	O
and	O
an	O
interface	O
allows	O
the	O
greatest	O
latitude	O
by	O
implementers	O
of	O
your	O
abstraction	O
,	O
again	O
,	O
as	O
long	O
as	O
you	O
do	O
n't	O
require	O
something	O
happens	O
by	O
an	O
implementer	O
of	O
the	O
interface	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
require	O
that	O
something	O
happens	O
,	O
then	O
you	O
do	O
n't	O
want	O
to	O
provide	O
an	O
interface	O
at	O
all--and	O
you	O
would	O
also	O
need	O
to	O
make	O
sure	O
that	O
your	O
base	O
class	O
ensures	O
this	O
required	O
action	O
to	O
ALWAYS	O
occur	O
..	O
.	O

Negative	O
to	O
doing	O
both	O
:	O
more	O
goo	O
.	O

example	O
pseudocode	O
:	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_209	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

Note	O
that	O
in	O
this	O
example	O
,	O
someone	O
could	O
make	O
their	O
own	O
class	O
that	O

and	O
then	O
pass	O
it	O
to	O
anything	O
that	O
takes	O
an	O
IVehicle	O
.	O

That	O
object	O
would	O
NOT	O
need	O
to	O
be	O
a	O
child	O
of	O
the	O
Vehicle	O
abstract	O
class	O
.	O

If	O
,	O
therefore	O
,	O
you	O
were	O
to	O
expect	O
something	O
specific	O
to	O
happen	O
in	O
the	O

method	O

's	O
quite	O
likely	O
that	O
that	O
new	O
class	O
would	O
NOT	O
fulfill	O
that	O
expectation	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
as	O
long	O
as	O
it	O
never	O
matters	O
what	O
implementations	O
of	O
IVehicle	O
do	O
,	O
then	O
it	O
's	O
the	O
most	O
flexible	O
abstraction	O
to	O
have	O
both	O
an	O
abstract	O
base	O
class	O
AND	O
an	O
interface	O
.	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
28026848	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/28026848/	O

Your	O
NSURLConnection	O
's	O
callbacks	O
are	O
happening	O
on	O
the	O
main	O
queue	B-Data_Structure
.	O

This	O
is	O
one	O
reason	O
your	O
application	O
is	O
locking	O
up	O
.	O

Your	O
managed	O
object	O
context	O
,	O
at	O
least	O
in	O
the	O
code	O
you	O
have	O
posted	O
,	O
is	O
not	O
following	O
the	O
Core	B-Library
Data	I-Library
concurrency	O
rules	O
.	O

You	O
have	O
a	O
choice	O
between	O
thread	O
confinement	O
(	O
unfortunately	O
,	O
the	O
default	O
,	O
which	O
is	O
obsolete	O
)	O
,	O
and	O
queue	B-Data_Structure
confinement	O
.	O

With	O
thread	O
confinement	O
,	O
you	O
can	O
only	O
use	O
a	O
managed	O
object	O
context	O
from	O
the	O
thread	O
where	O
it	O
was	O
created	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
created	O
your	O
managed	O
object	O
context	O
on	O
the	O
main	O
thread	O
(	O
or	O
queue	B-Data_Structure
)	O
,	O
you	O
can	O
only	O
use	O
it	O
from	O
there	O
-	O
so	O
any	O
Core	B-Library
Data	I-Library
operation	O
you	O
perform	O
on	O
that	O
context	O
will	O
block	O
the	O
main	O
thread	O
,	O
and	O
in	O
turn	O
the	O
UI	O
.	O

Using	O
queue	B-Data_Structure
confinement	O
(	O
almost	O
)	O
any	O
operation	O
on	O
the	O
managed	O
object	O
context	O
must	O
go	O
through	O
either	O
the	O
performBlock	O
:	O
or	O
performBlockAndWait	O
:	O
methods	O
.	O

The	O
enqueued	O
block	O
is	O
executed	O
on	O
the	O
context	O
's	O
serial	O
queue	B-Data_Structure
.	O

Typically	O
this	O
would	O
be	O
done	O
using	O
an	O
NSFetchedResultsController	O
,	O
which	O
observes	O
a	O
managed	O
object	O
context	O
for	O
changes	O
relevant	O
to	O
it	O
's	O
fetch	O
request	O
.	O

Once	O
the	O
initial	O
fetch	O
populates	O
the	O
controller	O
it	O
will	O
listen	O
for	O
changes	O
to	O
the	O
context	O
that	O
affect	O
the	O
objects	O
specified	O
by	O
the	O
fetch	O
request	O
.	O

When	O
relevant	O
changes	O
occur	O
the	O
controller	O
informs	O
it	O
's	O
delegate	O
through	O
callbacks	O
.	O

iPad	O

will	O

the	O

.	O

to	O
the	O
original	O
by	O
calling	O

:	O
on	O
the	O
new	O

.	O

using	O
the	O

can	O
set	O
up	O

transition	O
there	O
and	O
the	O
perform	O

-	O
performSegueWithIdentifier:sender	O
:	O
from	O
your	O
button	B-User_Interface_Element
.	O

that	O

the	O
segue	O
directly	O

will	O

code	O
.	O

Couple	O
things	O
.	O

This	O
is	O
a	O
bug	O
in	O
the	O
android	O
build	O
tools	O
that	O
they	O
have	O
fixed	O
.	O

Hooray	O
!	O

You	O
do	O
n't	O
have	O
to	O
apply	O
the	O
jacoco	B-Library
plugin	O
,	O
it	O
is	O
part	O
of	O
the	O
android	O
gradle	O
plugin	O
.	O

All	O
you	O
need	O
is	O
'	O
testCoverageEnabled	B-Code_Block
true	I-Code_Block
'	O
and	O
it	O
will	O
create	O
your	O
.ec	O
file	O
.	O

Applying	O
the	O
plugin	O
does	O
n't	O
hurt	O
as	O
far	O
as	O
I	O
know	O
,	O
but	O
it	O
's	O
helpful	O
to	O
get	O
your	O
mind	O
around	O
the	O
fact	O
that	O
jacoco	B-Library
is	O
in	O
there	O
already	O
.	O

The	O
override	O
for	O
'	O
reportsDir	O
'	O
might	O
not	O
work	O
,	O
so	O
you	O
should	O
also	O
look	O
for	O
your	O
report	O
in	O
'	O
build/outputs/reports/coverage/debug/index.html	O
'	O
.	O

element	O

:	O
exposed	O
as	O

property	O
in	O
the	O
viewer	O
.	O

type	O
?	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
2551073	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/2551073/	O

The	O
PersistentGenericSet	O
is	O
part	O
of	O
NHibernate	B-Library
(	O
used	O
to	O
track	O
changes	O
in	O
collections	O
)	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
ISet	O
interface	O
and	O
classes	O
from	O
Iesi.Collections	B-Library
,	O
which	O
was	O
used	O
to	O
fill	O
a	O
gap	O
in	O
the	O
.Net	B-Library
framework	O
as	O
there	O
is	O
n't	O
a	O
Set	O
type	O
.	O

I	O
guess	O
that	O
WCF	B-Library
has	O
a	O
problem	O
serializing	O
this	O
type	O
.	O

A	O
quick	O
fix	O
is	O
to	O
change	O
your	O
NHibernate	B-Library
mappings	O
to	O
use	O
a	O
Bag	O
instead	O
of	O
a	O
Set	O
.	O

Then	O
you	O
can	O
use	O
a	O
normal	O
IList	O
<T>	O
instead	O
of	O
Set<T>	O
in	O
your	O
classes	O
w	O
.	O

A	O
better	O
solution	O
is	O
to	O
create	O
a	O
remote	O
facade	O
which	O
sends	O
DTOs	O
to	O
your	O
WCF	B-Library
endpoints	O
.	O

This	O
will	O
allow	O
you	O
to	O
keep	O
the	O
interface	O
of	O
your	O
internal	O
types	O
separate	O
from	O
those	O
exposed	O
as	O
remote	O
services	O
.	O

Jimmy	O
Bogards	O
Automapper	B-Library
is	O
a	O
great	O
tool	O
which	O
will	O
help	O
with	O
the	O
mapping	O
process	O
.	O

Edit	O

After	O
re-reading	O
the	O
problem	O
I	O
had	O
a	O
look	O
around	O
the	O
and	O
came	O
across	O
this	O
article	O
which	O
describes	O
a	O
workaround	O
for	O
sending	O
NHibernate	B-Library
collections	O
over	O
WCF	B-Library
.	O

David	O
Brion	O
has	O
written	O
a	O
good	O
follow	O
up	O
article	O
.	O

:	O

:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/16434254/	O

I	O
have	O
an	O
installer	O
created	O
using	O
Installshield	O
2012	O
that	O
depends	O
greatly	O
on	O
the	O
value	O
of	O
a	O
Registry	O
key	O
written	O
by	O
some	O
other	O
application	O
developed	O
in-house	O
.	O

I	O
use	O
RegDBGetKeyValueEx	O
Installscript	B-Library
API	I-Library
to	O
fetch	O
the	O
value	O
.	O

This	O
value	O
is	O
a	O
directory	O
path	O
guaranteed	O
to	O
have	O
a	O

backslash	O
.	O

This	O
value	O
serves	O
as	O

my	O

.	O

I	O

.	O

which	O
wrongly	O

.	O

may	O
find	O
the	O

of	O

.	O

16434254	O

In	O
some	O
code	O
pages	O
the	O
currency	O
symbol	O
is	O
the	O
same	O
byte	O
value	O
in	O
ASCII	O
as	O
the	O
backslash	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
're	O
using	O
Unicode	O
functions	O
this	O
should	O
n't	O
be	O
an	O
issue	O
though	O
.	O

See	O
http://www.siao2.com/2005/09/17/469941.aspx	O
for	O
more	O
information	O
.	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
16434254	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/16434254/	O

When	O
assigning	O
the	O
Registry	O
data	O
to	O
your	O
m_reqPath	O
variable	O
,	O
you	O
are	O
treating	O
it	O
as	O
null-terminated	O
character	O
data	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
string	O
data	O
read	O
by	O
RegQueryValueEx()	O
is	O
not	O
guaranteed	O
to	O
be	O
null-terminated	O
,	O
if	O
the	O
original	O
writer	O
of	O
the	O
data	O
did	O
not	O
include	O
one	O
.	O

This	O
is	O
clearly	O
stated	O
in	O
the	O
documentation	O
.	O

Chances	O
are	O
that	O
the	O
string	O
data	O
you	O
are	O
reading	O
from	O
the	O
Registry	O
is	O
not	O
null-terminated	O
,	O
so	O
you	O
end	O
up	O
copying	O
random	O
data	O
from	O
the	O
end	O
of	O
your	O
buffer	O
.	O

To	O
account	O
for	O
that	O
possibility	O
,	O
you	O
need	O
to	O
allocate	O
extra	O
space	O
in	O
your	O
buffer	O
and	O
put	O
your	O
own	O
null	O
terminator	O
at	O
the	O
end	O
of	O
whatever	O
data	O
you	O
actually	O
read	O
.	O

If	O
the	O
data	O
is	O
properly	O
null	O
terminated	O
,	O
then	O
your	O
terminator	O
will	O
simply	O
be	O
redundant	O
.	O

You	O
are	O
also	O
leaking	O
the	O
opened	O
Registry	O
key	O
handle	O
if	O
RegOpenKeyEx()	O
succeeds	O
but	O
RegQueryValueEx()	O
fails	O
.	O

Try	O
this	O
instead	O
:	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_2123	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

To	O
avoid	O
this	O
issue	O
altogether	O
,	O
use	O
RegGetValue()	O
instead	O
,	O
which	O
deals	O
with	O
the	O
null	O
terminator	O
for	O
you	O
:	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_2124	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

Or	O
:	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_2125	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

like	O
this	O

)	I-Code_Block

method	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block

Q_3758	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block

)	I-Code_Block

n't	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
31276231	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/31276231/	O

An	O
AsyncTask	O
that	O
returns	O
nothing	O
from	O
doInBackground()	O
(	O
and	O
does	O
n't	O
communicate	O
with	O
onPostExecute()	O
via	O
private	O
members	O
)	O
is	O
always	O
suspicious	O
.	O

You	O
have	O
a	O
lot	O
of	O
side	O
effects	O
in	O
your	O
AsyncTask	O
and	O
that	O
kind	O
of	O
stuff	O
is	O
hard	O
to	O
debug	O
.	O

You	O
add	O
to	O
cityList	O
and	O
activeOrders	O
for	O
example	O
,	O
without	O
showing	O
what	O
that	O
actually	O
is	O
.	O

Presumably	O
those	O
are	O
lists	B-Data_Structure
attached	O
to	O
some	O
Adapter	O
and	O
adding	O
to	O
those	O
might	O
trigger	O
a	O
View	O
attached	O
to	O
the	O
Adapter	O
to	O
be	O
re-drawn	O
.	O

If	O
that	O
is	O
the	O
case	O
you	O
could	O
try	O
calling	O
setNotifyOnChange(false)	O
on	O
mAdapter	O
(	O
to	O
delay	O
updates	O
until	O
you	O
manually	O
call	O
notifyDataSetChanged()	O
later	O
)	O
.	O

http://developer.android.com/reference/android/widget/ArrayAdapter.html#setNotifyOnChange(boolean)	O

In	O
general	O
,	O
if	O
your	O
AsyncTask	O
does	O
n't	O
return	O
anything	O
or	O
otherwise	O
"	O
communicate	O
"	O
with	O
onPostExecute()	O
there	O
is	O
little	O
point	O
in	O
having	O
onPostExecute()	O
in	O
the	O
first	O
place	O
.	O

Even	O
better	O
would	O
be	O
not	O
to	O
have	O
any	O
side	O
effect	O
in	O
doInBackground()	O
and	O
instead	O
return	O
the	O
parsed	O
data	O
and	O
only	O
add	O
it	O
to	O
cityList	O
and	O
activeOrders	O
in	O
onPostExecute()	O
.	O

Multi-threading	O
is	O
tricky	O
and	O
AsyncTasks	O
while	O
appearing/attempting	O
to	O
make	O
it	O
easier	O
,	O
have	O
many	O
pitfalls	O
.	O

I	O
have	O
attempted	O
to	O
answer	O
a	O
question	O
on	O
thread	O
safety	O
of	O
AsyncTask	O
here	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
31276231	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/31276231/	O

I	O
do	O
n't	O
have	O
the	O
privilege	O
to	O
comment	O
,	O
so	O
I	O
'll	O
post	O
it	O
here	O
:	O

You	O
do	O
n't	O
happen	O
to	O
have	O
listeners	O
on	O
your	O
ordersDatabase	O
,	O
cityList	O
or	O
activeOrders	O
?	O

Question_ID	O
:	O
46801774	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/46801774/	O

I	O
'm	O
trying	O
to	O
write	O
a	O
RewriteRule	O
for	O
my	O
.htaccess	O
file	O
.	O

My	O
Condition	O
is	O
following	O
,	O
Force	O
All	O
user	O
on	O
my	O
website	O
to	O
HTTP	O
with	O
www	O
and	O
force	O
secure-email	O
folder	O
to	O
only	O
https	O
with	O
www	O
.	O

Any	O
ideas	O
on	O
how	O
to	O
write	O
this	O
RewriteRule	O
?	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
46801774	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/46801774/	O

You	O
can	O
use	O
something	O
similar	O
to	O
this	O
(	O
adapt	O
it	O
for	O
your	O
need	O
)	O
:	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_6799	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

FYI	O
:	O
this	O
works	O
only	O
with	O
Apache	O
version	O
>=	O
2.4	O
or	O
else	O
you	O
have	O
to	O
use	O
mod_rewrite	O

more	O
details	O
can	O
be	O
found	O
here	O
and	O
here	O
to	O
adapt	O
the	O
rules	O
above	O
.	O

But	O
I	O
highly	O
recommend	O
setting	O
all	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block

(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block

)	I-Code_Block

to	O

,	O

the	O
do	B-Code_Block

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block

)	I-Code_Block

is	O

item	O
.	O

.	O

drop	O
will	O
recognize	O
.	O

In	O
this	O
example	O
only	O
plain	O
text	O
is	O
used	O
.	O

But	O
you	O
might	O
want	O
to	O
create	O
rich	O
text	O
or	O
HTML	O
or	O
any	O
number	O
of	O
other	O
formats	O
.	O

The	O
external	O
application	O
you	O
are	O
dropping	O
on	O
must	O
be	O
registered	O
as	O
a	O
drop	O
target	O
.	O

You	O
cannot	O
force	O
the	O
other	O
app	O
to	O
respond	O
to	O
the	O
drop	O
...	O
it	O
must	O
be	O
listening	O
for	O
it	O
.	O

So	O
this	O
example	O
will	O
work	O
with	O
Word	O
and	O
Excel	O
.	O

It	O
will	O
not	O
work	O
with	O
Notepad	O
.	O

I	O
believe	O
all	O
4	O
items	O
are	O
satisfied	O
:	O

Override	O
the	O
preview	O
mouse	O
down	O
event	O
.	O

The	O
original	O
source	O
of	O
the	O
mouse	O
event	O
comes	O
from	O
the	O
data	O
grid	O
cell	B-User_Interface_Element
.	O

If	O
the	O
cell	B-User_Interface_Element
is	O
selected	O
then	O
you	O
are	O
within	O
the	O
block	O
of	O
cells	B-User_Interface_Element
that	O
is	O
selected	O
.	O

For	O
the	O
selected	O
cells	B-User_Interface_Element
,	O
gather	O
the	O
data	O
from	O
the	O
bindings	O
and	O
organize	O
into	O
a	O
grid	B-User_Interface_Element
.	O

As	O
a	O
baseline	O
use	O
plain	O
text	O
but	O
optionally	O
add	O
other	O
formats	O
as	O
well	O
.	O

Use	O
the	O
DragDrop	O
class	O
to	O
actually	O
implement	O
the	O
drag	O
and	O
drop	O
.	O

Override	O
preview	O
mouse	O
down	O
.	O

I	O
always	O

that	O

any	O

processor	O

If	O

supports	O
virtual	O
memory	O
addressing	O
,	O
each	O
process	O
has	O
a	O
unique	O
view	O
of	O
the	O
memory	O
.	O

different	O
processes	O
that	O
tries	O
to	O
read	O
from	O
the	O
same	O
memory	O
address	O
,	O
will	O
map	O
to	O
different	O
location	O
in	O
physical	O
memory	O
,	O
unless	O
the	O
memory	O
maps	O
tells	O
otherwize	O
(	O
shared	O
memory	O
,	O
like	O
DLL	O
files	O
are	O
mapped	O
read	O
only	O
like	O
this	O
for	O
instance	O
)	O

You	O
can	O
not	O
overwrite	O
a	O
blob	B-Library
store	I-Library
entity	O
,	O
only	O
delete	O
it	O
.	O

You	O
have	O
no	O
control	O
over	O
the	O
blob	O
store	O
key	O
,	O
so	O
you	O
will	O
have	O
to	O
keep/manage	O
the	O
URL	O
in	O
yourapp	O
with	O
a	O
redirect	O
to	O
the	O
current	O
blob	B-Library
store	I-Library
URL	O
.	O

As	O
for	O
writing	O
to	O
the	O
blob	B-Library
store	I-Library
,	O
have	O
a	O
look	O
at	O
the	O
file	B-Library
api	I-Library

https://developers.google.com/appengine/docs/python/blobstore/overview#Writing_Files_to_the_Blobstore	O

Sounds	O
like	O
your	O
session	O
is	O
timing	O
out	O
.	O

You	O
need	O
to	O
either	O
force	O
the	O
user	O
to	O
login	O
again	O
,	O
or	O
extend	O
your	O
session	O
timeout	O
.	O

You	O
can	O
change	O
the	O
session	O
timeout	O
by	O
editing	O
your	O
web.xml	B-File_Name
and	O
adding	O
:	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_859	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

Which	O
will	O
give	O
you	O
a	O
session	O
timeout	O
of	O
60	O
minutes	O
.	O

-1	O
means	O
there	O
is	O
no	O
timeout	O
.	O

:	O
7450608	O

Question_URL	O

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/7450608/	O

The	O
symptom	O
that	O
this	O
only	O
occurs	O
after	O
a	O
long	O
time	O
indeed	O
indicates	O
that	O
the	O
session	O
has	O
been	O
timed	O
out	O
.	O

But	O
changing	O
the	O
session	O
timeout	O
is	O
not	O
the	O
right	O
solution	O
.	O

You	O
have	O
actually	O
a	O
bug	O
in	O
your	O
JSP	B-Library
.	O

You	O
need	O
to	O
open	O
the	O
generated	O
homepage_jsp.java	B-File_Name
in	O
server	O
's	O
work	O
directory	O
and	O
head	O
to	O
line	O
107	O
and	O
finally	O
trackback	O
this	O
line	O
into	O
your	O
homepage.jsp	B-File_Name
so	O
that	O
you	O
can	O
fix	O
the	O
bug	O
.	O

Perhaps	O
you	O
need	O
to	O
do	O
a	O
request.getSession()	O
instead	O
of	O
request.getSession(false)	O
,	O
or	O
you	O
need	O
to	O
check	O
if	O
a	O
session	O
attribute	O
is	O
not	O
null	O
before	O
accessing	O
it	O
,	O
etcetera	O
.	O

There	O
were	O
a	O
number	O
of	O
libraries	O
that	O
were	O
highlighted	O
by	O
different	O
users	O
that	O
would	O
allow	O
the	O
sort	O
of	O
functionality	O
required	O
.	O

listed	O
them	O
here	O
and	O
some	O
of	O
these	O
were	O
evaluated	O
so	O
where	O
appropriate	O

've	O
tried	O
to	O
put	O
down	O
interesting	O
comments	O
for	O
comparing	O
them	O
.	O

The	O
details	O
I	O
've	O
included	O
are	O
completely	O
opinion	O
based	O
,	O
however	O
any	O
of	O
these	O
libraries	O
would	O
probably	O
achieve	O
the	O
required	O
goal	O
.	O

evaluate	O

to	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
36919534	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/36919534/	O

Sort	O
the	O
array	B-Data_Structure
when	O
it	O
is	O
1	O
dimension	O
before	O
you	O
build	O
the	O
multi-dimensional	O
array	B-Data_Structure
.	O

Even	O
better	O
if	O
you	O
are	O
using	O
a	O
query	O
,	O
sort	O
it	O
there	O
.	O

Sort	O
by	O
parent	O
then	O
sort	O
.	O

When	O
you	O
build	O
your	O
multidimensional	O
array	B-Data_Structure
,	O
each	O
child	O
will	O
be	O
appended	O
to	O
the	O
parent	O
.	O

If	O
they	O
are	O
already	O
in	O
the	O
correct	O
order	O
,	O
they	O
will	O
end	O
up	O
in	O
the	O
same	O
order	O
.	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
26353240	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/26353240/	O

No	O
need	O
to	O
record	O
these	O
times	O
yourself	O
.	O

The	O
Pi	O
(	O
and	O
almost	O
any	O
Linux	O
distribution	O
)	O
writes	O
those	O
events	O
to	O
the	O
/var/log/wtmp	B-File_Name
file	O
(	O
more	O
about	O
that	O
file	O
here	O
)	O
.	O

The	O
last	B-Code_Block
command	O
can	O
retrieve	O
those	O
events	O
(	O
also	O
see	O
the	O
manual	O
entry	O
for	O
last	O
)	O
.	O

Try	O
the	O
following	O
:	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_3634	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

Explanation	O
of	O
the	O
flags	O
:	O

-F	B-Code_Block
prints	O
the	O
full	O
date	O
and	O
times	O
-	O
which	O
is	O
handy	O
in	O
your	O
case	O
,	O
because	O
that	O
's	O
what	O
you	O
wanted	O
to	O
know	O
.	O

-R	B-Code_Block
suppresses	O
the	O
hostname	O
in	O
the	O
output	O
.	O

You	O
do	O
n't	O
need	O
that	O
.	O

-x	B-Code_Block
shows	O
shutdown	O
en	O
runlevel	O
changes	O
-	O
now	O
that	O
's	O
what	O
you	O
wanted	O
to	O
know	O
.	O

Finally	O
the	O
grep	B-Code_Block
statement	O
filters	O
out	O
the	O
boot	O
or	O
shutdown	O
messages	O
.	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
26353240	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/26353240/	O

I	O
would	O
recomend	O
code	O
that	O
looks	O
like	O
the	O
following	O
:	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_3633	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

The	O
couple	O
of	O
differences	O
.	O

First	O
,	O
you	O
always	O
open	O
the	O
file	O
in	O
append	O
mode	O
.	O

This	O
way	O
,	O
the	O
file	O
will	O
be	O
flushed	O
every	O
time	O
.	O

Next	O
,	O
it	O
will	O
always	O
update	O
the	O
file	O
with	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
time	O
elapsed	O
.	O

So	O
even	O
if	O
your	O
raspberry	O
pi	O
shuts	O
down	O
,	O
you	O
should	O
be	O
able	O
to	O
recover	O
it	O
.	O

2.5.2-1	O

PS1	O
Script	O

:	I-Code_Block

(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

Powerline	O
config	O

config.json	B-File_Name

colors.json	B-File_Name

colorschemes/shell/default.json	B-File_Name

themes/shell/default.json	B-File_Name

Problem	O

I	O
have	O
the	O
same	O
problem	O
as	O
him	O
,	O

I	O
write	O
a	O
few	O

wraps	O
and	O

(	O

1)	O
.	O

it	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
37757484	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/37757484/	O

To	O
decide	O
between	O
using	O
an	O
ArrayList/Vector	O
or	O
a	O
HashMap	O
depends	O
on	O
whether	O
you	O
have	O
key-value	O
pairs	O
or	O
simple	O
a	O
list	B-Data_Structure
of	O
elements	O
.	O

For	O
key-value	O
pairs	O
a	O
HashMap	O
is	O
the	O
go-to	O
option	O
(	O
e.g	O
name	O
-	O
person	O
object	O
)	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
just	O
have	O
objects	O
but	O
no	O
real	O
keys	O
(	O
a	O
list	O
of	O
trees	O
in	O
a	O
forest	O
)	O
then	O
a	O
ArrayList	O
or	O
Vector	O
would	O
be	O
better	O
.	O

The	O
difference	O
between	O
Vector	O
and	O
ArrayList	O
is	O
more	O
subtle	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
want	O
more	O
information	O
on	O
the	O
difference	O
between	O
the	O
two	O
you	O
can	O
read	O
this	O
article	O
.	O

But	O
as	O
the	O
article	O
is	O
from	O
2001	O
,	O
the	O
information	O
is	O
n't	O
the	O
newest	O
.	O

In	O
most	O
cases	O
,	O
the	O
ArrayList	O
is	O
the	O
better	O
choice	O
and	O
Vector	O
is	O
pretty	O
much	O
considered	O
deprecated	O
nowadays	O
.	O

As	O
the	O
biggest	O
difference	O
between	O
the	O
two	O
is	O
,	O
that	O
Vector	O
is	O
synchronized	O
while	O
ArrayList	O
is	O
n't	O
,	O
which	O
in	O
most	O
cases	O
,	O
makes	O
the	O
Vector	O
slower	O
than	O
the	O
ArrayList	O
as	O
it	O
creates	O
unnecessary	O
overhead	O
.	O

For	O
more	O
information	O
you	O
can	O
look	O
at	O
this	O
question	O
:	O
Why	O
is	O
Java	O
Vector	O
class	O
considered	O
obsolete	O
or	O
deprecated	O
?	O

value	O

my	O

rountine	O

0.1	O
.	O

type	O
double	O
.	O

I	O
hover	O
the	O
mouse	O
over	O
the	O
variable	O
in	O
debug	O

I	O
see	O
0.100000000000001	O

is	O
the	O
cause	O
of	O
this	O
change	O
and	O
how	O
do	O
I	O

it	O

?	O

Method	O
Definition	O
:	O

(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block

Method	O
Call	O
with	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
Q_2491	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

My	O
environment	O
is	O
Windows	O
64	O
bit	O
OS	O
using	O
Qt	O
5.2.1	O

.	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
22773304	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/22773304/	O

Many	O
decimal	O
numbers	O
are	O
not	O
exactly	O
representable	O
in	O
IEEE	O
floating	O
point	O
(	O
i.e	O
.	O
the	O
binary	O
representation	O
used	O
for	O
double	O
)	O
and	O
0.1	O
falls	O
in	O
this	O
camp	O
.	O

When	O
you	O
type	O
0.1	O
the	O
C++	O
compiler	O
is	O
required	O
to	O
convert	O
that	O
into	O
a	O
double	O
to	O
be	O
represented	O
on	O
your	O
hardware	O
.	O

It	O
does	O
so	O
by	O
computing	O
a	O
near	O
approximation	O
of	O
this	O
and	O
so	O
you	O
see	O
a	O
bit	O
of	O
error	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
try	O
something	O
like	O
a	O
power	O
of	O
two	O
:	O
0.5	O
,	O
0.25	O
these	O
will	O
be	O
exactly	O
represented	O
.	O

See	O
this	O
link	O
for	O
a	O
much	O
more	O
in-depth	O
description	O
of	O
the	O
idea	O
.	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
22773304	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/22773304/	O

This	O
is	O
normal	O
behaviour	O
in	O
any	O
computer	O
.	O

It	O
's	O
caused	O
by	O
the	O
fact	O
that	O
decimal	O
numbers	O
are	O
being	O
stored	O
in	O
fixed-sized	O
binary	O
memory	O
.	O

The	O
extra	O
digits	O
come	O
from	O
the	O
inherent	O
errors	O
caused	O
by	O
converting	O
from	O
binary	O
to	O
decimal	O
.	O

You	O
will	O
not	O
get	O
rid	O
of	O
them	O
.	O

The	O
best	O
you	O
can	O
do	O
is	O
choose	O
a	O
precision	O
(	O
either	O
float	O
or	O
double	O
)	O
that	O
is	O
big	O
enough	O
so	O
that	O
the	O
extra	O
error	O
digits	O
will	O
not	O
make	O
any	O
difference	O
to	O
your	O
solution	O
,	O
and	O
then	O
chop	O
them	O
off	O
when	O
you	O
display	O
the	O
number	O
.	O

Question_ID	O
:	O
7421703	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/7421703/	O

When	O
my	O
view	O
controller	O
is	O
first	O
presented	O
,	O
I	O
want	O
it	O
to	O
potentially	O
update	O
a	O
cache	O
that	O
provides	O
the	O
data	O
for	O
that	O
view	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
when	O
the	O
user	O
taps	O
the	O
back	O
button	B-User_Interface_Element
from	O
a	O
deeper	O
view	O
controller	O
to	O
return	O
to	O
this	O
view	O
controller	O
,	O
I	O
do	O
n't	O
want	O
to	O
update	O
the	O
cache	O
again	O
.	O

Which	O
event	O
should	O
I	O
be	O
using	O
?	O

in	O
init	O
,	O
I	O
do	O
n't	O
have	O
all	O
the	O
parameters	O
I	O
need	O
yet	O
.	O

viewWillAppear	O
will	O
be	O
fired	O
every	O
time	O
the	O
view	O
will	O
appear	O
.	O

viewDidLoad	O
will	O
be	O
fired	O
every	O
time	O
the	O
view	O
has	O
been	O
loaded	O
from	O
the	O
nib	O
,	O
which	O
I	O
believe	O
could	O
happen	O
a	O
second	O
time	O
if	O
there	O
's	O
a	O
memory	O
warning	O
.	O

(	O
Or	O
is	O
this	O
wrong	O
?	O
)	O

Since	O
this	O
is	O
not	O
a	O
memory	O
resident	O
cache	O
,	O
it	O
seems	O
the	O
wrong	O
place	O
to	O
handle	O
this	O
.	O

having	O
the	O
caller	O
call	O
something	O
extra	O
is	O
inelegant	O
,	O
if	O
there	O
's	O
a	O
built-in	O
way	O
to	O
handle	O
this	O
.	O

To	O
clarify	O
,	O
this	O
is	O
not	O
a	O
memory	O
resident	O
cache	O
.	O

This	O
is	O
parsing	O
an	O
XML	O
file	O
to	O
binary	O
.	O

The	O
binary	O
is	O
loaded	O
and	O
unloaded	O
in	O
viewDidLoad	O
and	O
viewDidUnload	O
.	O

This	O
is	O
a	O
prerequisite	O
for	O
that	O
step	O
,	O
making	O
sure	O
the	O
binary	O
is	O
up-to-date	O
prior	O
to	O
it	O
being	O
loaded	O
.	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
7421703	O

Question_URL	O
:	O

load	O
the	O
cache	O
in	O

.	O

:	O
47872154	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/47872154/	O

What	O
I	O
end	O
up	O
doing	O
is	O
creating	O
a	O

plug	O
in	O
that	O

the	O
data	O
source	O
from	O
the	O
webtest	O

and	O

the	O
value	O
.	O

Here	O
is	O
a	O

Without	O
knowing	O
more	O
info	O
,	O
this	O
could	O
be	O
your	O
problem	O
.	O

As	O
the	O
creator	O
of	O
Selenium	O
RC	O
,	O
I	O
actually	O
recommend	O
against	O
using	O
the	O
Windows	O
Service	O
entirely	O
.	O

Instead	O
,	O
do	O
what	O
we	O
do	O
at	O
BrowserMob	O
,	O
which	O
provides	O
free	O
monitoring	O
and	O
free	O
load	O
testing	O
services	O
,	O
as	O
well	O
as	O
a	O
recently	O
launch	O
instant	O
test	O
tool	O
that	O
takes	O
screenshots	O
of	O
your	O
site	O
from	O
multiple	O
locations	O
.	O

What	O
we	O
do	O
is	O
launch	O
everything	O
from	O
under	O
the	O
context	O
of	O
a	O
VNC	O
session	O
.	O

On	O
Windows	O
,	O
configure	O
VNC	O
to	O
launch	O
a	O
session	O
upon	O
startup	O
.	O

Then	O
make	O
sure	O
the	O
user	O
auto-logs	O
in	O
.	O

Then	O
place	O
a	O
.bat	O
file	O
in	O
Program	B-File_Name
Files->Startup	I-File_Name
that	O
launches	O
Selenium	O
RC	O
.	O

It	O
's	O
kind	O
of	O
a	O
pain	O
,	O
but	O
it	O
's	O
the	O
most	O
reliable	O
way	O
I	O
've	O
found	O
for	O
ensuring	O
that	O
Selenium	O
RC	O
starts	O
in	O
an	O
environment	O
that	O
supports	O
screenshots	O
,	O
launching	O
IE	O
,	O
interacting	O
with	O
native	O
events	O
,	O
etc	O
.	O

Good	O
luck	O
!	O

and	O

.	O

form	B-User_Interface_Element

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
5082507	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/5082507/	O

"	O
how	O
to	O
fire	O
a	O
mouse	O
down	O
event	O
?	O
"	O
.	O

You	O
do	O
not	O
need	O
to	O
worry	O
about	O
'	O
firing	O
'	O
the	O
event	O
-	O
the	O
OS	O
does	O
that	O
.	O

You	O
need	O
to	O
handle	O
the	O
event	O
which	O
is	O
EVT_LEFT_DOWN	O
.	O

Is	O
your	O
question	O
about	O
how	O
to	O
handle	O
wxWidgets	O
events	O
?	O

Have	O
you	O
looked	O
at	O
the	O
sample	O
programs	O
?	O

http://docs.wxwidgets.org/2.6/wx_samples.html	O
They	O
are	O
all	O
in	O
C++	O
.	O

There	O
is	O
a	O
description	O
of	O
how	O
to	O
handle	O
events	O
here	O
:	O
http://docs.wxwidgets.org/2.6/wx_eventhandlingoverview.html#eventhandlingoverview	O

If	O
you	O
question	O
is	O
about	O
something	O
more	O
specific	O
in	O
the	O
details	O
of	O
handling	O
the	O
EVT_LEFT_DOWN	O
event	O
,	O
then	O
please	O
post	O
your	O
code	O
,	O
describe	O
what	O
you	O
want	O
it	O
to	O
do	O
and	O
what	O
it	O
does	O
instead	O
.	O

:	O

threads	O
and	O
all	O
access	O

section	O

value	O
from	O
file	O

the	O
value	O
.	O

.	O

one	O
thread	O
access	O

critical	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
Q_1039	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

What	O
am	O
I	O
doing	O

:	O
13592166	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/13592166/	O

AboveNumber	O
can	O
do	O
no	O
magic	O
.	O

If	O
the	O
list	B-Data_Structure
is	O
unordered	O
,	O
it	O
must	O
run	O
through	O
all	O
items	O
in	O
the	O
list	B-Data_Structure
.	O

You	O
can	O
optimize	O
this	O
by	O
maintaining	O
the	O
list	B-Data_Structure
in	O
order	O
,	O
i.e	O
.	O
by	O
making	O
sure	O
that	O
the	O
list	B-Data_Structure
is	O
always	O
ordered	O
after	O
an	O
insert	O
or	O
erase	O
.	O

If	O
the	O
list	B-Data_Structure
is	O
ordered	O
,	O
you	O
may	O
find	O
your	O
"	O
mean	O
"	O
by	O
a	O
binary	O
search	O
,	O
which	O
would	O
be	O
much	O
faster	O
than	O
running	O
through	O
all	O
the	O
list	B-Data_Structure
,	O
then	O
cut	O
the	O
list	B-Data_Structure
at	O
that	O
position	O
.	O

:	I-Code_Block
Q_1841	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block

for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

example	O
is	O
easy	O
,	O
it	O
works	O
and	O
it	O
seams	O
to	O
do	O
exactly	O
what	O
I	O
want	O
.	O

I	O
do	O

?	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
17918344	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/17918344/	O

Waffle	B-Library
uses	O
the	O
Windows	O
SSPI	O
,	O
which	O
performs	O
all	O
operations	O
involving	O
Kerberos	O
tickets	O
on	O
client	O
's	O
behalf	O
.	O

The	O
client	O
never	O
sees	O
the	O
ticket	O
.	O

This	O
is	O
a	O
basic	O
Kerberos	O
question	O
.	O

The	O
token	O
sent	O
to	O
the	O
server	O
is	O
encrypted	O
by	O
server	O
's	O
secret	O
key	O
,	O
which	O
guarantees	O
that	O
the	O
token	O
was	O
created	O
by	O
the	O
Ticket	O
Granting	O
Service	O
,	O
which	O
authenticated	O
the	O
client	O
.	O

Yes	O
,	O
the	O
are	O
retrieved	O
from	O
the	O
security	O
token	O
.	O

The	O
problem	O
is	O
you	O
expect	O
that	O
Javascript	O
contained	O
within	O
an	O
ajax	O
response	O
is	O
executed	O
.	O

might	O
be	O
possible	O
to	O

to	O

out	O
the	O

and	O
execute	O
it	O
in	O
some	O
way	O
,	O
such	O
as	O
eval()	O
but	O
that	O
would	O
be	O
nasty	O
and	O
not	O
a	O
good	O
idea	O
.	O

eval()	O
you	O
also	O
have	O
to	O
consider	O
that	O
it	O
will	O
only	O
accept	O
valid	O

,	O
so	O
you	O
could	O

just	O
pass	O
your	O
response	O
to	O
it	O
because	O
that	O
includes	O
some	O
HTML	O
.	O

possible	O

be	O
to	O

popup()	O
function	O

page	O

an	O

,	O
and	O

assign	O
the	O
click	O
handler	O
after	O
you	O
add	O
the	O
HTML	O
to	O
the	O
DOM	B-Library
.	O

example	O
:	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
49020250	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/49020250/	O

Because	O
in	O
literal	O
strings	O
,	O
\	O
is	O
an	O
escape	O
character	O
-	O
allow	O
putting	O
quotes/tabs/newlines	O
etc	O
.	O
in	O
literal	O
strings	O
.	O

You	O
should	O
use	O
'	O
c:\\data	O
'	O
or	O
'	O
c:/data	O
'	O
(	O
forward	O
slash	O
works	O
fine	O
in	O
windows	O
)	O

Another	O
way	O
is	O
to	O
use	O
"	O
raw	O
"	O
strings	O
r'c:\data'	O
but	O
be	O
careful	O
,	O
because	O
you	O
ca	O
n't	O
use	O
any	O
escaped	O
characters	O
anymore	O

:	I-Code_Block
Q_5141	I-Code_Block

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
40686543	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/40686543/	O

Refer	O
to	O
the	O
Javadoc	O
of	O
String.replaceFirst	O
:	O

The	O
first	O
parameter	O
is	O
a	O
regular	O
expression	O
(	O
meaning	O
characters	O
like	O
*	O
have	O
special	O
meaning	O
)	O
;	O

The	O
second	O
parameter	O
is	O
a	O
regex	O
replacement	O
(	O
meaning	O
certain	O
character	O
sequences	O
have	O
special	O
meaning	O
,	O
e.g	O
.	O
\	O
and	O
$	O
)	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
want	O
to	O
pass	O
in	O
strings	O
from	O
an	O
untrusted	O
source	O
(	O
like	O
user	O
input	O
)	O
,	O
you	O
need	O
to	O
quote	O
them	O
appropriately	O
:	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_5826	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

However	O
,	O
String.replaceFirst	O
is	O
not	O
the	O
right	O
tool	O
for	O
this	O
job	O
.	O

It	O
wo	O
n't	O
work	O
correctly	O
if	O
there	O
is	O
a	O
match	O
for	O
the	O
search	O
string	O
before	O
the	O
one	O
you	O
are	O
really	O
looking	O
for	O
.	O

The	O
most	O
straightforward	O
modification	O
to	O
your	O
code	O
would	O
be	O
to	O
use	O
String.substring	O
-	O
you	O
know	O
exactly	O
where	O
the	O
thing	O
you	O
want	O
to	O
replace	O
is	O
,	O
so	O
make	O
use	O
of	O
that	O
information	O
:	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_5827	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

(	O
This	O
would	O
replace	O
the	O
last	O
7	O
lines	O
in	O
the	O
loop	O
)	O

You	O
can	O
do	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
Q_1918	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

MyApp.Web	O
references	O
MyApp.Logic	O
,	O
and	O
MyApp.Logic	O
references	O
MyApp.Data	O
.	O

On	O
my	O
application	O
,	O
what	O
I	O
am	O
trying	O
to	O
do	O
is	O
simply	O
bind	O
a	O
gridview	B-User_Interface_Element
by	O
the	O
tablename	O
,	O
which	O
is	O
chosen	O
from	O
a	O
dropdownlist	B-User_Interface_Element
.	O

However	O
,	O
there	O
are	O
hundreds	O
and	O
more	O
tables	B-Data_Structure
.	O

The	O
purpose	O
here	O
is	O
just	O
to	O
display	O
data	O
to	O
the	O
user	O
(	O
with	O
paging	O
)	O
.	O

So	O
a	O
class	O
"	O
Get_Data	O
"	O
on	O
project	O
MyApp.Data	O
has	O
a	O
function	O
:	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
Q_1919	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

From	O
MyApp.Logic	O
,	O
I	O
am	O
just	O
passing	O
the	O
datatable	B-Data_Structure
from	O
the	O
MyApp.Data	O
tier	O
to	O
MyApp.Web	O
.	O

And	O
then	O
the	O
gridview	B-User_Interface_Element
is	O
bound	O
and	O
everything	O
is	O
working	O
here	O
.	O

So	O
what	O
I	O
am	O
doing	O
wrong	O
here	O
?	O

Is	O
it	O
really	O
bad	O
to	O
have	O
datatable	B-Data_Structure
in	O
UI	O
level	O
?	O

Why	O
is	O
it	O
a	O
bad	O
design	O
?	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
18562928	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/18562928/	O

The	O
notion	O
that	O
it	O
is	O
bad	O
practice	O
for	O
your	O
UI	O
to	O
create/load/consume	O
a	O
datatable	B-Data_Structure
comes	O
from	O
the	O
idea	O
that	O
it	O
is	O
preferable	O
to	O
split	O
your	O
application	O
into	O
layers	O
that	O
specialize	O
,	O
the	O
most	O
common	O
split	O
is	O
to	O
have	O
3	O
layers	O
:	O

Layer	O
1	O
is	O
a	O
data	O
layer	O
responsible	O
for	O
communicating	O
with	O
the	O
database	O
and	O
populating	O
domain	O
objects	O
,	O
the	O
domain	O
objects	O
are	O
typically	O
defined	O
in	O
layer	O
2	O
which	O
also	O
holds	O
the	O
business	O
logic	O
for	O
your	O
application	O
.	O

by	O
domain	O
objects	O
i	O
mean	O
classes	O
that	O
represent	O
real	O
things	O
like	O
customer	O
,	O
bank	O
account	O
,	O
hotel	O
room	O
etc	O
.	O

and	O
by	O
business	O
logic	O
i	O
mean	O
the	O
rules	O
that	O
apply	O
to	O
domain	O
objects	O
during	O
events	O
i.e	O
.	O
when	O
a	O
hotel	O
room	O
is	O
booked	O
a	O
confirmation	O
is	O
sent	O
to	O
the	O
customer	O
.	O

the	O
third	O
layer	O
is	O
the	O
UI	O
layer	O
,	O
to	O
simplyfy	O
coding	O
this	O
should	O
only	O
deal	O
with	O
whats	O
in	O
layer	O
2	O
,	O
this	O
is	O
where	O
the	O
recommendation	O
to	O
not	O
use	O
datatables	B-Data_Structure
in	O
your	O
UI	O
comes	O
from	O
.	O

the	O
motivation	O
to	O
split	O
your	O
application	O
really	O
start	O
to	O
make	O
sense	O
when	O
your	O
application	O
is	O
big	O
,	O
or	O
you	O
have	O
multiple	O
developers	O
working	O
on	O
it	O
,	O
or	O
your	O
using	O
unit	O
testing	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
're	O
in	O
that	O
situation	O
then	O
i	O
'd	O
try	O
and	O
find	O
a	O
friendly	O
member	O
of	O
your	O
team	O
to	O
explain	O
this	O
better	O
,	O
but	O
if	O
this	O
is	O
just	O
you	O
writing	O
an	O
application	O
on	O
your	O
own	O
then	O
i	O
would	O
n't	O
worry	O
too	O
much	O
about	O
it	O
,	O
write	O
lots	O
of	O
code	O
,	O
read	O
lots	O
of	O
books	O
and	O
this	O
stuff	O
will	O
make	O
more	O
sense	O
,	O
i	O
would	O
recommend	O
the	O
craig	O
larman	O
book	O
on	O
uml	O
and	O
patterns	O
.	O

hope	O
this	O
helps	O

:	O

.	O
