Question_ID	O
:	O
19114353	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/19114353/	O

I	O
'm	O
writing	O
some	O
software	O
that	O
talks	O
to	O
external	O
hardware	O
via	O
a	O
dll	B-Library
(	O
moving	O
some	O
motors	O
and	O
reading	O
some	O
values	O
back	O
)	O
.	O

The	O
calls	O
to	O
the	O
dll	B-Library
are	O
blocking	O
and	O
may	O
not	O
return	O
for	O
in	O
the	O
order	O
of	O
10	O
seconds	O
.	O

The	O
software	O
performs	O
a	O
scan	O
by	O
moving	O
the	O
hardware	O
,	O
taking	O
a	O
reading	O
and	O
repeating	O
for	O
a	O
number	O
of	O
points	O
.	O

One	O
scan	O
can	O
take	O
in	O
the	O
order	O
of	O
30	O
minutes	O
to	O
complete	O
.	O

While	O
the	O
scan	O
is	O
running	O
I	O
would	O
obviously	O
like	O
the	O
GUI	B-User_Interface_Element
to	O
be	O
responsive	O
and	O
a	O
live	O
graph	B-Data_Structure
(	O
in	O
an	O
MDI	O
Child	O
)	O
of	O
the	O
incoming	O
data	O
to	O
be	O
updated	O
at	O
each	O
point	O
.	O

Multithreading	O
seems	O
the	O
obvious	O
choice	O
for	O
this	O
problem	O
.	O

My	O
question	O
is	O
,	O
what	O
is	O
the	O
best	O
way	O
to	O
thread	O
this	O
and	O
talk	O
back	O
to	O
the	O
main	O
VCL	B-Library
thread	O
to	O
update	O
the	O
graph	B-Data_Structure
during	O
a	O
scan	O
?	O

I	O
currently	O
have	O
a	O
single	O
TThread	O
descendant	O
that	O
performs	O
the	O
'	O
scan	O
logic	O
'	O
and	O
an	O
array	B-Data_Structure
of	O
doubles	O
in	O
the	O
public	O
var	O
section	O
of	O
the	O
ChildForm	O
.	O

I	O
need	O
to	O
fill	O
out	O
this	O
array	B-Data_Structure
from	O
the	O
thread	O
but	O
I	O
do	O
n't	O
know	O
whether	O
to	O
use	O
Synchronize	O
or	O
CriticalSection	O
or	O
PostMessage	O
or	O
some	O
other	O
method	O
.	O

Each	O
time	O
a	O
new	O
value	O
is	O
added	O
,	O
the	O
main	O
VCL	B-Library
thread	O
needs	O
to	O
update	O
the	O
graph	B-Data_Structure
.	O

Should	O
I	O
really	O
have	O
an	O
intermediary	O
object	O
for	O
the	O
data	O
that	O
is	O
a	O
global	O
var	O
and	O
access	O
this	O
from	O
the	O
Thread	O
and	O
the	O
ChildForm	O
separately	O
somehow	O
?	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
19114353	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/19114353/	O

I	O
find	O
that	O
populating	O
a	O
TThreadList	O
from	O
the	O
background	O
thread	O
,	O
then	O
posting	O
a	O
message	O
to	O
the	O
main	O
thread	O
that	O
there	O
is	O
a	O
new	O
item	O
in	O
the	O
list	B-Data_Structure
,	O
then	O
processing	O
the	O
list	B-Data_Structure
in	O
the	O
main	O
thread	O
is	O
simple	O
and	O
easily	O
maintainable	O
.	O

With	O
this	O
method	O
,	O
you	O
could	O
store	O
as	O
many	O
readings	O
as	O
you	O
wanted	O
in	O
the	O
list	B-Data_Structure
,	O
and	O
every	O
time	O
the	O
main	O
thread	O
received	O
a	O
message	O
,	O
it	O
would	O
simply	O
process	O
all	O
the	O
items	O
in	O
the	O
list	B-Data_Structure
at	O
once	O
.	O

Define	O
a	O
class	O
for	O
the	O
readings	O
,	O
instantiate	O
them	O
,	O
and	O
add	O
them	O
to	O
the	O
list	B-Data_Structure
in	O
the	O
background	O
thread	O
.	O

Do	O
n't	O
forget	O
to	O
free	O
them	O
in	O
the	O
main	O
thread	O
when	O
you	O
pop	O
them	O
off	O
the	O
list	B-Data_Structure
.	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
19114353	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/19114353/	O

If	O
you	O
want	O
to	O
invest	O
a	O
little	O
more	O
then	O
a	O
simple	O
Synchronize	O
call	O
which	O
by	O
the	O
way	O
blocks	O
the	O
main	O
thread	O
,	O
you	O
can	O
add	O
a	O
simple	O
FIFO	O
queue	B-Data_Structure
with	O
messaging	O
on	O
top	O
of	O
it	O
.	O

The	O
flow	O
of	O
data	O
would	O
be	O
like	O
this	O
:	O

The	O
thread	O
puts	O
the	O
data	O
into	O
the	O
queue	B-Data_Structure
.	O

The	O
thread	O
post	O
a	O
message	O
to	O
the	O
main	O
thread	O
window	O
.	O

Which	O
one	O
I	O
do	O
n't	O
care	O
:)	O

You	O
handle	O
the	O
message	O
that	O
data	O
is	O
available	O
and	O
process	O
any	O
messages	O
in	O
the	O
queue	B-Data_Structure
as	O
you	O
see	O
fit	O
.	O

The	O
code	O
would	O
look	O
something	O
like	O
this	O
:	O

the	O
queue	B-Data_Structure
..	O
.	O

:	I-Code_Block

code	I-Code_Block

annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

the	O
data	O
is	O
put	O
into	O
the	O
queue	B-Data_Structure
..	O
.	O

:	I-Code_Block

for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

and	O
processing	O
..	O
.	O

:	I-Code_Block

(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

The	O
code	O
is	O
written	O
without	O
Delphi	O
and	O
checks	O
so	O
it	O
can	O
contain	O
errors	O
.	O

I	O
showed	O
the	O
example	O
using	O
my	O
freely	O
available	O
thread	O
safe	O
queue	B-Data_Structure
and	O
TAnyValue	O
.	O

You	O
can	O
find	O
both	O
here	O
:	O

http://www.cromis.net/blog/downloads/	O

please	O
note	O
then	O
I	O
did	O
not	O
do	O
any	O
check	O
if	O

was	O
actually	O
sent	O
.	O

should	O
check	O
that	O
in	O

code	O
.	O

SOLUTION	O

Well	O
,	O
that	O
's	O
what	O
I	O
get	O
when	O
I	O
use	O
a	O
bit	O
oldish	O
Symfony2	O
release	O
(	O
2.0-RC6	O
)	O
.	O

It	O
seems	O
that	O
there	O
was	O
a	O
bug	O
in	O
__construct	O
of	O
RoleSecurityIdentity	O
(	O
reported	O
back	O
in	O
December	O
'	O
10	O
)	O
.	O

Instead	O
of	O
instance	O
of	O
Role	O
it	O
should	O
be	O
instance	O
of	O
RoleInstance	O
.	O

I	O
should	O
probably	O
close	O
this	O
question	O
..	O
.	O

I	O
'm	O
pretty	O
new	O
to	O
whole	O
ACL	B-Data_Structure
concept	O
in	O
Symfony2	O
but	O
I	O
understand	O
basics	O
behind	O
it	O
.	O

Last	O
night	O
I	O
was	O
trying	O
to	O
make	O
next	O
scenario	O
work	O
:	O

I	O
have	O
2	O
user	O
roles	O
(	O
ROLE_GROUP1	O
,	O
ROLE_GROUP	O
2)	O
and	O
I	O
want	O
to	O
setup	O
object-level	O
ACL	O
for	O
the	O
one	O
of	O
these	O
groups	O
.	O

If	O
user	O
with	O
ROLE_GROUP1	O
is	O
logged	O
in	O
it	O
should	O
put	O
this	O
role	O
into	O
ACE	O
,	O
otherwise	O
it	O
should	O
put	O
ROLE_GROUP2	O
.	O

So	O
far	O
I	O
wrote	O
this	O
code	O
(	O
really	O
almost	O
identical	O
to	O
official	O
docs	O
)	O
:	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
Q_897	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

The	O
way	O
I	O
understand	O
it	O
,	O
this	O
should	O
grant	O
all	O
permissions	O
to	O
users	O
with	O
ROLE_GROUP1	O
role	O
.	O

Am	O
I	O
wrong	O
?	O

To	O
check	O
for	O
permissions	O
I	O
used	O
this	O
code	O
(	O
again	O
,	O
from	O
official	O
docs	O
)	O
:	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
Q_898	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

..	O
.	O
but	O
it	O
always	O
fails	O
(	O
that	O
is	O
throws	O
an	O
exception	O
)	O
.	O

I	O
looked	O
into	O
the	O
ACL	B-Data_Structure
tables	I-Data_Structure
and	O
everything	O
seemed	O
normal	O
,	O
as	O
far	O
as	O
I	O
could	O
see	O
.	O

Am	O
I	O
doing	O
something	O
wrong	O
with	O
RoleSecurityIdentity	O
?	O

Is	O
there	O
any	O
way	O
to	O
achieve	O
this	O
scenario	O
?	O

Any	O
help	O
would	O
be	O
much	O
appreciated	O
!	O

I	O
just	O
drilled	O
down	O
through	O

out	O

permission	O
grant	O
fails	O
in	O
equals	O
method	O
of	O
RoleSecurityIdentity	O
.	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
Q_6448	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

The	O
two	O
tables	B-Data_Structure
are	O
related	O
through	O
Foreign-key	O
:	O
FkOriginalTextId	O

Basically	O
,	O
OriginalText	O
will	O
have	O
key/value	O
pairs	O
for	O
different	O
languages	O
.	O

If	O
a	O
particular	O
client	O
wants	O
a	O
certain	O
value	O
to	O
be	O
customized	O
then	O
it	O
goes	O
to	O
the	O
CustomText	O
table	B-Data_Structure
.	O

An	O
example	O
would	O
be	O
OriginalText	O
:	O
Employee	O
,	O
CustomText	O
:	O
Staff-member	O
for	O
the	O
key	O
:	O
Employee	O
.	O

I	O
want	O
to	O
write	O
a	O
Lambda/Linq	B-Library
to	O
get	O
all	O
the	O
text	O
of	O
a	O
given	O
language	O
from	O
the	O
OriginalText	O
table	B-Data_Structure
,	O
but	O
the	O
TextValue	O
should	O
be	O
overriden	O
if	O
there	O
's	O
a	O
custom	O
replacement	O
for	O
that	O
key	O
in	O
the	O
CustomText	O
table	B-Data_Structure
.	O

I	O
can	O
do	O
this	O
using	O
multiple	O
SQL	O
statements	O
by	O
getting	O
the	O
OriginalText	O
values	O
to	O
a	O
temp	O
table	B-Data_Structure
and	O
later	O
on	O
updating	O
them	O
with	O
CustomText	O
value	O
,	O
but	O
is	O
there	O
's	O
a	O
better	O
way	O
to	O
do	O
that	O
?	O

Perhaps	O
using	O
a	O
CTE	O
?	O

P.S	O
.	O
I	O
want	O
to	O
do	O
this	O
using	O
LINQ	B-Library
or	O
Lambda	B-Library
expressions	O

The	O
best	O
option	O
is	O
to	O
use	O
.one	O
instead	O
of	O
live	O
for	O
the	O
button	B-User_Interface_Element
.	O

That	O
makes	O
more	O
sense.	O
.	O

you	O
do	O
not	O
want	O
to	O
use	O
it	O
then	O
you	O
can	O
use	O
a	O

your	O
page	O
and	O
when	O
the	O
click	O
event	O
is	O
triggered	O
then	O
set	O
the	O
flag	O
value.	O
.	O

Next	O
time	O
when	O
you	O
click	O
the	O
button	O
check	O
for	O
the	O
flag	O
value	O
,	O
if	O
it	O
was	O
already	O
executed	O
once	O
then	O
do	O
not	O
run	O
the	O
code	O
inside	O
it.	O
.	O

Check	O
this	O
example	O
http://jsfiddle.net/sushanth009/Fakb5/	O

Also	O
note	O
that	O
.live	O
is	O
deprecated	O
in	O
the	O
current	O
jQuery	B-Library
version	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
preferred	O
to	O
use	O
.on()	O
instead	O

So	O

.	O

if	O
a	O
profile	O
is	O

,	O
@ActiveProfiles	O
sets	O
them	O
as	O

@IfProfileValue	O
allows	O

to	O
check	O
things	O
in	O
Spring	B-Library
Environment	O
.	O

Wut	O
?	O

I	O

deprecate	O
all	O
of	O
them	O
and	O

new	O

.	O

Answers	O

@IfProfileValue	B-Code_Block

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
33016848	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/33016848/	O

That	O
's	O
correct	O
,	O
and	O
I	O
explained	O
this	O
in	O
detail	O
here	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/a/23627479/388980	O

..	O
.	O
which	O
I	O
'm	O
assuming	O
you	O
have	O
already	O
seen	O
,	O
since	O
you	O
commented	O
on	O
my	O
answer	O
yesterday	O
.	O

The	O
reason	O
that	O
@IfProfileValue	O
has	O
nothing	O
to	O
do	O
with	O
@Profile	O
or	O
@ActiveProfiles	O
is	O
due	O
to	O
the	O
evolution	O
of	O
the	O
framework	O
.	O

See	O
below	O
for	O
further	O
details	O
.	O

These	O
statements	O
are	O
not	O
entirely	O
correct	O
,	O
especially	O
the	O
last	O
part	O
.	O

@Profile	O
is	O
used	O
to	O
selectively	O
enable	O
a	O
component	O
(	O
e.g	O
.	O
,	O
@Service	O
,	O
etc	O
.	O
)	O
,	O
@Configuration	O
class	O
,	O
or	O
@Bean	O
method	O
if	O
one	O
of	O
the	O
named	O
bean	O
definition	O
profiles	O
is	O
active	O
in	O
the	O
Spring	O
Environment	O
for	O
the	O
ApplicationContext	O
.	O

This	O
annotation	O
is	O
not	O
directly	O
related	O
to	O
testing	O
:	O
@Profile	O
should	O
not	O
be	O
used	O
on	O
a	O
test	O
class	O
.	O

@ActiveProfiles	O
is	O
used	O
to	O
designate	O
which	O
bean	O
definition	O
profiles	O
(	O
e.g	O
.	O
,	O
those	O
declared	O
via	O
@Profile	O
)	O
should	O
be	O
active	O
when	O
loading	O
an	O
ApplicationContext	O
for	O
an	O
integration	O
test	O
.	O

@IfProfileValue	O
does	O
not	O
allow	O
you	O
to	O
check	O
things	O
in	O
the	O
Spring	O
Environment	O
.	O

I	O
'm	O
not	O
sure	O
why	O
you	O
are	O
assuming	O
this	O
,	O
since	O
none	O
of	O
the	O
documentation	O
in	O
the	O
Spring	B-Library
Framework	I-Library
states	O
that	O
.	O

As	O
I	O
stated	O
in	O
the	O
aforementioned	O
thread	O
:	O

Please	O
note	O
that	O
@IfProfileValue	O
was	O
introduced	O
in	O
Spring	B-Library
Framework	I-Library
2.0	O
,	O
long	O
before	O
the	O
notion	O
of	O
bean	O
definition	O
profiles	O
,	O
and	O
@ActiveProfiles	O
was	O
first	O
introduced	O
in	O
Spring	B-Library
Framework	I-Library
3.1	O
.	O

In	O
the	O
aforementioned	O
thread	O
,	O
I	O
also	O
pointed	O
out	O
the	O
following	O
:	O

The	O
term	O
'	O
profile	O
'	O
is	O
perhaps	O
misleading	O
when	O
considering	O
the	O
semantics	O
for	O
@IfProfileValue	O
.	O

The	O
key	O
is	O
to	O
think	O
about	O
'	O
test	O
groups	O
'	O
(	O
like	O
those	O
in	O
TestNG	B-Library
)	O
instead	O
of	O
'	O
profiles	O
'	O
.	O

See	O
the	O
examples	O
in	O
the	O
JavaDoc	O
for	O
@IfProfileValue	O
.	O

That	O
depends	O
,	O
and	O
..	O
.	O

I	O
'm	O
assuming	O
you	O
mean	O
bean	O
definition	O
profile	O
when	O
you	O
say	O
"	O
profile	O
"	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
're	O
using	O
@ActiveProfiles	O
to	O
set	O
the	O
bean	O
definition	O
profiles	O
for	O
your	O
tests	O
,	O
you	O
cannot	O
currently	O
use	O
@IfProfileValue	O
to	O
determine	O
if	O
a	O
bean	O
definition	O
profile	O
is	O
active	O
,	O
since	O
the	O
bean	O
definition	O
profiles	O
configured	O
via	O
@ActiveProfiles	O
are	O
set	O
directly	O
in	O
the	O
test	O
's	O
ApplicationContext	O
and	O
not	O
as	O
a	O
Java	O
system	O
property	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
if	O
you	O
are	O
setting	O
the	O
bean	O
definition	O
profiles	O
only	O
via	O
the	O
spring.profiles.active	O
system	O
property	O
,	O
then	O
it	O
would	O
be	O
possible	O
to	O
use	O
@IfProfileValue	O
to	O
determine	O
if	O
a	O
bean	O
definition	O
profile	O
is	O
active	O
,	O
since	O
@IfProfileValue	O
in	O
fact	O
works	O
with	O
system	O
properties	O
.	O

For	O
example	O
,	O
you	O
could	O
then	O
use	O
the	O
following	O
:	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_4699	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

That	O
wo	O
n't	O
work	O
since	O
activeProfiles	O
is	O
the	O
incorrect	O
property	O
name	O
.	O

The	O
correct	O
system	O
property	O
name	O
is	O
spring.profiles.active	O
.	O

See	O
AbstractEnvironment.ACTIVE_PROFILES_PROPERTY_NAME	O
for	O
details	O
.	O

The	O
fact	O
that	O
@IfProfileValue	O
does	O
not	O
work	O
in	O
harmony	O
with	O
@ActiveProfiles	O
is	O
a	O
known	O
issue	O
to	O
the	O
Spring	B-Library
team	O
.	O

Please	O
consult	O
the	O
following	O
JIRA	O
issues	O
for	O
further	O
details	O
and	O
to	O
join	O
in	O
on	O
the	O
discussions	O
if	O
you	O
'd	O
like	O
.	O

https://jira.spring.io/browse/SPR-7754	O

https://jira.spring.io/browse/SPR-8982	O

https://jira.spring.io/browse/SPR-11677	O

Hope	O
this	O
clarifies	O
the	O
situation	O
for	O
you	O
!	O

Sam	O
(	O
author	O
of	O
the	O
Spring	O
TestContext	O
Framework	O
)	O

Question_ID	O
:	O
5920152	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/5920152/	O

Firstly	O
,	O
I	O
know	O
LocationManager	O
does	O
n't	O
have	O
to	O
be	O
called	O
in	O
an	O
AsyncTask	O
as	O
it	O
's	O
already	O
non	O
UI	O
blocking	O
:)	O

I	O
have	O
an	O
activity	O
which	O

1	O
.	O
Gets	O
the	O
users	O
current	O
location	O

2	O
.	O
Calls	O
a	O
webservice	O
to	O
retrieve	O
a	O
list	O
of	O
specific	O
POIs	O
around	O
that	O
location	O
.	O

The	O
user	O
can	O
choose	O
to	O
view	O
the	O
results	O
as	O
map	B-Data_Structure
or	O
list	B-Data_Structure
using	O
a	O
TabActivity	O
.	O

Bearing	O
this	O
in	O
mind	O
the	O
AsyncTask	O
to	O
get	O
users	O
location	O
and	O
call	O
to	O
webservice	O
is	O
managed	O
by	O
the	O
TabActivity	O
view	O
rather	O
than	O
either	O
of	O
the	O
docked	O
views	O
.	O

So	O
I	O
want	O
the	O
TabActivity	O
to	O
start	O
an	O
AsyncTask	O
which	O
first	O
gets	O
the	O
users	O
location	O
,	O
then	O
calls	O
the	O
webservice	O
.	O

It	O
's	O
pretty	O
much	O
all	O
working	O
apart	O
from	O
getting	O
the	O
users	O
location	O
from	O
the	O
AsyncTask	O
.	O

The	O
webservice	O
code	O
is	O
written	O
,	O
the	O
mapping	O
and	O
overlay	O
code	O
is	O
written	O
,	O
the	O
task	O
progress	O
dialog	B-User_Interface_Element
copes	O
with	O
orientation	O
changes	O
.	O

The	O
focus	O
on	O
location	O
is	O
speed	O
rather	O
than	O
accuracy	O
.	O

If	O
the	O
user	O
chooses	O
to	O
view	O
results	O
on	O
the	O
mapview	O
then	O
I	O
will	O
provide	O
a	O
'	O
My	O
location	O
'	O
button	B-User_Interface_Element
which	O
will	O
enable	O
a	O
more	O
accurate	O
location	O
to	O
be	O
obtained	O
.	O

I	O
just	O
want	O
to	O
initially	O
get	O
a	O
rough	O
location	O
and	O
return	O
the	O
search	O
results	O
quickly	O
.	O

Maybe	O
I	O
'm	O
going	O
about	O
this	O
the	O
wrong	O
way	O
.	O

Maybe	O
I	O
should	O
display	O
the	O
map	B-Data_Structure
view	O
,	O
let	O
the	O
map	B-Data_Structure
activity	O
find	O
the	O
current	O
location	O
,	O
then	O
call	O
just	O
the	O
webservice	O
in	O
the	O
async	O
-	O
but	O
then	O
what	O
if	O
the	O
user	O
taps	O
the	O
list	O
view	O
tab	O
during	O
the	O
location	O
phase	O
?	O

I	O
was	O
also	O
going	O
to	O
allow	O
the	O
user	O
to	O
specify	O
their	O
default	O
view	O
-	O
some	O
people	O
may	O
prefer	O
a	O
list	O
to	O
a	O
map	O
.	O

In	O
this	O
case	O
I	O
would	O
have	O
a	O
listview	O
which	O
had	O

I	O
sussed	O
it	O
.	O

The	O
problem	O
I	O
was	O
having	O
was	O
that	O
the	O
LocationListener	O
was	O
not	O
being	O
called	O
in	O
the	O
AsyncTask	O
.	O

The	O
reason	O
for	O
this	O
was	O
that	O
although	O
I	O
'd	O
created	O
and	O
prepared	O
a	O
lopper	O
in	O
the	O
thread	O
I	O
had	O

called	O

I	O
start	O
the	O
requestLocationUpdates	O
,	O
kick	O
off	O
a	O
timer	O
.	O

Either	O

locationmanager	O
responds	O
with	O
a	O
location	O
,	O
or	O
the	O
timer	O
expires	O
.	O

this	O
point	O

call	O

to	O
ensure	O
things	O
return	O
to	O
normal	O
.	O

Seems	O
to	O
be	O
working	O
.	O

You	O
also	O
have	O
to	O
remember	O
to	O
respond	O
to	O
the	O
back	O
button	B-User_Interface_Element
etc	O
,	O
cancelling	O
the	O
timer	O
and	O
looper	O
if	O
the	O

is	O
cancelled	O
.	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
Q_3849	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

Eclipse	O
gave	O
me	O
this	O
warning	O
:	O

Multiple	O
markers	O
at	O
this	O
line	O

Syntax	O
error	O
on	O
token	O
"	O
++	B-Code_Block
"	O
,	O
+	B-Code_Block

expected	O

Invalid	O
argument	O
to	O
operation	O
++	B-Code_Block
/	O
-	B-Code_Block
-	I-Code_Block

This	O
makes	O
sense	O
,	O
because	O
++	B-Code_Block
on	O
its	O
own	O
is	O
an	O
operator	O
of	O
sorts	O
.	O

Interestingly	O
,	O
however	O
,	O
if	O
I	O
put	O
a	O
space	O
between	O
the	O
"	O
++	B-Code_Block
"	O
,	O
then	O
the	O
warning	O
disappears	O
.	O

I	O
did	O
n't	O
paste	O
my	O
entire	O
code	O
for	O
the	O
sake	O
of	O
readability	O
,	O
but	O
if	O
necessary	O
,	O
I	O
can	O
edit	O
and	O
add	O
it	O
in	O
.	O

regarding	O
this	O
would	O

helpful	O
.	O

you	O
.	O

:	O
31801069	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/31801069/	O

No	O
,	O
it	O
's	O
not	O
a	O
bug	O
.	O

It	O
's	O
unusual	O
,	O
but	O
it	O
's	O
not	O
a	O
bug	O
.	O

The	O
first	O
thing	O
to	O
do	O
is	O
simplify	O
the	O
example	O
massively	O
:	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_4546	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block

)	I-Code_Block

:	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_4547	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

Now	O
admittedly	O
I	O
'm	O
using	O
strings	O
for	O
both	O
start	O
and	O
end	O
,	O
but	O
due	O
to	O
+	B-Code_Block
being	O
left-associative	O
,	O
that	O
does	O
n't	O
make	O
any	O
difference	O
here	O
.	O

(	O
If	O
start	O
were	O
an	O
integer	O
,	O
the	O
first	O
binary	O
+	B-Code_Block
operator	O
would	O
be	O
integer	O
addition	O
in	O
both	O
cases	O
.	O
)	O

Basically	O
,	O
the	O
extra	O
+	B-Code_Block
ends	O
up	O
being	O
a	O
unary	O
+	B-Code_Block
operator	O
with	O
'	O
\t	O
'	O
as	O
the	O
operand	O
.	O

Unary	O
numeric	O
promotion	O
is	O
applied	O
to	O
the	O
char	O
,	O
giving	O
int	O
as	O
a	O
result	O
.	O

So	O
the	O
code	O
becomes	O
effectively	O
:	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_4548	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

which	O
is	O
effectively	O
:	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_4549	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

which	O
is	O
effectively	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_4550	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

..	O
.	O
at	O
which	O
point	O
it	O
's	O
hopefully	O
clear	O
why	O
you	O
're	O
getting	O
the	O
output	O
you	O
are	O
.	O

To	O
avoid	O
accidentally	O
ending	O
up	O
treating	O
a	O
character	O
as	O
an	O
integer	O
,	O
it	O
's	O
probably	O
best	O
to	O
just	O
use	O
strings	O
instead	O
-	O
at	O
which	O
point	O
the	O
code	O
wo	O
n't	O
compile	O
because	O
there	O
's	O
no	O
unary	O
+	B-Code_Block
operator	O
for	O
String	O
:	O

)	I-Code_Block

.	O
.	O

:	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_4552	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
31801069	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/31801069/	O

The	O
problem	O
is	O
not	O
just	O
with	O
the	O
+	B-Code_Block
+	I-Code_Block
in	O
your	O
code	O
.	O

But	O
it	O
's	O
also	O
with	O
the	O
fact	O
that	O
you	O
are	O
using	O
char	O
'	O
\t	O
'	O
and	O
not	O
String	O
"	O
\t	O
"	O
.	O

But	O
when	O
you	O
use	O
System.out.println	B-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
"	I-Code_Block
Hello	I-Code_Block
"	I-Code_Block
+	I-Code_Block
+	I-Code_Block
'	I-Code_Block
\t'	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block
;	B-Code_Block
,	O
it	O
becomes	O
effectively	O
System.out.println	B-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
"	I-Code_Block
Hello	I-Code_Block
"	I-Code_Block
+	I-Code_Block
(	B-Code_Block
+	I-Code_Block
'	I-Code_Block
\t'	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block
)	B-Code_Block
;	B-Code_Block
.	O

So	O
it	O
is	O
treated	O
as	O
an	O
int	O
by	O
java	O
.	O

You	O
only	O
assign	O
+	B-Code_Block
and	O
-	B-Code_Block
signs	O
to	O
ints	O
,	O
not	O
chars	O
.	O

Remember	O
you	O
can	O
do	O
int	B-Code_Block
i	I-Code_Block
=	I-Code_Block
+2	I-Code_Block
or	O
-2	B-Code_Block
or	O
+	B-Code_Block
+	I-Code_Block
2	I-Code_Block
.	O

And	O
the	O
ASCII	O
value	O
of	O
\t	O
is	O
9	O
.	O

Hence	O
it	O
gets	O
appended	O
to	O
the	O
string	O
and	O
get	O
's	O
printed	O
as	O
Hello9	O
.	O

have	O
this	O

plugin	O
here	O
:	O

canvas	O

will	O

algorithm	O
which	O
allows	O
for	O
background	B-User_Interface_Element
drawing	O
.	O

Question_URL	O

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/7930740/	O

I	O
'm	O
trying	O
to	O
write	O
some	O
generic	O
code	O
for	O
handling	O
drops	O
in	O
WPF	B-Library
drop	O
targets	O
.	O

AllowDrop	O
is	O
set	O
to	O
true	O
,	O
and	O
I	O
've	O
hooked	O
onto	O
DragEnter	O
,	O
DragOver	O
,	O
DragLeave	O
,	O
&	O
Drop	O
on	O
the	O
drop	O
target	O
UIElement	O
.	O

Using	O
the	O
bubbling	O
events	O
enables	O
nesting	O
of	O
drop	O
targets	O
.	O

Note	O
I	O
have	O
no	O
access	O
to	O
the	O
drag	O
source	O
-	O
this	O
is	O
inter-application	O
drag	O
&	O
drop	O
.	O

Drop	O
is	O
easy	O
-	O
but	O
what	O
indicates	O
a	O
cancel	O
?	O

The	O
problem	O
I	O
have	O
is	O
this	O
:	O

DragLeave	O
is	O
a	O
bubbling	O
routed	O
event	O
.	O

e.OriginalSource	O
is	O
always	O
set	O
for	O
this	O
event	O
(	O
and	O
the	O
corresponding	O
Preview	O
)	O
via	O
hittesting	O
.	O

The	O
target	O
is	O
an	O
ItemsControl	O
(	O
Listbox	O
is	O
what	O
I	O
've	O
currently	O
been	O
testing	O
with	O
)	O
.	O

As	O
I	O
drag	O
over	O
my	O
intended	O
drop	O
target	O
,	O
I	O
get	O
loads	O
of	O
DragLeave	O
events	O
from	O
the	O
child	O
visuals	O
within	O
the	O
target	O
.	O

I	O
never	O
get	O
any	O
from	O
the	O
target	O
itself	O
.	O

Grids	B-User_Interface_Element
,	O
rectangles	B-User_Interface_Element
,	O
borders	B-User_Interface_Element
,	O
textblocks	B-User_Interface_Element
,	O
they	O
all	O
happily	O
send	O
me	O
DragLeave	O
,	O
but	O
none	O
from	O
the	O
actual	O
ItemsControl	O
I	O
'm	O
connected	O
up	O
to	O
.	O

What	O
am	O
I	O
missing	O
?	O

How	O
am	O
I	O
supposed	O
to	O
determine	O
that	O
a	O
drop	O
operation	O
has	O
definitely	O
finished	O
?	O

(	O
The	O
actual	O
problem	O
I	O
'm	O
trying	O
to	O
solve	O
is	O
that	O
I	O
'm	O
implementing	O
some	O
custom	O
dragging	O
behaviour	O
in	O
a	O
TreeView	O
that	O
expands	O
folders	B-User_Interface_Element
when	O
you	O
hover	O
over	O

,	O
and	O
cancels	O

&	O
undoes	O

expansion	O

to	O
come	O
,	O

ca	O

even	O

to	O

)	O
.	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
7930740	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/7930740/	O

You	O
do	O
have	O
a	O
complex	O
scenario	O
here	O
so	O
this	O
will	O
start	O
basic	O
in	O
hopes	O
of	O
giving	O
you	O
a	O
direction	O
and	O
hopefully	O
a	O
solution	O
.	O

The	O
framework	O
will	O
only	O
inform	O
of	O
a	O
DragEnter	O
event	O
if	O
the	O
control	O
is	O
marked	O
with	O
AllowDrop	B-Code_Block
=	I-Code_Block
true	I-Code_Block
.	O

So	O
make	O
sure	O
you	O
've	O
done	O
that	O
.	O

It	O
sounds	O
like	O
you	O
have	O
but	O
I	O
just	O
want	O
to	O
be	O
sure	O
.	O

I	O
'm	O
not	O
sure	O
why	O
you	O
need	O
the	O
DragLeave	O
event	O
but	O
if	O
it	O
's	O
to	O
grab	O
the	O
selected	O
data	O
the	O
easiest	O
way	O
to	O
get	O
the	O
data	O
is	O
not	O
to	O
hook	O
into	O
DragLeave	O
but	O
to	O
hook	O
into	O
PreviewMouseMove	O
.	O

You	O
can	O
then	O
determine	O
if	O
the	O
mouse	O
is	O
pressed	O
and	O
how	O
far	O
of	O
a	O
distance	O
to	O
move	O
before	O
enacting	O
a	O
DoDragDrop	O
.	O

In	O
this	O
event	O
,	O
you	O
also	O
have	O
the	O
ability	O
to	O
add	O
and	O
analyze	O
Drag	O
Data	O
.	O

When	O
the	O
drag	O
starts	O
you	O
can	O
create	O
a	O
new	O
DataObject	O
and	O
send	O
it	O
with	O
the	O
DoDragDrop	O
call	O
:	O

4305676	O

Similar	O
to	O
MAW	O
's	O
answer	O
,	O
except	O
I	O
would	O
use	O
a	O
Windows	O
Service	O
instead	O
of	O
a	O
command	O
line	O
app	O
(	O
no	O
GUI	O
)	O
,	O
and	O
split	O
out	O
the	O
individual	O
DB	O
scripts	O
into	O
separate	O
tasks	O
within	O
the	O
Service	O
so	O
that	O
they	O
can	O
if	O
necessary	O
be	O
called	O
at	O
different	O
time	O
intervals	O
,	O
log	O
their	O
results	O
separately	O
,	O
and	O
be	O
independently	O
configured	O
.	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
4305676	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/4305676/	O

This	O
depends	O
greatly	O
on	O
your	O
DBMS	O
.	O

In	O
SQL	O
Server	O
there	O
are	O
scheduled	O
jobs	O
which	O
can	O
run	O
any	O
combination	O
of	O
stored	O
procedures/commands	O
on	O
a	O
schedule	O
,	O
similar	O
to	O
Windows	O
scheduled	O
tasks	O
.	O

Since	O
you	O
've	O
tagged	O
this	O
question	O
with	O
mysql	O
,	O
I	O
'll	O
assume	O
thats	O
what	O
your	O
running	O
.	O

One	O
way	O
to	O
do	O
this	O
on	O
mysql	O
is	O
:	O

http://dev.mysql.com/tech-resources/articles/event-feature.html	O

If	O
all	O
else	O
fails	O
,	O
you	O
can	O
reference	O
all	O
of	O
these	O
scripts	O
in	O
a	O
stored	O
procedure	O
,	O
than	O
create	O
a	O
simple	O
command	O
line	O
program	O
which	O
would	O
connect	O
to	O
that	O
db	O
and	O
call	O
that	O
procedure	O
.	O

Then	O
schedule	O
that	O
program	O
with	O
Windows	O
Task	O
scheduler	O
or	O
similar	O
.	O

a	O

on	O

.	O

you	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_7029	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

CASE	B-Code_Block
expressions	O
are	O
evaluated	O
in	O
order	O
from	O
top	O
to	O
bottom	O
and	O
resolve	O
to	O
the	O
first	O
WHEN	O
condition	O
that	O
is	O
met	O
,	O
so	O
if	O
both	O
B	O
and	O
LK	O
are	O
active	O
,	O
then	O
the	O
first	O
condition	O
will	O
be	O
met	O
,	O
the	O
first	O
result	O
will	O
be	O
returned	O
,	O
and	O
it	O
wo	O
n't	O
matter	O
that	O
the	O
other	O
two	O
conditions	O
are	O
also	O
both	O
true	O
.	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block

If	O
you	O
right-click	O
on	O
the	O
interface	O
and	O
choose	O
implement	O
interface	O
,	O
it	O
will	O
do	O

for	O
you	O
,	O

the	O
way	O
you	O
have	O
the	O
interface	O
designed	O

it	O
wont	O
match	O
the	O
interface	O
's	O
definition	O
.	O

make	O
them	O
match	O
,	O
you	O
can	O
do	O
the	O
following	O
(	O
now	O
the	O
implementation	O
will	O
match	O
the	O
signature	O
of	O
the	O
interface	O
)	O
:	O

Question_ID	O
:	O
41443520	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/41443520/	O

Given	O
three	O
major	O
competing	O
applications	O
each	O
implementing	O
a	O
slightly	O
different	O
data	O
schema	O
for	O
the	O
same	O
problem	O
domain	O
,	O
I	O
am	O
faced	O
with	O
the	O
task	O
of	O
implementing	O
:	O

a	O
"	O
canonical	O
"	O
data	O
schema	O
expressive	O
enough	O
to	O
represent	O
something	O
like	O
the	O
intersection	O
set	O
of	O
features	O
of	O
all	O
3	O
applications	O
as	O
well	O
as	O
additional	O
details	O
(	O
meta	O
data	O
)	O

converters	O
for	O
doing	O
(	O
bidirectional	O
)	O
data	O
exchange	O
between	O
those	O
3	O
applications	O
and	O
the	O
canonical	O
schema	O

How	O
I	O
currently	O
approach	O
the	O
task	O

The	O
canonical	O
schema	O
is	O
defined	O
using	O
XSD	O
and	O
closely	O
resembles	O
the	O
data	O
schema	O
of	O
one	O
of	O
the	O
3	O
applications	O
,	O
let	O
's	O
call	O
it	O
A	O
.	O

This	O
renders	O
data	O
exchange	O
with	O
A	O
trivial	O
.	O

In	O
order	O
to	O
allow	O
for	O
a	O
bidirectional	O
data	O
exchange	O
with	O
applications	O
B	O
and	O
C	O
(	O
create	O
some	O
state	O
in	O
A	O
,	O
load	O
it	O
into	O
B	O
,	O
alter	O
it	O
in	O
B	O
,	O
load	O
the	O
altered	O
state	O
into	O
A	O
)	O
,	O
I	O
try	O
to	O
map	O
simples	O
states	O
in	O
A	O
onto	O
more	O
complex	O
states	O
in	O
B/C	O
which	O
can	O
be	O
identified	O
and	O
deconstructed	O
in	O
the	O
reverse	O
mapping	O
.	O

Why	O
I	O
want	O
to	O
change	O
my	O
approach	O

Most	O
of	O
the	O
schema	O
mappings	O
are	O
pretty	O
trivial	O
(	O
the	O
name	O
of	O
an	O
object	O
in	O
A	O
simply	O
maps	O
to	O
the	O
name	O
of	O
the	O
object	O
in	O
B	O
)	O
,	O
so	O
I	O
would	O
like	O
to	O
avoid	O
writing	O
a	O
lot	O
of	O
trivial	O
code	O
by	O
hand	O
.	O

I	O
imagine	O
that	O
this	O
trivial	O
code	O
could	O
be	O
generated	O
given	O
a	O
formalized	O
mapping	O
between	O
the	O
data	O
schemes	O
.	O

For	O
the	O
nontrivial	O
parts	O
of	O
the	O
mapping	O
(	O
like	O
the	O
one	O
desribed	O
above	O
)	O
,	O
I	O
expect	O
lots	O
of	O
changes	O
in	O
the	O
future	O
simply	O
because	O
it	O
seems	O
so	O
arbitrary	O
.	O

In	O
many	O
cases	O
a	O
specific	O
convention	O
for	O
mapping	O
states	O
in	O
A	O
onto	O
more	O
complex	O
states	O
in	O
B/C	O
might	O
run	O
into	O
a	O
dead	O
end	O
at	O
some	O
point	O
.	O

For	O
example	O
it	O
might	O
become	O
necessary	O
for	O
users	O
to	O
change	O
the	O
"	O
mirrored	O
subspace	O
"	O
label	O
and	O
therefore	O
another	O
approach	O
for	O
identifying	O
conversion	O
artifacts	O
might	O
be	O
necessary	O
.	O

I	O
imagine	O
that	O
a	O
formalized	O
mapping	O
could	O
be	O
a	O
tool	O
to	O
transparently	O
manage	O
those	O
conventions	O
.	O

Maybe	O
a	O
reasoner	O
could	O
even	O
automatically	O
spot	O
incoherent	O
,	O
inconsistent	O
mappings	O
.	O

It	O
might	O
also	O
allow	O
me	O
to	O
more	O
easily	O
discuss	O
the	O
mapping	O
with	O
domain	O
experts	O
and	O
users	O
.	O

Questions	O

From	O
what	O
I	O
read	O
about	O
ontologies	O
I	O
have	O
the	O
impression	O
that	O
what	O
I	O
want	O
is	O
an	O
ontology	O
.	O

Is	O
this	O
correct	O
?	O

As	O
I	O
understand	O
it	O
,	O
using	O
an	O
ontology	O
to	O
describe	O
the	O
mapping	O
would	O
also	O
require	O
me	O
to	O
express	O
the	O
data	O
schemes	O
themselves	O
in	O
the	O
ontology	O
(	O
so	O
a	O
relation	O
"	O
maps	O
to	O
"	O
can	O
reference	O
a	O
type	O
from	O
A	O
and	O
a	O
type	O
from	O
B	O
)	O
.	O

Since	O
those	O
schemes	O
are	O
taken	O
from	O
long-lived	O
applications	O
,	O
they	O
are	O
not	O
always	O
coherent	O
.	O

For	O
example	O
,	O
a	O
"	O
feature	O
"	O
in	O
the	O
application	O
might	O

to	O

semantic	O

you	O
would	O
expect	O
from	O
the	O
semantics	O
of	O
its	O
constituents	O
.	O

existing	O
tools	O
help	O
me	O

?	O

expect	O
that	O

would	O

some	O
additional	O

something	O

-	O

between	O

"	O

is	O
my	O

on	O
stackexchange	O
,	O

a	O

I	O
have	O

been	O
able	O
to	O
find	O
a	O
solution	O
to	O
with	O
numerous	O
hours	O
spent	O
on	O
Google	O
.	O

I	O
need	O
to	O
get	O
results	O
from	O
a	O
.do	O
page	O
:	O

http://webapps2.rrc.state.tx.us/EWA/productionQueryAction.do	O

The	O
url	O
remains	O
static	O
when	O
a	O
large	O
query	O
e.g	O
is	O
submitted	O
-	O
I	O
cannot	O
alter	O
my	O
query	O
by	O
changing	O
the	O
url	O
.	O

Once	O
submitted	O
,	O
it	O
takes	O
a	O
long	O
time	O
to	O
load	O
,	O
and	O
after	O
loading	O
,	O
a	O
table	B-User_Interface_Element
of	O
results	O
is	O
presented	O
.	O

I	O
then	O
require	O
all	O
the	O
data	O
to	O
be	O
on	O
one	O
page	O
so	O
I	O
select	O
'	O
View	O
All	O
'	O
as	O
the	O
page	O
size	O
from	O
the	O
drop	B-User_Interface_Element
down	I-User_Interface_Element
menu	I-User_Interface_Element
on	O
the	O
top	O
left	O
of	O
the	O
table	B-User_Interface_Element
to	O
obtain	O
the	O
following	O
page	O
(	O
which	O
has	O
many	O
more	O
rows	B-User_Interface_Element
than	O
displayed	O
here	O
)	O

Finally	O
,	O
to	O
then	O
import	O
this	O
data	O
,	O
I	O
open	O
a	O
spreadsheet	B-User_Interface_Element
and	O
copy-paste	O
it	O
all	O
in	O
.	O

Even	O
for	O
one	O
county/query/submission	O
,	O
this	O
process	O
is	O
extremely	O
tedious	O
,	O
and	O
I	O
have	O
to	O
do	O
this	O
monthly	O
for	O
about	O
20	O
counties	O
,	O
then	O
a	O
further	O
10	O
districts	O
.	O

Due	O
to	O
the	O
long	O
load	O
time	O
associated	O
with	O
the	O
return	O
of	O
each	O
query	O
,	O
this	O
is	O
a	O
task	O
that	O
easily	O
takes	O
2-3	O
hours	O
to	O
complete	O
.	O

As	O
such	O
,	O
I	O
am	O
hoping	O
someone	O
here	O
has	O
some	O
kind	O
of	O
solution	O
to	O
automate/ease	O
the	O
process	O
,	O
or	O
even	O
simply	O
advice	O
as	O
to	O
where	O
I	O
can	O
find	O
information	O
to	O
create	O
a	O
solution	O
myself	O
.	O

If	O
I	O
could	O
directly	O
query	O
the	O
database	O
import	O
the	O
data	O
into	O
a	O
spreadsheet	B-User_Interface_Element
,	O
my	O
problem	O
would	O
be	O
solved	O
.	O

The	O
load	O
times	O
are	O
irrelevant	O
if	O
the	O
entire	O
process	O
of	O
querying	O
the	O
server	O
can	O
be	O

as	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block

code	I-Code_Block

annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

hope	O

are	O

an	O
issue	O
with	O
the	O
Database	O
taking	O
the	O
time	O
to	O
generate	O
the	O
results	O
.	O

If	O
this	O
is	O
the	O
case	O
,	O
do	O
you	O
know	O
if	O
there	O
are	O
any	O
indexes	O
on	O
the	O
database	O
being	O
queried	O
?	O

you	O
are	O

data	O
across	O
multiple	O

(	O

.	O

cut	O

of	O

I	O
have	O
an	O
EF	B-Library
model	O
where	O
I	O
logically	O
have	O
a	O
"	O
template	O
"	O
type	O
and	O
an	O
"	O
instance	O
of	O
the	O
template	O
type	O
"	O

Basically	O
my	O
templates	O
are	O
like	O
a	O
work	O
flow	O
and	O
the	O
instances	O
are	O
those	O
templates	O
applied	O
to	O
an	O
object	O
.	O

The	O
association	O
is	O
that	O
a	O
template	O
has	O
zero	O
to	O
many	O
instances	O
,	O
an	O
instance	O
is	O
always	O
based	O
on	O
a	O
template	O
.	O

For	O
example	O
the	O
template	O
may	O
be	O
"	O
send	O
letter	O
"	O
which	O
gets	O
applied	O
to	O
a	O
customer	O
to	O
create	O
an	O
instance	O
of	O
the	O
letter	O
sent	O
,	O
which	O
includes	O
the	O
date	O
sent	O
,	O
the	O
pdf	O
of	O
the	O
letter	O
etc	O
.	O

The	O
templates	O
have	O
a	O
few	O
subclasses/types	O
which	O
will	O
always	O
match	O
an	O
instance	O
which	O
also	O
has	O
a	O
corresponding	O
subclass	O
.	O

The	O
issue	O
is	O
how	O
can	O
I	O
ensure	O
that	O
when	O
I	O
create	O
an	O
instance	O
(	O
which	O
will	O
have	O
a	O
reference	O
to	O
the	O
template	O
)	O
that	O
the	O
instance	O
is	O
of	O
the	O
correct	O
inherited	O
type	O
.	O

For	O
example	O
if	O
the	O
template	O
is	O
of	O
type	O
TemplateType2	O
(	O
inherits	O
from	O
template	O
)	O
and	O
I	O
add	O
an	O
instance	O
to	O
loan1	O
.	O
.	O
loan1.TemplateInstances.add(foo)	O
…	O
I	O
want	O
to	O
ensure	O
that	O
foo	O
is	O
of	O
type	O
InstanceType2	O
.	O

The	O
way	O
I	O
am	O
doing	O
it	O
now	O
seems	O
like	O
such	O
a	O
hack	O
.	O

I	O
am	O
storing	O

instance	O
entity	O

the	O

.	O

It	O

but	O

basically	O
using	O
the	O
value	O
of	O
a	O
property	O
to	O
do	O
mapping	O
,	O
exposing	O
the	O
possibility	O
of	O
all	O
sorts	O

errors	O
if	O
they	O
do	O
not	O
match	O
the	O
name	O
of	O

name	O
,	O

they	O

name	O
.	O

Any	O
ideas	O
or	O
thoughts	O
how	O
to	O
tackle	O
this	O
issue	O
?	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
2892716	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/2892716/	O

This	O
kind	O
of	O
syntax	O
is	O
really	O
the	O
target	O
for	O
pyparsing	B-Library
.	O

The	O
basic	O
format	O
is	O
simple	O
enough	O
,	O
and	O
in	O
pyparsing	B-Library
,	O
it	O
looks	O
like	O
:	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_558	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

But	O
once	O
you	O
start	O
to	O
add	O
arithmetic	O
expressions	O
,	O
and	O
boolean	O
operations	O
and	O
support	O
for	O
'	O
and	B-Code_Block
'	O
and	O
'	O
or	B-Code_Block
'	O
operators	O
,	O
things	O
get	O
complicated	O
.	O

Also	O
,	O
this	O
is	O
a	O
recursive	O
grammar	O
,	O
since	O
an	O
action	O
can	O
itself	O
be	O
a	O
nested	O
decision	O
.	O

Pyparsing	B-Library
has	O
built-in	O
support	O
that	O
simplifies	O
definition	O
of	O
arithmetic	O
and	O
boolean	O
expressions	O
,	O
including	O
precedence	O
of	O
operations	O
and	O
gruping	O
in	O
parentheses	O
,	O
plus	O
recursive	O
expressions	O
.	O

Here	O
is	O
the	O
pyparsing	B-Library
grammar	O
in	O
various	O
pieces	O
.	O

First	O
here	O
are	O
some	O
of	O
the	O
basic	O
parsing	O
elements	O
:	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_559	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

The	O
parse	O
action	O
attached	O
to	O
the	O
number	O
expression	O
will	O
automatically	O
convert	O
the	O
parsed	O
number	O
to	O
a	O
float	O
value	O
at	O
parse	O
time	O
.	O

The	O
Word	O
class	O
takes	O
two	O
strings	O
:	O
a	O
string	O
containing	O
all	O
valid	O
leading	O
characters	O
,	O
and	O
a	O
string	O
of	O
all	O
valid	O
body	O
characters	O
.	O

This	O
varname	O
definition	O
supports	O
variable	O
names	O
similar	O
to	O
Python	O
identifiers	O
.	O

Pyparsing	B-Library
has	O
the	O
operatorPrecedence	O
method	O
that	O
takes	O
an	O
expression	O
for	O
the	O
basic	O
operand	O
definition	O
,	O
and	O
a	O
list	O
of	O
tuples	O
to	O
define	O
each	O
level	O
of	O
operators	O
:	O
an	O
expression	O
for	O
the	O
operators	O
,	O
an	O
integer	O
whether	O
the	O
operator	O
is	O
unary	O
,	O
binary	O
,	O
or	O
ternary	O
,	O
and	O
whether	O
left	O
-	O
or	O
right-associative	O
.	O

operatorPrecedence	O
takes	O
care	O
of	O
the	O
recursive	O
definition	O
of	O
arithmetic	O
expressions	O
nested	O
in	O
parentheses	O
.	O

This	O
expression	O
defines	O
basic	O
4-function	O
math	O
:	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_560	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

Now	O
here	O
is	O
the	O
definition	O
of	O
a	O
boolean	O
condition	O
(	O
which	O
we	O
'll	O
eventually	O
use	O
to	O
define	O
the	O
decision	O
question	O
)	O
:	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_561	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

Your	O
definition	O
of	O
actions	O
was	O
a	O
little	O
sketchy	O
,	O
so	O
I	O
made	O
up	O
some	O
possible	O
statements	O
:	O
an	O
assignment	O
statement	O
,	O
a	O
print	O
statement	O
,	O
and	O
since	O
this	O
is	O
a	O
speech	O
application	O
,	O
a	O
say	O
statement	O
which	O
is	O
very	O
simliar	O
to	O
print	O
.	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_562	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

In	O
addition	O
to	O
the	O
expression	O
definitions	O
,	O
you	O
'll	O
notice	O
that	O
some	O
expressions	O
are	O
followed	O
by	O
a	O
quoted	O
string	O
,	O
as	O
if	O
the	O
expression	O
is	O
a	O
function	O
being	O
called	O
with	O
that	O
string	O
.	O

In	O
fact	O
,	O
this	O
"	O
call	O
"	O
actually	O
returns	O
a	O
copy	O
of	O
the	O
expression	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
matched	O
tokens	O
are	O
tagged	O
with	O
that	O
name	O
.	O

These	O
results	O
names	O
are	O
very	O
helpful	O
at	O
post-parsing	O
time	O
at	O
picking	O
out	O
the	O
individual	O
matching	O
elements	O
(	O
similar	O
to	O
named	O
groups	O
in	O
regular	O
expressions	O
)	O
.	O

Finally	O
,	O
to	O
put	O
these	O
pieces	O
together	O
into	O
your	O
decision	O
expression	O
,	O
here	O
are	O

It	O
's	O
pretty	O
simple	O
.	O

CurrentCulture	O
is	O
the	O
culture	O
assigned	O
for	O
thread	O
to	O
be	O
used	O
in	O
various	O
culture-specific	O
methods	O
.	O

To	O
example	O
,	O
ToString()	O
one	O
.	O

CurrentUICulture	O
is	O

By	O
setting	O
both	O
you	O
ensure	O
what	O
all	O
ToString()	O
works	O
correctly	O
and	O
your	O
form	O
resources	O
are	O
loaded	O
from	O
appropriate	O
satellite	O
.	O

Regarding	O
usage	O
,	O
you	O
may	O
think	O
to	O
provide	O
user	O
with	O
option	O
to	O
change	O
language	O
.	O

To	O
example	O
,	O
I	O
have	O
native	O
German	O
windows	O
,	O
but	O
I	O
set	O
English	O
culture	O
in	O
it	O
(	O
date	O
format	O
and	O
default	O
culture	O
for	O
console	O
applications	O
)	O
,	O
while	O
I	O
speak	O
Russian	O
.	O

Which	O
language	O
do	O
you	O
think	O
I	O
will	O
chose	O
when	O
using	O
your	O
software	O
?	O

=P	O

By	O
default	O
,	O
either	O
take	O
language	O
chosen	O
in	O
installer	O
(	O
if	O
you	O
have	O
installer	O
in	O
multiple	O
languages	O
and	O
options	O
to	O
change	O
it	O
there	O
)	O
or	O
current	O
Windows	O
user	O
language	O
preferences	O
.	O

One	O
possible	O
scenario	O
:	O

Preconditions	O
:	O
application	O
is	O
already	O
localized	O
,	O
satellites	O
are	O
there	O
(	O
if	O
not	O
,	O
read	O
this	O
)	O
.	O

I	O
do	O
n't	O
like	O
satellites	O
myself	O
,	O
but	O
they	O
are	O
easy	O
to	O
start	O
with	O
.	O

When	O
application	O
starts	O
,	O
you	O
create	O
a	O
list	B-Data_Structure
of	O
available	O
languages	O
(	O
either	O
statically	O
or	O
by	O
enumerating	O
satellites	O
)	O
.	O

:	I-Code_Block

info	O
available	O
here	O
-	O

From	O
:	O
http://blog.phusion.nl/2008/12/16/passing-environment-variables-to-ruby-from-phusion-passenger/	O

But	O
wait	O
,	O
I	O
've	O
already	O
set	O
environment	O
variables	O
in	O
my	O
/etc/bashrc	B-File_Name
or	O
/etc/profile	B-File_Name
.	O

Why	O
do	O

they	O
work	O
?	O

If	O
you	O
've	O
set	O
environment	O
variables	O
in	O
your	O
/etc/bashrc	B-File_Name
or	O
/etc/profile	B-File_Name
,	I-File_Name
then	O
these	O
environment	O
variables	O
are	O
made	O
available	O
in	O
your	O
shell	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
on	O
most	O
operating	O
systems	O
,	O
Apache	O
is	O
not	O
started	O
from	O
the	O
shell	O
and	O
does	O
not	O
load	O
environment	O
variables	O
defined	O
in	O
bashrc/profile	B-File_Name
,	O
which	O
is	O
why	O
setting	O
environment	O
variables	O
in	O
/etc/bashrc	B-File_Name
and	O
/etc/profile	B-File_Name
usually	O
has	O
no	O
effect	O
on	O
Apache	O
(	O
and	O
by	O
induction	O
,	O
on	O
Passenger	O
and	O
Rails	B-Library
processes	O
)	O
.	O

:	O

:	O

Depending	O
if	O
you	O
want	O
it	O
to	O

on	O
page	B-User_Interface_Element
load	O
or	O

in	O

:	O
38259499	O

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/38259499/	O

If	O
you	O
install	O
through	O
the	O
package	O
manager	O
,	O
you	O
're	O
going	O
to	O
get	O
an	O
older	O
version	O
.	O

Whether	O
or	O
not	O
that	O
matters	O
is	O
up	O
to	O
you	O
.	O

There	O
are	O
benefits	O
to	O
installing	O
everything	O
through	O
the	O
package	O
manager	O
;	O
namely	O
,	O
it	O
becomes	O
easy	O
to	O
keep	O
your	O
entire	O
system	O
up-to-date	O
(	O
by	O
Ubuntu	O
's	O
definition	O
of	O
up-to-date	O
)	O
.	O

There	O
are	O
also	O
obvious	O
benefits	O
to	O
following	O
a	O
given	O
piece	O
of	O
software	O
's	O
instructions	O
.	O

Personally	O
,	O
if	O
I	O
were	O
sharing	O
code	O
with	O
other	O
developers	O
who	O
use	O
composer	O
,	O
I	O
'd	O
install	O
composer	O
through	O
the	O
'	O
recommended	O
'	O
way	O
and	O
try	O
to	O
keep	O
it	O
up	O
to	O
date	O
by	O
checking	O
periodically	O
for	O
new	O
versions	O
on	O
the	O
website	O
.	O

That	O
way	O
we	O
'd	O
all	O
be	O
using	O
the	O
same	O
version	O
.	O

:	O
23629090	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/23629090/	O

That	O
is	O
once	O
execution	O
reaches	O
the	O
first	O
await	B-Code_Block
,	O
execution	O
is	O
effectively	O
"	O
paused	O
"	O
and	O
will	O
not	O
resume	O
until	O
that	O
Task	O
is	O
complete	O
.	O

You	O
can	O
avoid	O
this	O
by	O
not	O
awaiting	O
the	O
Task	O
,	O
just	O
add	O
it	O
to	O
a	O
list	B-Data_Structure
of	O
tasks	O
to	O
keep	O
track	O
of	O
.	O

To	O
facilitate	O
this	O
I	O
think	O
it	O
will	O
help	O
if	O
you	O
introduced	O
a	O
couple	O
of	O
helper	O
methods	O
to	O
execute	O
the	O
body	O
of	O
your	O
loops	O
and	O
return	O
a	O
Task	O
.	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_3234	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

Then	O
in	O
your	O
main	O
loop	O
you	O
just	O
add	O
the	O
tasks	O
to	O
a	O
list	B-Data_Structure
as	O
the	O
methods	O
are	O
kicked	O
off	O
,	O
this	O
will	O
essentially	O
execute	O
the	O
tasks	O
in	O
parallel	O
.	O

You	O
may	O
need	O
to	O
increase	O
the	O
number	O
of	O
concurrent	O
connections	O
your	O
server	O
can	O
make	O
if	O
it	O
causes	O
a	O
problem	O
.	O

Your	O
main	O
method	O
then	O
becomes	O
.	O

MIN	O
media	O
queries	O
.	O

Therefore	O
,	O
instead	O
of	O
using	O
graceful	O
degradation	O
,	O
I	O
aim	O
to	O
implement	O
progressive	O
enhancement	O

Can	O
anyone	O
explain	O
the	O
best	O
way	O
to	O
re-engineer	O
my	O
CSS	O
to	O
use	O
MIN-width	O
media	O
queries	O
as	O
opposed	O
to	O
MAX-width	O
?	O

In	O
the	O
example	O
below	O
I	O
have	O
trimmed	O
out	O
95%	O
of	O
the	O
css	O
and	O
have	O
left	O
the	O
breakpoints	O

//	O
------------------------------MAIN	O
CSS	O

:	I-Code_Block

@media	B-Code_Block
MIN-width	I-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block

Min-width	O
media	O
queries	O
are	O
very	O
easy	O
,	O
to	O
use	O
,	O
and	O
are	O
not	O
too	O
different	O
from	O
using	O
MAX	O
media	O
queries	O
.	O

Here	O
is	O
an	O
example	O
using	O
your	O
code	O
:	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_3780	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

It	O
is	O
important	O
to	O
still	O
use	O
max-width	O
to	O
create	O
limits	O
for	O
the	O
style	O
of	O
objects	O
on	O
certain	O
screens	O
.	O

Using	O
min-width	O
can	O
be	O
especially	O
useful	O
if	O
you	O
want	O
certain	O
styles	O
to	O
apply	O
to	O
a	O
smaller	O
object	O
and	O
then	O
have	O
that	O
same	O
style	O
apply	O
to	O
a	O
larger	O
object	O
.	O

This	O
way	O
you	O
can	O
keep	O
the	O
styles	O
for	O
that	O
minimum	O
size	O
but	O
also	O
add	O
on	O
extra	O
styles	O
to	O
the	O
larger	O
object	O
with	O
out	O
effecting	O
the	O
smaller	O
one	O
.	O

For	O
example	O
:	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_3781	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

In	O
the	O
above	O
example	O
,	O
the	O
styles	O
from	O
screens	O
with	O
a	O
size	O
of	O
over	O
740px	O
will	O
already	O
be	O
applied	O
to	O
any	O
screens	O
with	O
a	O
size	O
of	O
over	O
900px	O
.	O

From	O
there	O
you	O
can	O
adjust	O
your	O
styles	O
as	O
you	O
like	O
,	O
reducing	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
code	O
needed	O
to	O
produce	O
the	O
page	O
.	O

Other	O
Things	O
:	O

-When	O
it	O
comes	O
to	O
actual	O
elements	O
on	O
the	O
screen	O
(	O
excluding	O
min/max	O
-sizes	O
with	O
@media	B-Code_Block
)	O
it	O
can	O
always	O
be	O
helpful	O
to	O
use	O
percentages	O
,	O
because	O
that	O
way	O
items	O
can	O
be	O
auto	O
re-sized	O
according	O
to	O
the	O
screen	O
size	O
.	O

-Here	O
is	O
a	O
great	O
website	O
that	O
will	O
help	O
you	O
on	O
your	O
endeavours	O
with	O
media	O
queries	O
:	O
http://css-tricks.com/snippets/css/media-queries-for-standard-devices/	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
27283346	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/27283346/	O

It	O
totally	O
depends	O
on	O
the	O
rest	O
of	O
your	O
site	O
.	O

Some	O
sites	O
can	O
be	O
displayed	O
well	O
at	O
the	O
width	O
of	O
400px	O
while	O
some	O
others	O
need	O
to	O
set	O
a	O
minumum	O
because	O
it	O
's	O
too	O
small	O
to	O
render	O
the	O
document	O
objects	O
in	O
a	O
clean	O
manner	O
.	O

Very	O
often	O
you	O
will	O
not	O
even	O
need	O
to	O
use	O
min-width	O
or	O
max-width	O
when	O
optimizing	O
for	O
mobile	O
,	O
there	O
are	O
far	O
more	O
better	O
practices	O
.	O

Here	O
are	O
some	O
of	O
them	O
:	O

Use	O
Em	O
over	O
Px	O
-	O
It	O
is	O
always	O
better	O
to	O
set	O
font-size	O
and	O
other	O
sizes	O
in	O
units	O
of	O
"	O
em	O
"	O
rather	O
than	O
in	O
"	O
px	O
"	O
.	O

This	O
is	O
because	O
a	O
pixel	O
is	O
extremely	O
small	O
on	O
a	O
cell	O
phone	O
,	O
whereas	O
em	O
units	O
proportionally	O
adjusts	O
the	O
object	O
to	O
a	O
size	O
that	O
fits	O
the	O
screen	O
.	O

Use	O
Percentages	O
-	O
You	O
'll	O
find	O
that	O
using	O
percentages	O
are	O
far	O
more	O
friendly	O
than	O
,	O
for	O
instance	O
,	O
specifying	O
the	O
width	O
or	O
height	O
of	O
an	O
element	O
in	O
pixels	O
or	O
em	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
use	O
percentages	O
,	O
your	O
content	O
will	O
always	O
adjust	O
well	O
in	O
for	O
skinny	O
displays	O
.	O

Avoid	O
Absolutely	O
Positioned	O
Elements	O
-	O
Having	O
elements	O
positioned	O
absolutely	O
can	O
be	O
more	O
difficuly	O
to	O
handle	O
on	O
small	O
displays	O
.	O

It	O
simply	O
can	O
,	O
as	O
the	O
absolute	O
elements	O
may	O
get	O
too	O
near	O
to	O
the	O
relatively	O
positioned	O
elements	O
.	O

Use	O
relative	O
positioning	O
as	O
much	O
as	O
possible	O
for	O
a	O
clean	O
site	O
.	O

I	O
have	O
a	O
fixed	O
menu	B-User_Interface_Element
,	O
which	O

with	O
scrolling	O
.	O

I	O
want	O
to	O
add	O
dynamically	O
another	O
div	O
before	O
this	O
menu	B-User_Interface_Element
,	O
it	O
is	O
supposed	O
to	O
disappear	O
once	O
clicked	O
.	O

It	O
should	O
stick	O
to	O
the	O
moving	O
menu	B-User_Interface_Element
.	O

I	O
tried	O
to	O
prepend	O
it	O
to	O
body	O
with	O
position	O
fixed	O
-	O
it	O
was	O
over	O
the	O
menu	B-User_Interface_Element
.	O

I	O
prepend	O
it	O
to	O
the	O
menu	B-User_Interface_Element
,	O
the	O
result	O

21818346	O

You	O
can	O
usually	O
create	O
a	O
new	O
,	O
sanitised	O
,	O
table	O
,	O
depending	O
on	O
the	O
actual	O
DB	O
server	O
you	O
are	O
using	O
.	O

The	O
hard	O
thing	O
is	O
that	O
if	O
there	O
are	O
other	O
tables	O
in	O
the	O
database	O
,	O
you	O
may	O
have	O
issues	O
with	O
foreign	O
keys	O
,	O
indexes	O
,	O
etc	O
which	O
will	O
refer	O
to	O
the	O
original	O
table	O
.	O

Whether	O
making	O
a	O
new	O
sanitised	O
table	O
will	O
be	O
quicker	O
than	O
updating	O
your	O
existing	O
table	O
is	O
something	O
you	O
can	O
only	O
tell	O
by	O
trying	O
it	O
.	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
21818346	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/21818346/	O

Dump	O
the	O
pk/clustered	O
key	O
of	O
all	O
the	O
records	O
you	O
want	O
to	O
update	O
into	O
a	O
temp	O
table	O
.	O

Then	O
perform	O
the	O
update	O
joining	O
to	O
the	O
temp	O
table	O
.	O

That	O
will	O
ensure	O
the	O
lowest	O
locking	O
level	O
and	O
quickest	O
access	O
.	O

You	O
can	O
also	O
add	O
an	O
identity	O
column	B-Data_Structure
to	O
the	O
temp	O
table	O
,	O
than	O
you	O
can	O
loop	O
through	O
and	O
do	O
the	O
updates	O
in	O
batches	O
.	O

Using	O
CakePHP	B-Library
I	O
have	O

.	O

a	O
record	O

'm	O
trying	O
to	O

a	O

to	O
submit	O

a	O

"	O

All	O
"	O
button	B-User_Interface_Element
.	O

,	O
all	O

have	O

,	O

idea	O
was	O
to	O

some	O
kind	O
of	O

I	O
have	O
a	O

:	O
9358136	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/9358136/	O

You	O
set	O
the	O
header	B-User_Interface_Element
to	O
white-space	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
nowrap	I-Code_Block
;	I-Code_Block
therefore	O
,	O
the	O
browser	O
is	O
unable	O
to	O
break	O
the	O
headers	B-User_Interface_Element
,	O
so	O
the	O
width	O
of	O
the	O
table	B-User_Interface_Element
will	O
be	O
bigger	O
than	O
the	O
container	O
div	O
.	O

You	O
can	O
set	O
,	O
overflow	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
hidden	I-Code_Block
;	I-Code_Block
to	O
cut	O
the	O
overflowing	O
parts	O
,	O
or	O
overflow	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
auto	I-Code_Block
;	I-Code_Block
to	O
create	O
a	O
scrollbar	B-User_Interface_Element
,	O
but	O
without	O
them	O
it	O
's	O
the	O
correct	O
rendering	O
.	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
9358136	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/9358136/	O

There	O
are	O
two	O
solutions	O
.	O

i)	O
IF	O
you	O
want	O
to	O
STRICTLY	O
contain	O
table	B-User_Interface_Element
WITHIN	O
div	O
then	O
overflow:auto	B-Code_Block
;	I-Code_Block
is	O
the	O
way	O
to	O
go	O
.	O

ii)	O
BUT	O
if	O
you	O
change	O
your	O
mind	O
and	O
want	O
to	O
WRAP	O
div	O
to	O
the	O
width	O
of	O
table	B-User_Interface_Element
then	O
.	O

display:table	B-Code_Block
;	I-Code_Block
is	O
the	O
way	O
to	O
go	O
.	O

Generally	O
its	O
bad	O
idea	O
to	O
contain	O
wider	O
element	O
within	O
explicitly	O
known	O
less	O
wider	O
element	O
.	O

Both	O
line	O
feed	O
(	O
^J	O
,	O
0x0a	O
)	O
and	O
carriage	O
return	O
(	O
^M	O
,	O
0x0d	O
)	O
are	O
used	O
as	O
line	O
separators	O
;	O
Unix	O
uses	O
the	O
first	O
,	O
(	O
old	O
)	O
Mac	O
the	O
latter	O
,	O
Windows	O
both	O
in	O
combination	O
(	O
CR-LF	O
)	O
.	O

Vim	O

What	O
Vim	O
detects	O
is	O
determined	O
by	O
the	O
'	O
fileformats	O
'	O
option	O
.	O

can	O
make	O
it	O
detect	O

as	O
well	O
via	O

The	O
first	O
problem	O
even	O
before	O
you	O
get	O
to	O
line	O
breaks	O
is	O
that	O
you	O
're	O
reading	O
bytes	O
and	O
then	O
treating	O
those	O
as	O
characters	O
.	O

You	O
're	O
effectively	O
assuming	O
an	O
encoding	O
of	O
ISO-8859-1	O
which	O
may	O
well	O
not	O
be	O
correct	O
.	O

You	O
should	O
be	O
using	O
an	O
InputStreamReader	O
instead	O
.	O

Then	O
there	O
's	O
the	O
issue	O
of	O
operating	O
systems	O
having	O
different	O
line	O
breaks.	O
.	O
use	O
BufferedReader.readLine()	O
to	O
read	O
a	O
line	O
in	O
a	O
way	O
that	O
handles	O
line	O
breaks	O
of	O
\n	O
,	O
\r	O
or	O
\r\n	O
.	O

So	O
your	O
code	O
would	O
become	O
:	O

svg	O
files	O
should	O
stretch	O
and	O
keep	O
proper	O
scaling	O
thus	O
looking	O
sharp	O
after	O
stretching	O
.	O

Now	O
with	O
svg	O
files	O
i	O
can	O
keep	O
all	O
my	O
images	B-User_Interface_Element
in	O
the	O
drawable	O
folder	O
instead	O
of	O
filtering	O
them	O
out	O
by	O
density	O
.	O

This	O
makes	O
the	O
apk	O
file	O
smaller	O
which	O
is	O
desirable	O
.	O

Question	O
:	O
Would	O
there	O
be	O
any	O
reason	O
i	O
would	O
not	O
want	O
to	O
take	O
my	O
current	O
PNG	O
images	B-User_Interface_Element
in	O
native	O
android	O
project	O
and	O
convert	O
them	O
to	O
svg	O
files	O
with	O
for	O
example	O
an	O
online	O
converter	O
tool	O
like	O
vector	O
magic	O
?	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
26823055	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/26823055/	O

There	O
are	O
several	O
reasons	O
that	O
you	O
would	O
not	O
want	O
to	O
do	O
this	O
.	O

First	O
,	O
vector	O
drawables	O
are	O
only	O
supported	O
on	O
Android	O
5.0	O
+	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
are	O
only	O
targeting	O
Lollipop	O
and	O
above	O
,	O
this	O
wo	O
n't	O
be	O
an	O
issue	O
,	O
but	O
you	O
will	O
still	O
need	O
PNGs	O
for	O
older	O
versions	O
of	O
Android	O
.	O

Second	O
,	O
converting	O
raster	O
to	O
vector	O
will	O
in	O
most	O
cases	O
yield	O
poor	O
results	O
.	O

Instead	O
,	O
you	O
should	O
start	O
by	O
creating	O
the	O
original	O
assets	O
as	O
vector	O
images	B-User_Interface_Element
in	O
a	O
program	O
like	O
Illustrator	O
.	O

Then	O
export	O
to	O
SVG	O
for	O
conversion	O
to	O
VectorDrawable	O
format	O
and	O
export	O
to	O
PNG	O
for	O
the	O
DPI	O
buckets	O
you	O
'd	O
like	O
to	O
support	O
on	O
pre-5.0	O
devices	O
.	O

If	O
your	O
column	B-Data_Structure
names	O
are	O
not	O
all-lowercase	O
,	O
you	O
must	O
specify	O
them	O
in	O
double	O
quotes	O
and	O
with	O
the	O
exact	O
same	O
capitalization	O
as	O
they	O
are	O
in	O
the	O
table	B-Data_Structure
:	O

SELECT	B-Code_Block
*	I-Code_Block
FROM	I-Code_Block
"	I-Code_Block
MockTable	I-Code_Block
"	I-Code_Block
WHERE	I-Code_Block
"	I-Code_Block
Hours	I-Code_Block
"	I-Code_Block
>	I-Code_Block
25	I-Code_Block
;	I-Code_Block

Note	O
this	O
says	O
"	B-Code_Block
Hours	I-Code_Block
"	I-Code_Block
instead	O
of	O
"	B-Code_Block
HOURS	I-Code_Block
"	I-Code_Block
.	O

For	O
this	O
reason	O
,	O
it	O
's	O
best	O
to	O
use	O
all-lowercase	O
for	O
your	O
column	B-Data_Structure
and	O
table	B-Data_Structure
names	O
.	O

In	O
addition	O
,	O
when	O
using	O
lowercase	O
you	O
wo	O
n't	O
need	O
to	O
put	O
the	O
double-quotes	O
around	O
the	O
column	B-Data_Structure
names	O
unless	O
they	O
are	O
a	O
reserved	O
word	O
that	O
might	O
mean	O
something	O
else	O
in	O
that	O
context	O
.	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
33091991	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/33091991/	O

When	O
you	O
compare	O
numbers	O
as	O
strings	O
,	O
you	O
have	O
to	O
think	O
about	O
alphabetical	O
order	O
.	O

The	O
magnitude	O
of	O
the	O
number	O
is	O
meaningless	O
,	O
at	O
this	O
point	O
is	O
merely	O
a	O
word	O
.	O

So	O
"	O
25	O
"	O
is	O
greater	O
than	O
"	O
100	O
"	O
because	O
the	O
"	O
2	O
"	O
comes	O
after	O
the	O
"	O
1	O
"	O
in	O
an	O
alphabetical	O
sense	O
.	O

What	O
you	O
need	O
to	O
do	O
is	O
either	O
cast	O
your	O
"	O
Hours	B-Code_Block
"	O
field	O
as	O
integer	O
(	O
or	O
fix	O
that	O
damned	O
table	B-Data_Structure
because	O
numbers	O
in	O
string	O
fields	O
is	O
nasty	O
)	O
.	O

)	I-Code_Block

and	O

:	O
23841820	O

Question_URL	O
:	O

You	O
can	O
install	O
an	O
unverified	O
app	O
on	O
mac	O
by	O
right-clicking	O
the	O
DMG	O
and	O
selecting	O
open	O
,	O
this	O
will	O
pop	O
up	O
a	O
warning	O
but	O
as	O
opposed	O
to	O
doubled	O
clicking	O
,	O
there	O
is	O
an	O
option	O
to	O
continue	O
.	O

See	O
this	O
article	O
for	O
screenshots	O
-	O
http://osxdaily.com/2012/07/27/app-cant-be-opened-because-it-is-from-an-unidentified-developer/	O

The	O
only	O
other	O
option	O
is	O
to	O
pay	O
Apple	O
to	O
become	O
a	O
verified	O
developer	O
,	O

then	O
have	O
your	O
app	O
reviewed	O
and	O
added	O
to	O
the	O
Mac	O
app	O
store	O
.	O

I	O
want	O
to	O

that	O

thing	O

I	O
want	O
a	O

that	O
is	O
able	O
to	O
be	O
called	O
case-insensitively	O
.	O

Example	O
:	O
I	O
want	O
applepie()	O
to	O
be	O
able	O
to	O
called	O
case-insensitively	O
:	O

most	O
straightforward	O
approach	O
is	O
to	O
declare	O
another	O
255	O
functions	O
with	O
some	O
letter	O
in	O
caps	O
:	O

:	I-Code_Block

(	I-Code_Block

)	I-Code_Block

This	O
does	O
the	O
following	O
;	O

gets	O
the	O
length	O
of	O
the	O
function	O
name	O

figures	O
out	O
number	O
of	O
case	O
combinations	O
(	O
2^n	O
)	O

loops	O
over	O
each	O
combination	O

turns	O
the	O
combination	O
number	O
into	O
a	O
string	O
of	O
binary	O
digits	O

the	O
string	O
of	O
binary	O
digits	O
so	O
it	O
is	O
the	O
same	O
length	O
as	O
the	O
function	O
name	O

indexes	O
through	O
each	O
char	O
of	O
the	O
function	O
name	O
and	O
string	O
of	O
binary	O
digits	O
and	O
does	O
a	O
toupper()	O
case	O
change	O
only	O
if	O
the	O
corresponding	O
binary	O
digit	O
is	O
1	O

reassembles	O
the	O
chars	O
to	O
a	O
string	O

does	O
a	O
bash	O
alias	O
from	O
each	O
combination	O
to	O
the	O
function	O
name	O

the	O
function	O
is	O

,	O

name	O
.	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O

Question_URL	O

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/28741241/	O

This	O
can	O
be	O
accomplished	O
by	O
using	O
AutoLayout	O
.	O

You	O
will	O
need	O
4	O
labels	O
:	O

Title	O
Labels	O

Value	O
Labels	O

You	O
will	O
need	O
to	O
pin	O
both	O
title	O
labels	B-User_Interface_Element
to	O
have	O
equal	O
widths	O
and	O
you	O
will	O
need	O
to	O
pin	O
both	O
value	O
labels	B-User_Interface_Element
to	O
have	O
equal	O
widths	O
.	O

You	O
will	O
also	O
need	O
to	O
set	O
constraints	O
for	O
horizontal	O
spacing	O
between	O
both	O
title	O
and	O
value	O
.	O

To	O
ensure	O
that	O
the	O
spacing	O
is	O
always	O
equal	O
between	O
rows	B-User_Interface_Element
.	O

In	O
code	O
when	O
you	O
set	O
the	O
value	O
of	O
your	O
label	B-User_Interface_Element
,	O
you	O
will	O
need	O
to	O
make	O
sure	O
that	O
the	O
colon	O
symbol	O
is	O
part	O
of	O
the	O
value	O
.	O

E.g	O
.	O

[	B-Code_Block
NSString	I-Code_Block
stringwithFormat	I-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
@	I-Code_Block
"	I-Code_Block
:%d	I-Code_Block
"	I-Code_Block
,	I-Code_Block
value	I-Code_Block
]	I-Code_Block
;	B-Code_Block

This	O
image	B-User_Interface_Element
illustrates	O
the	O
constraints	O
required	O
:	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
28741241	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/28741241/	O

Using	O
Autolayout	O
place	O
the	O
two	O
labels	B-User_Interface_Element
in	O
the	O
UIView	O
and	O
then	O
align	O
the	O
view	O
to	O
align	O
centre	O
in	O
the	O
horizontal	O
and	O
use	O
vertical	O
spacing	O
between	O
the	O
views	O
..	O
.	O
as	O

The	O
correct	O
approach	O
is	O
to	O
use	O
a	O
container	B-User_Interface_Element
view	O
,	O
which	O
derives	O
its	O
height	O
from	O
its	O
subviews	O
.	O

The	O
container	B-User_Interface_Element
view	O
is	O
then	O
pinned	O
to	O
the	O
centre	O
of	O
the	O
cell	B-User_Interface_Element
-	O
you	O
would	O
n't	O
have	O
any	O
constraints	O
linking	O
the	O
container	B-User_Interface_Element
to	O
the	O
top	O
and	O
bottom	O
edges	O
of	O
the	O
cell	B-User_Interface_Element
.	O

the	O
container	B-User_Interface_Element
,	O
the	O
vertical	O
constraints	O
would	O
be	O
|[label1]-[label2]|	O
,	O
which	O
would	O
make	O
the	O
container	B-User_Interface_Element
the	O
height	O
of	O
the	O

labels	B-User_Interface_Element

the	O
space	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
centre	O
of	O
the	O
container	B-User_Interface_Element
view	O
would	O
be	O
between	O
the	O
two	O
labels	B-User_Interface_Element
.	O

continue	B-Code_Block
is	O
maybe	O
one	O
of	O
the	O
worse	O
feature	O
of	O
java	O
,	O
with	O
the	O
break	B-Code_Block
keyword	O
(	O
except	O
in	O
switch	B-Code_Block
statements	O
)	O
.	O

It	O
leads	O
to	O
jigsaw	O
code	O
where	O
you	O
have	O
to	O
find	O
out	O
where	O
the	O
code	O
jumps	O
.	O

One	O
continue	B-Code_Block
may	O
be	O
practical	O
but	O
it	O
gets	O
very	O
hard	O
to	O
change	O
the	O
code	O
it	O
produces	O
(	O
think	O
about	O
adding	O
an	O
inner	O
loop.	O
.	O
)	O
,	O
and	O
2	O
continues	B-Code_Block
will	O
make	O
you	O
crazy	O
.	O

You	O
can	O
always	O
avoid	O
using	O
continue	B-Code_Block
,	O
there	O
is	O
always	O
another	O
solution	O
.	O

Same	O
for	O
break	B-Code_Block
.	O

Here	O
,	O
why	O
do	O
n't	O
you	O
just	O
use	O
some	O
kind	O
of	O

:	I-Code_Block
A_1183	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

That	O
's	O
easy	O
,	O
simple	O
,	O
clear	O
and	O
even	O
better	O
when	O
you	O
have	O
a	O
separate	O
method	O
that	O
contains	O
processing	O
.	O

Also	O
,	O
in	O
your	O
case	O
,	O
that	O
is	O
tied	O
to	O
robustness	O
,	O
you	O
could	O
provide	O
a	O
process()	O
method	O
that	O
throws	O
an	O
exception	O
if	O
the	O
data	O
entered	O
is	O
not	O
valid	O
.	O

makes	O

even	O
more	O

that	O
there	O
is	O
a	O
"	O
normal	O
"	O

of	O

as	O

.	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
1411364	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/1411364/	O

For	O
completeness	O
.	O

You	O
must	O
enable	O
multitouch	O
,	O
scalesPagesToFit	O
to	O
get	O
it	O
to	O
work	O
(	O
there	O
are	O
some	O
conditions	O
if	O
its	O
within	O
certain	O
other	O
views	B-User_Interface_Element
)	O
.	O

But	O
then	O
to	O
prevent	O
it	O
scaling	O
your	O
webpage	O
(	O
especially	O
if	O
using	O
local	O
files	O
)	O
.	O

You	O
will	O
need	O
to	O
add	O
the	O
following	O
snippet	O
to	O
your	O
HTML	O

For	O
more	O
info	O
so	O
:	O
http://iphoneincubator.com/blog/windows-views/right-scale-for-a-uiwebview	O

First	O
I	O
believe	O
you	O
mean	O
D3	O

,	O
since	O
PWM	O
does	O
not	O
exist	O
on	O
A3	O
.	O

Assuming	O
you	O
are	O
driving	O
a	O
DC	O
motor	O
,	O
and	O
not	O
something	O
like	O
a	O
servo	O
or	O
stepper	O

You	O
have	O
two	O
problems	O
.	O

1st	O
.	O

you	O
may	O
need	O
a	O
smoothing	O
capacitor	O
.	O

Where	O
your	O
formula	O
would	O
be	O
F	B-Code_Block
=	I-Code_Block
L*C	I-Code_Block
Noting	O
that	O
analogWrite	O
uses	O
a	O
F	B-Code_Block
=	I-Code_Block
490Hz	I-Code_Block
.	O

The	O
concept	O
is	O
simple	O
,	O
in	O
short	O
the	O
cap	O
average	O
out	O
the	O
high	O
and	O
lows	O
of	O
the	O
PWM	O
,	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
duty	O
cycle	O
.	O

And	O
the	O
capacitance	O
needed	O
is	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
frequency	O
and	O
impedance	O
.	O

This	O
will	O
provide	O
the	O
analog	O
voltage	O
.	O

2nd	O
.	O

And	O
bigger	O
problem	O
is	O
the	O
output	O
of	O
the	O
Arduino	O
can	O
not	O
supply	O
sufficient	O
current	O
to	O
drive	O
the	O
motor	O
correctly	O
.	O

So	O
at	O
low	O
speeds	O
the	O
pulses	O
which	O
were	O
week	O
,	O
stall	O
out	O
during	O
their	O
low	O
periods	O
.	O

You	O
should	O
have	O
your	O
PWM	O
output	O
drive	O
a	O
transistor	O
,	O
which	O
in	O
turn	O
will	O
ON-OFF	O
the	O
motor	O
directly	O
from	O
the	O
power	O
supply	O
.	O

Now	O
your	O
motor	O
may	O
have	O
enough	O
inertia	O
as	O
not	O
to	O
need	O
the	O
cap	O
.	O

see	O
adafruit-arduino-lesson-13-dc-motors/breadboard	O

and	O
here	O
for	O
a	O
discussion	O
about	O
the	O
smoothing	O
cap	O

an	O

to	O
one	O

the	O

The	O
inline	O
mootools	B-Library
request	O
did	O
not	O
execute	O
when	O
declared	O
through	O
the	O
onclick()	O
.	O

It	O
seems	O
this	O
was	O
caused	O
by	O
the	O
script	O
not	O
being	O
synchronous	O
.	O

So	O
probably	O

returns	O
without	O
actually	O
fully	O
committing	O
the	O
request	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
browser	O
then	O
moves	O
to	O
another	O
page	O
breaking	O
the	O
execution	O
.	O

Adding	O
a	O
synchronous	O
call	O
to	O
the	O
script	O
fixes	O
the	O
problem	O
:	O

that	O
was	O
mentioned	O
on	O
the	O
onmousedownevent	O
,	O
i.e	O
.	O
firefox	O
not	O

the	O
ajax	B-Library
call	O
if	O
the	O
browser	O

back	O
is	O

.	O

that	O
to	O
be	O
as	O
that	O
was	O
n't	O
the	O
main	O
question	O
raised	O
.	O

For	O
trully	O
offline-charts	O
,	O
there	O
is	O
a	O
way	O

While	O
regular	O
charts	O
process	O
an	O
independent	O
event-flow	O
,	O
received	O
from	O
MT4-Server	O
,	O
there	O
is	O
a	O
change	O
for	O
retaining	O
your	O
own	O
control	O
over	O
TOHLCV-data	B-Code_Block
records	O
-	O
-	O
including	O
the	O
TimeZone	B-Code_Block
shifts	O
,	O
synthetic	O
Bar(s)	B-Code_Block
additions	O
and	O
other	O
adaptations	O
,	O
as	O
needed	O
.	O

How	O
to	O
avoid	O
a	O
live-quote-stream	O
updates	O
in	O
MetaTrader	O
Terminal	O
4	O

The	O
simplest	O
ever	O
way	O
is	O
not	O
to	O
login	O
to	O
any	O
Trading	O
Server	O
.	O

This	O
will	O
avoid	O
unwanted	O
updates	O
from	O
reaching	O
your	O
local	O
anFxQuoteStreamPROCESSOR	B-Code_Block
.	O

There	O
used	O
to	O
be	O
a	O
way	O
,	O
how	O
to	O
inject	O
fake	O
QuoteStreamDATA	B-Code_Block
into	O
a	O
local	O
MT4	O
,	O
however	O
this	O
enters	O
a	O
gray	O
,	O
if	O
not	O
black	O
zone	O
,	O
as	O
MetaQuotes	O
,	O
Inc	O
.	O
,	O
postulated	O
the	O
Server/Terminal	O
protocol	O
to	O
be	O
a	O
protected	O
IP	O
and	O
any	O
attempt	O
to	O
reverse-engineer	O
they	O
consider	O
an	O
unlawfull	O
violation	O
of	O
their	O
rights	O
and	O
could	O
cause	O
legal	O
consequences	O
,	O
so	O
be	O
carefull	O
on	O
stepping	O
there	O
.	O

Anyway	O
,	O
a	O
doable	O
approach	O
with	O

explicit	O
risk	O
warning	O
being	O
presented	O
above	O
.	O

I	O
've	O
made	O
an	O
application	O
with	O
C#	O
,	O
in	O
this	O
application	O
I	O
have	O
to	O
read	O
every	O
20	O
second	O
840	O
registers	O
of	O
PLC	O
via	O
Modbus	O
TCP	O
.	O

I	O
use	O
this	O
library	O
http://www.codeproject.com/Tips/16260/Modbus-TCP-class	O
.	O

When	O
I	O
use	O
the	O
method	O

Master.ReadHoldingRegister(ushortid,byteunit,ushortstartAddress,ushortnumInputs)	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
29743699	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/29743699/	O

Modbus	O
allows	O
up	O
to	O
125	O
holding	O
registers	O
to	O
be	O
read	O
in	O
a	O
single	O
Read	O
Holding	O
Registers	O
function	O
call	O
.	O

If	O
the	O
library	O
does	O
not	O
throw	O
an	O
error	O
on	O
a	O
call	O
to	O
840	O
registers	O
,	O
then	O
it	O
is	O
probably	O
taking	O
this	O
limit	O
into	O
account	O
by	O
spliting	O
your	O
call	O
in	O
several	O
Read	O
Holding	O
Registers	O
requests	O
.	O

I	O
would	O
study	O
the	O
source	O
code	O
to	O
be	O
sure	O
that	O
you	O
can	O
do	O
that	O
reliably	O
.	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
29743699	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/29743699/	O

As	O
suggested	O
add	O
a	O
bit	O
of	O
delay	O
between	O
the	O
calls	O
.	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
Q_637	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
7861757	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/7861757/	O

When	O
formating	O
a	O
numeric	O
string	O
as	O
currency	O
,	O
you	O
have	O
to	O
parse	O
it	O
back	O
before	O
you	O
can	O
re-convert	O
it	O
back	O
to	O
a	O
numeric	O
form	O
,	O
this	O
depends	O
on	O
the	O
curency	O
formatting	O
rules	O
you	O
used	O
to	O
create	O
the	O

in	O

first	O
place	O
.	O

:	O

.	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
26096867	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/26096867/	O

logback	B-Library
is	O
the	O
default	O
logging	O
implementation	O
used	O
by	O
Spring	B-Library
Boot	I-Library
(	O
I	O
assume	O
you	O
are	O
using	O
spring	B-Library
boot	I-Library
to	O
create	O
a	O
jar	O
and	O
run	O
that	O
!	O
)	O
.	O

Basicly	O
you	O
do	O
n't	O
need	O
to	O
do	O
anything	O
logging	O
is	O
already	O
handled	O
by	O
the	O
starter	O
you	O
included	O
.	O

There	O
is	O
a	O
default	O
logback.xml	B-File_Name
shipped	O
with	O
Spring	B-Library
which	O
turns	O
on	O
logging	O
,	O
for	O
the	O
spring	B-Library
framework	O
this	O
is	O
on	O
INFO	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
want	O
to	O
override	O
this	O
simply	O
create	O
a	O
logback.xml	B-File_Name
file	O
with	O
the	O
same	O
content	O
as	O
the	O
default	O
one	O
and	O
put	O
the	O
logger	O
for	O
spring	B-Library
on	O
DEBUG	O
or	O
TRACE	O
.	O

Not	O
sure	O
if	O
you	O
really	O
want	O
to	O
put	O
everything	O
on	O
trace	O
unless	O
you	O
want	O
a	O
less	O
performant	O
application	O
.	O

As	O
to	O
what	O
you	O
are	O
doing	O
wrong	O
is	O
that	O
you	O
are	O
probably	O
doing	O
to	O
much	O
and	O
thinking	O
to	O
complex	O
.	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
26096867	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/26096867/	O

dont	O
know	O
if	O
logging.level.org.springframework	O
and	O
the	O
logging.path	O
works	O
with	O
spring	B-Library
boot	I-Library
.	O

You	O
can	O
try	O
to	O
move	O
your	O
logback.xml	B-File_Name
file	O
and	O
application.properties	B-File_Name
directly	O
to	O
resources	O
dir	O
+	O
paste	O
this	O
to	O
logback.xml	B-File_Name

Below	O
is	O
the	O
method	O
to	O
clone	O
OpenCV	B-Library
2.4.10	O
through	O
TortoiseGit	O
2.4.0.3	O
.	O

Clone	O
OpenCV	B-Library
HEAD	B-Code_Block
from	O
https://github.com/opencv/opencv.git	O
.	O

In	O
the	O
cloned	O
directory	O
,	O
right	O
click	O
and	O
select	O
TortoiseGit	O
from	O
the	O
popup	O
menu	B-User_Interface_Element
.	O

From	O
the	O
sub	O
menu	B-User_Interface_Element
,	O
select	O
Switch/Checkout	B-Code_Block
.	O

In	O
Switch/Checkout	B-Code_Block
menu	B-User_Interface_Element
,	O
select	O
OpenCV-2.4.10	B-Library
from	O
Branch	B-Code_Block
or	O
2.4.10	O
from	O
Tag	B-Code_Block
.	O

See	O
show	B-Code_Block
log	I-Code_Block
to	O
verify	O
if	O
the	O
right	O
version	O
is	O
cloned	O
or	O
not	O
.	O

Hope	O
this	O
help	O
.	O

the	O
opencv-2.4.10	B-Library
core	O
package	O
from	O
the	O
GitHub	O
clone	O
.	O

usually	O

:	O
36835825	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/36835825/	O

Problem	O
:	O

I	O
want	O
to	O
use	O
a	O
different	O
size	O
scale	O
for	O
edges	B-User_Interface_Element
and	O
nodes	B-User_Interface_Element
in	O
a	O
network	B-Library
created	O
with	O
the	O
ggnetwork	B-Library
package	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
look	O
at	O
the	O
image	B-User_Interface_Element
below	O
you	O
may	O
think	O
I	O
already	O
did	O
that	O
since	O
they	O
all	O
have	O
different	O
sizes	O
but	O
in	O
fact	O
edge	B-User_Interface_Element
and	O
node	B-User_Interface_Element
size	O
are	O
not	O
scaled	O
independently	O
in	O
this	O
plot	B-User_Interface_Element
.	O

They	O
are	O
both	O
scaled	O
by	O
the	O
scale_size_area()	O
function	O
towards	O
the	O
same	O
maximum	O
(	O
30	O
)	O
.	O

If	O
I	O
get	O
larger	O
nodes	O
my	O
edges	O
will	O
shrink	O
.	O

I	O
guess	O
my	O
problem	O
boils	O
down	O
to	O
scaling	O
the	O
size	O
of	O
different	O
geoms	O
with	O
different	O
functions	O
.	O

So	O
for	O
example	O
how	O
can	O
I	O
scale	O
the	O
size	O
of	O
the	O
nodes	O
with	O
scale_size_area	B-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
max_size	I-Code_Block
=	I-Code_Block
30	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block
and	O
the	O
size	O
of	O
the	O
edges	O
with	O
scale_size_continuous	B-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
range	I-Code_Block
=	I-Code_Block
c(1,6))	I-Code_Block
?	O

Example	O
code	O
:	O

:	I-Code_Block

44495847	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
Q_5779	I-Code_Block

The	O
other	O
answers	O
are	O
correct	O
-	O
however	O
this	O
implementation	O
of	O
the	O
Singleton	O
pattern	O
is	O
horribly	O
flawed	O
and	O
will	O
break	O
in	O
unexpected	O
ways	O
in	O
a	O
multi-threading	O
environment	O
.	O

The	O
easiest	O
way	O
is	O
not	O
to	O
have	O
lazy	O
initialization	O
of	O
the	O
singleton	O
,	O
if	O
you	O
really	O
must	O
have	O
lazy	O
initialization	O
then	O
do	O
it	O
using	O
a	O
static	O
holder	O
:	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_2926	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

This	O
uses	O
the	O
class	O
loader	O
to	O
handle	O
all	O
the	O
lazy	O
initialization	O
,	O
thread	O
safety	O
,	O
etc	O
for	O
you	O
.	O

It	O
's	O
completely	O
thread	O
safe	O
and	O
fast	O
due	O
to	O
the	O
fact	O
that	O
it	O
does	O
n't	O
need	O
synchronization	O
or	O
null	O
checks	O
.	O

Question_ID	O
:	O
35324855	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/35324855/	O

I	O
am	O
trying	O
to	O
implement	O
an	O
algorithm	O
for	O
process	O
histograms	O
images	B-User_Interface_Element
using	O
multiple	O
threads	O
.	O

One	O
of	O
the	O
most	O
common	O
approach	O
is	O
to	O
split	O
multiple	O
thread	O
create	O
a	O
cache	O
buffer	B-Data_Structure
on	O
each	O
one	O
,	O
do	O
the	O
histogram	O
on	O
the	O
cache	O
buffer	B-Data_Structure
and	O
then	O
lock	O
a	O
mutex	O
addition	O
the	O
values	O
on	O
the	O
local	O
to	O
the	O
output	O
vector	B-Data_Structure
,	O
and	O
unlock	O
the	O
buffer	B-Data_Structure
.	O

This	O
approach	O
is	O
very	O
efficient	O
but	O
can	O
introduce	O
a	O
'	O
jam	O
'	O
.	O

I	O
mean	O
the	O
additions	O
of	O
the	O
datas	O
cannot	O
be	O
realized	O
concurently	O
.	O

In	O
most	O
of	O
the	O
case	O
when	O
the	O
range	O
of	O
the	O
values	O
is	O
quite	O
short	O
(	O
e.g	O
.	O
0-255	O
)	O
it	O
's	O
the	O
time	O
needed	O
to	O
proceed	O
the	O
addition	O
is	O
very	O
fast	O
and	O
can	O
be	O
neglect	O
.	O

If	O
the	O
range	O
of	O
datas	O
is	O
higher	O
like	O
for	O
example	O
on	O
thermal	O
images	B-User_Interface_Element
this	O
time	O
can	O
become	O
more	O
significant	O
.	O

Thermal	O
images	B-User_Interface_Element
are	O
often	O
matrix	B-Data_Structure
of	O
unsigned	O
short	O
,	O
even	O
if	O
the	O
values	O
does	O
n't	O
use	O
the	O
full	O
range	O
(	O
0-65535	O
)	O
the	O
algorithm	O
must	O
process	O
all	O
the	O
range	O
.	O

In	O
order	O
to	O
speed	O
up	O
a	O
little	O
bit	O
hte	O
processing	O
I	O
thought	O
to	O
launch	O
a	O
background	O
thread	O
to	O
do	O
the	O
addition	O
while	O
the	O
"	O
foreground	O
"	O
thread	O
would	O
only	O
write	O
the	O
datas	O
into	O
a	O
preallocated	O
buffer	B-Data_Structure
.	O

So	O
basically	O
the	O
work	O
of	O
a	O
"	O
foreground	O
"	O
thread	O
used	O
to	O
be	O
that	O
:	O

get	O
a	O
buffer	O
from	O
a	O
circular	O
buffer	O
.	O

process	O
the	O
histogram	O
for	O
a	O
specified	O
set	O
of	O
data	O
(	O
e.g	O
.	O
from	O
line	O
n	O
to	O
line	O
m	O
)	O
.	O

-notify	O
the	O
background	O
buffer	B-Data_Structure
the	O
operations	O
are	O
finished	O
.	O

The	O
background	O
thread	O
used	O
to	O
do	O
:	O

wait	O
until	O
a	O
notification	O
arrive	O
and	O
check	O
if	O
the	O
number	O
of	O
available	O
buffer	B-Data_Structure
is	O
lower	O
than	O
the	O
number	O
of	O
buffers	B-Data_Structure
.	O

If	O
the	O
conditions	O
are	O
true	O
then	O
look	O
for	O
the	O
buffer	B-Data_Structure
to	O
be	O
processed	O
from	O
the	O
buffers	B-Data_Structure
available	O
.	O

Do	O
the	O
addition	O
with	O
the	O
output	O
buffer	O
.	O

make	O
the	O
processed	O
buffer	O
reusable	O
.	O

I	O
am	O
not	O
very	O
familiar	O
with	O
condition	O
variables	O
.	O

So	O
in	O
order	O
to	O
check	O
communication	O

variable	O
I	O

i	O
am	O
trying	O
to	O
get	O
the	O
difference	O
between	O
class	O
RSAPKCS1Signatureformatter	O
and	O
RSACryptoServiceProvider	O

as	O

data	O

:	O
44833318	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/44833318/	O

RSAPKCS1SignatureFormatter	O
just	O
calls	O
RSACryptoServiceProvider.SignHash	O
.	O

Since	O
you	O
do	O
n't	O
have	O
a	O
code	O
sample	O
it	O
's	O
not	O
easy	O
to	O
say	O
what	O
the	O
problem	O
is	O
.	O

Psychic	O
debugging	O
says	O
that	O
you	O
're	O
calling	O
SignData	O
when	O
using	O
the	O
RSA	O
object	O
directly	O
,	O
which	O
results	O
in	O
it	O
getting	O
hashed	O
again	O
,	O
and	O
that	O
what	O
you	O
really	O
want	O
is	O
SignHash	O
(	O
for	O
pre-digested	O
values	O
)	O
.	O

As	O
objects	O
are	O
shared	O
,	O
reusing	O
the	O
same	O
list	B-Data_Structure
object	O
will	O
not	O
do	O
.	O

Would	O
involve	O
copying	O
.	O

Null	O
or	O
empty	O
list	B-Data_Structure
?	O

Assuming	O
you	O
want	O
to	O
read	O
from	O
and	O
write	O
to	O
the	O
list	B-Data_Structure
,	O
null	O
seems	O
ugly	O
.	O

In	O
java	O
a	O
LinkedList	O
would	O
be	O
lighter	O
that	O
an	O
ArrayList	O
,	O
so	O
pick	O
a	O
linked	O
list	O
.	O

Null	O
would	O
be	O
faster	O
.	O

A	O
read-only	O
,	O
to-be-replaced	O
Collections.emptyList()	O
would	O
be	O
a	O
bit	O
safer	O
.	O

Instead	O
of	O
the	O
data	O
structure	O
of	O
one	O
aspect	O
it	O
might	O
be	O
worthwile	O
considering	O
the	O
algorithmic	O
approach	O
.	O

Spending	O
time	O
on	O
the	O
right	O
relevant	O
things	O
.	O

Queues	B-Data_Structure
.	O

Priorities	O
.	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
Q_5255	I-Code_Block

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
41417370	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/41417370/	O

Do	O
a	O
regular	O
expression	O
find/replace	O
like	O
this	O
:	O

Open	O
Replace	O
Dialog	B-User_Interface_Element

Find	O
What	O
:	O
[	O
^	O
\[\]]*\[([^\]]+)\]	O

Replace	O
With	O
:	O
\1\n	O

Check	O
regular	O
expression	O

Click	O
Replace	O
or	O
Replace	O
All	O

Explanation	O

one	O
problem	O
is	O
that	O
brackets	O
are	O
RE	O
metacharacters	O
,	O
that	O
means	O
we	O
have	O
to	O
escape	O
each	O
bracket	O
,	O
when	O
we	O
need	O
a	O
literal	O
bracket	O
,	O
i.e	O
.	O

a	O
literal	O
bracket	O
becomes	O
\	O
[	O
or	O
\	O
]	O
in	O
the	O
RE	O

here	O
in	O
the	O
RE	O
we	O
look	O
for	O
an	O
optional	O
part	O
that	O
may	O
consist	O
of	O
everything	O
not	O
brackets	O
(	O
[	O
\	O
[	O
\	O
]	O
]	O
*)	O

followed	O
by	O
an	O
opening	O
bracket	O
,	O
followed	O
by	O
somthing	O
not	O
a	O
closing	O
bracket	O
((	O
[	O
^\	O
]	O
]	O
+))	O
which	O
is	O
also	O
captured	O
into	O
\1	O
due	O
to	O
the	O
parentheses	O
,	O
for	O
reuse	O
in	O
the	O
substitution	O

whatever	O
is	O
matched	O
above	O
is	O
completely	O
replaced	O
by	O
whatever	O
was	O
captured	O
into	O
\1	O
followed	O
by	O
a	O
newline	O
(	O
\n	O
)	O
,	O
when	O
you	O
need	O
windows-style	O
lineendings	O
,	O
you	O
might	O
want	O
to	O
use	O
\r\n	O
instead	O

Question_ID	O
:	O
47030828	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/47030828/	O

I	O
recently	O
found	O
out	O
that	O
there	O
are	O
two	O
types	O
of	O
LayoutManager	O
you	O
can	O
use	O
in	O
working	O
with	O
RecyclerView	O
,	O
one	O
from	O
native	O
Android	O
and	O
one	O
from	O
Leanback	B-Library
library	O
.	O

I	O
need	O
to	O
use	O
the	O
one	O
from	O
leanback	B-Library
in	O
order	O
to	O
be	O
able	O
to	O
maintain	O
the	O
position	O
of	O
the	O
focused	O
element	O
fixed	O
in	O
the	O
middle	O
of	O
the	O
screen	O
.	O

The	O
problem	O
is	O
I	O
need	O
to	O
set	O
this	O
layout	O
to	O
stack	O
from	O
end	O
so	O
the	O
direction	O
would	O
be	O
to	O
scroll	O
to	O
left	O
,	O
not	O
the	O
default	O
right	O
scrolling	O
.	O

In	O
the	O
native	O
library	O
,	O
there	O
are	O
two	O
methods	O
I	O
can	O
use	O
to	O
achieve	O
this	O
,	O
setStackFromEnd(true)	O
or	O
setReverseLayout(true)	O
.	O

Is	O
there	O
any	O
way	O
I	O
can	O
achieve	O
this	O
from	O
Leanback	B-Library
LayoutManager	O
?	O

Thanks	O
You	O

:	O

:	O

I	O
was	O
reading	O

The	O
original	O
idea	O
comes	O
from	O
groovy	O
.	O

It	O
was	O
proposed	O
for	O
Java	O
7	O
as	O
part	O
of	O
Project	O
Coin	O
:	O
https://wiki.openjdk.java.net/display/Coin/2009+Proposals+TOC	O
(	O
Elvis	O
and	O
Other	O
Null-Safe	O
Operators	O
)	O
,	O
but	O
has	O
n't	O
been	O
accepted	O
yet	O
.	O

The	O
related	O
Elvis	O
operator	O
?	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
was	O
proposed	O
to	O
make	O
x	B-Code_Block
?	I-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
y	I-Code_Block
shorthand	O
for	O
x	B-Code_Block
!=	I-Code_Block
null	I-Code_Block
?	I-Code_Block
x	I-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
y	I-Code_Block
,	O
especially	O
useful	O
when	O
x	O
is	O
a	O
complex	O
expression	O
.	O
