I	O
'm	O
not	O
sure	O
this	O
would	O
even	O
work	O
;	O
if	O
,	O
say	O
,	O
the	O
person	O
reference	O
was	O
null	O
,	O
what	O
would	O
the	O
runtime	O
replace	O
it	O
with	O
?	O

A	O
new	O
Person	O
?	O

That	O
would	O
require	O
the	O
Person	O
to	O
have	O
some	O
default	O
initialization	O
that	O
you	O
'd	O
expect	O
in	O
this	O
case	O
.	O

The	O
?	B-Code_Block
?	I-Code_Block

operator	O
in	O
C#	O
might	O
be	O
best	O
termed	O
the	O
"	O

"	O
operator	O

first	O

is	O

null	O
.	O

Unfortunately	O

Java	O
does	O
n't	O
have	O
it	O
.	O

think	O
the	O

you	O
could	O
do	O

the	O
ternary	O
operator	O
to	O

expression	O

works	O
fine	O

part	O
of	O
the	O
problem	O
is	O
that	O
your	O
reading	O
it	O
too	O
literally	O
.	O

That	O
's	O
not	O

;	O

instructions	O
do	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_5098	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

Notice	O
how	O
I	O
did	O
n't	O
just	O
write	O
"	O
alias.<alias>	B-Code_Block
"	O
or	O
the	O
like	O
.	O

The	O
whole	O
purpose	O
of	O
the	O
config	B-Code_Block
command	O
is	O
to	O
actually	O
configure	O
how	O
git	O
works	O
.	O

The	O
point	O
of	O
alias	O
is	O
to	O
give	O
all	O
your	O
commands	O
like	O
config	B-Code_Block
,	O
help	B-Code_Block
,	O
init	B-Code_Block
,	O
etc	O
.	O
new	O
ways	O
to	O
be	O
called	O
upon	O
.	O

In	O
the	O
above	O
example	O
,	O
I	O
typed	O
right	O
next	O
to	O
"	O
alias	B-Code_Block
.	I-Code_Block
"	O
what	O
I	O
wanted	O
the	O
NEW	O
command	O
to	O
be	O
,	O
and	O
a	O
space	O
away	O
on	O
the	O
right	O
where	O
it	O
says	O
"	O
help	B-Code_Block
"	O
I	O
refer	O
to	O
the	O
command	O
I	O
want	O
to	O
make	O
an	O
alias	O
for	O
.	O

I	O
'm	O
basically	O
changing	O
the	O
"	O
help	B-Code_Block
"	O
command	O
so	O
I	O
can	O
use	O
it	O
just	O
by	O
typing	O
"	O
hp	B-Code_Block
"	O
.	O

You	O
can	O
literally	O
make	O
it	O
anything	O
you	O
want	O
.	O

I	O
could	O
use	O
code	O
like	O
this	O
:	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_5099	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

and	O
I	O
can	O
write	O
IMABigBaboon	O
instead	O
of	O
init	B-Code_Block
and	O
it	O
will	O
work	O
.	O

Try	O
it	O
!	O

Just	O
be	O
careful	O
you	O
do	O
n't	O
name	O
two	O
commands	O
the	O
same	O
thing	O
.	O

Otherwise	O
you	O
wind	O
up	O
changing	O
the	O
name	O
of	O
the	O
previous	O
alias	O
.	O

Remember	O
;	O
you	O
can	O
only	O

for	O
one	O
command	O
!	O

Question_ID	O
:	O
41944911	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/41944911/	O

My	O
question	O
is	O
:	O
Which	O
is	O
better	O
between	O
using	O
NotificationCenter	O
and	O
using	O
Closures	O
to	O
communicate	O
between	O
two	O
instances	O
?	O

If	O
they	O
are	O
similar	O
,	O
what	O
should	O
I	O
use	O
?	O

Hopefully	O
,	O
this	O
example	O
helps	O
you	O
to	O
understand	O
better	O
:	O
-	O

If	O
we	O
take	O
URLSession	O
class	O
as	O
an	O
example	O
.	O

Why	O
do	O
most	O
of	O
its	O
methods	O
have	O
a	O
closure	O
?	O

Why	O
do	O
not	O
they	O
send	O
a	O
notification	O
with	O
Data	O
,	O
Response	O
,	O
and	O
Error	O
inside	O
it	O
?	O

I	O
know	O
the	O
difference	O
between	O
them	O
,	O
I	O
just	O
do	O
n't	O
know	O
in	O
what	O
situations	O
should	O
I	O
use	O
each	O
one	O
.	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
41944911	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/41944911/	O

In	O
some	O
cases	O
the	O
patterns	O
are	O
interchangeable	O
,	O
however	O
:	O

Using	O
a	O
closure	O
is	O
the	O
simplest	O
solution	O
for	O
simple	O
cases	O

Using	O
a	O
delegate	O
is	O
common	O
when	O
there	O
is	O
complex	O
communication	O
between	O
two	O
objects	O
.	O

One	O
delegate	O
can	O
be	O
better	O
than	O
many	O
closures	O
.	O

You	O
have	O
to	O
use	O
notifications	O
when	O
you	O
have	O
multiple	O
observers	O
or	O
when	O
you	O
are	O
not	O
sure	O
what	O
objects	O
will	O
be	O
observing	O
.	O

You	O
might	O
be	O
asking	O
yourself	O
why	O
we	O
are	O
using	O
closures	O
for	O
simple	O
cases	O
and	O
not	O
delegates	O
or	O
notifications	O
.	O

The	O
answer	O
is	O
that	O
closures	O
are	O
the	O
most	O
lightweight	O
.	O

They	O
are	O
easy	O
to	O
create	O
and	O
they	O
positively	O
affect	O
your	O
code	O
quality	O
.	O

Let	O
's	O
consider	O
a	O
completion	O
callback	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
decide	O
to	O
use	O
a	O
notification	O
,	O
you	O
need	O
another	O
method	O
that	O
will	O
handle	O
that	O
notification	O
.	O

The	O
same	O
is	O
valid	O
for	O
delegates	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
need	O
some	O
context	O
(	O
e.g	O
.	O
the	O
parameters	O
that	O
triggered	O
the	O
actions	O
)	O
,	O
you	O
will	O
need	O
to	O
save	O
it	O
into	O
a	O
property	O
.	O

On	O
the	O
other	O
hand	O
,	O
a	O
closure	O
can	O
be	O
created	O
inline	O
.	O

That	O
means	O
that	O
the	O
code	O
that	O
triggers	O
the	O
action	O
and	O
handles	O
its	O
result	O
is	O
at	O
one	O
place	O
.	O

This	O
really	O
simplifies	O
the	O
structure	O
of	O
your	O
code	O
.	O

Also	O
note	O
that	O
if	O
the	O
closure	O
needs	O
some	O
context	O
,	O
it	O
can	O
capture	O
it	O
,	O
without	O
the	O
need	O
to	O
create	O
an	O
additional	O
property	O
.	O

Question_ID	O
:	O
48920728	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/48920728/	O

Here	O
I	O
want	O
to	O
pass	O
the	O
value	O
which	O
am	O
getting	O
in	O
data	O
to	O
the	O
controller	O
so	O
I	O
gave	O
my	O
code	O
like	O
this	O
.	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block

(	I-Code_Block

for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

int	O
&	O
is	O
a	O
reference	O
to	O
an	O
int	O
,	O
i.e	O
.	O
an	O
int	O

give	O
to	O
the	O
function	O

function	O
will	O
change	O

your	O
variable	O
will	O
reflect	O
the	O
changes	O
.	O

maybe	O
you	O
already	O
see	O
it	O
:	O

constant	O
is	O
not	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
36967459	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/36967459/	O

Dealt	O
with	O
this	O
problem	O
several	O
years	O
ago	O
and	O
there	O
was	O
no	O
way	O
you	O
could	O
force	O
most	O
email	O
client	O
to	O
"	O
process	O
"	O
(	O
trigger	O
"	O
Add	O
to	O
calendar	O
"	O
menu	B-User_Interface_Element
)	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
what	O
you	O
want	O
is	O
just	O
make	O
some	O
element	O
in	O
your	O
email	O
trigger	O
that	O
.	O

You	O
can	O
do	O
this	O
by	O
simply	O
linking	O
that	O
element	O
to	O
.ical	O
file	O
on	O
your	O
server	O
.	O

The	O
advantage	O
is	O
that	O
you	O
can	O
attache	O
some	O
parameters	O
to	O
your	O
link	O
and	O
generate	O
that	O
event	O
file	O
dynamically	O
.	O

Also	O
,	O
it	O
scales	O
pretty	O
well	O
.	O

:	O
2290073	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/2290073/	O

is	O
due	O
to	O

default	O

size	O

has	O
nothing	O
to	O

.	O

)	O

omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

do	O
n't	O

it	O
in	O
the	O

page	O

's	O

some	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
46419176	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/46419176/	O

As	O
long	O
as	O
there	O
is	O
an	O
owner	O
relation	O
between	O
two	O
windows	B-User_Interface_Element
.	O

the	O
owner	O
of	O
a	O
window	B-User_Interface_Element
can	O
never	O
be	O
on	O
top	O
of	O
the	O
owned	O
window	B-User_Interface_Element
.	O

Windows	B-User_Interface_Element
in	O
an	O
owner	O
,	O
parent	O
,	O
child	O
relation	O
always	O
behave	O
the	O
same	O
.	O

The	O
owned/child	O
window	B-User_Interface_Element
is	O
always	O
on	O
top	O
of	O
the	O
parent/owner	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
want	O
to	O
break	O
this	O
,	O
you	O
have	O
to	O
break	O
the	O
owner/child	O
relation	O
.	O

Let	O
all	O
dialog	B-User_Interface_Element
windows	I-User_Interface_Element
have	O
no	O
owner	O
..	O
.	O
than	O
they	O
may	O
float	O
freely	O
.	O

But	O
:	O
I	O
will	O
expect	O
the	O
you	O
program	O
does	O
n't	O
behave	O
better	O
.	O

Even	O
worse	O
.	O

User	O
might	O
search	O
windows	B-User_Interface_Element
that	O
are	O
deep	O
below	O
covered	O
under	O
other	O
windows	B-User_Interface_Element
.	O

And	O
they	O
will	O
never	O
get	O
in	O
front	O
,	O
when	O
your	O
program	O
gets	O
active	O
.	O

See	O
the	O
description	O
about	O
parent/child/owned	O
windows	B-User_Interface_Element
here	O
.	O

Also	O
this	O
article	O
might	O
be	O
helpful	O
.	O

Edit	O
:	O
The	O
problem	O
is	O
that	O
internally	O
the	O
MFC	B-Library
sets	O
the	O
main	O
window	B-User_Interface_Element
as	O
an	O
owner	O
if	O
no	O
parent	O
is	O
given	O
.	O

Only	O
the	O
call	O
to	O
BOOL	B-Code_Block
Wnd	I-Code_Block
::	I-Code_Block
CreateDlgIndirect(LPCDLGTEMPLATE	I-Code_Block
lpDialogTemplate	I-Code_Block
,	I-Code_Block
CWnd	I-Code_Block
*	I-Code_Block
pParentWnd	I-Code_Block
,	I-Code_Block
HINSTANCE	I-Code_Block
hInst	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block
allows	O
to	O
leave	O
pParentWnd	O
NULL	O
.	O

So	O
you	O
may	O
create	O
the	O
window	B-User_Interface_Element
as	O
normal	O
,	O
but	O
use	O
SetParent(NULL)	O
after	O
it	O
was	O
created	O
.	O

Again	O
the	O
MFC	B-Library
ASSERTs	O
this	O
.	O

SO	O
you	O
may	O
use	O
the	O
API	B-Library
function	O
and	O
the	O
handle	O
of	O
your	O
dialog	O
.	O

have	O

wich	O
are	O
made	O

my	O

table	B-Data_Structure
names	O

a	O

:	O

.	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
5122776	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/5122776/	O

EDIT	O
:	O

IIUC	O
,	O
you	O
have	O
a	O
similarity	O
formula	O
per	O
field	O
,	O
and	O
you	O
want	O
to	O
use	O
it	O
per	O
document	O
,	O
running	O
against	O
all	O
other	O
documents	O
.	O

You	O
can	O
use	O
several	O
options	O
,	O
all	O
at	O
indexing	O
time	O
:	O

Extend	O
the	O
SimilarityDelegator	O
class	O
,	O
if	O
you	O
only	O
need	O
to	O
modify	O
part	O
of	O
the	O
methods	O
.	O

In	O
both	O
methods	O
,	O
you	O
may	O
make	O
use	O
of	O
payloads	O
to	O
store	O
term-specific	O
information	O
(	O
could	O
be	O
useful	O
for	O
the	O
lat-long	O
data	O
)	O
.	O

After	O
implementing	O
a	O
Similarity	O
class	O
using	O
one	O
of	O
these	O
methods	O
,	O
use	O
Similarity.setDefault(mySimilarity)	O
to	O
set	O
this	O
as	O
the	O
Similarity	O
instance	O
for	O
indexing	O
and	O
searching	O
.	O

Only	O
then	O
index	O
your	O
text	O
corpus	O
,	O
which	O
you	O
can	O
search	O
later	O
-	O
you	O
will	O
probably	O
have	O
to	O
extend	O
the	O
Searcher	O
class	O
as	O
well	O
to	O
get	O
the	O
raw	O
similarity	O
.	O

Good	O
luck	O
.	O

Patrick	O
,	O
I	O
will	O
first	O
quote	O
Grant	O
Ingersoll	O
about	O
modifying	O
the	O
Similarity	O
class	O
:	O
"	O
Here	O
be	O
Dragons	O
"	O
.	O

Customizing	O
Lucene	O
's	O
Similarity	O
class	O
is	O
hard	O
.	O

I	O
have	O
done	O
this	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
not	O
fun	O
.	O

Only	O
do	O
this	O
if	O
you	O
absolutely	O
have	O
to	O
.	O

I	O
suggest	O
you	O
should	O
first	O
read	O
Grant	O
's	O
spatial	O
search	O
paper	O
,	O
his	O
findability	O
paper	O
and	O
his	O
'	O
debugging	O
relevance	O
'	O
paper	O
.	O

These	O
show	O
other	O
ways	O
to	O
get	O
hits	O
as	O
needed	O
.	O

am	O
doing	O
some	O
research	O
into	O
the	O
Memento	O
Pattern	O
and	O
I	O
am	O
generally	O
new	O
to	O
behavioural	O
patterns	O
and	O
with	O
my	O
research	O
I	O
have	O
been	O
getting	O
pretty	O
confused	O
.	O

One	O
of	O
the	O
main	O
things	O
I	O
have	O
been	O
getting	O
confused	O
on	O
is	O
the	O
differences	O
between	O
the	O
Memento	O
Pattern	O
and	O
Serialization	O
.	O

From	O
what	O
I	O
can	O
gather	O
both	O
can	O
be	O
used	O
to	O
store	O
objects	O
and	O
have	O
them	O
brought	O
back	O
at	O
a	O
later	O
date	O
but	O
I	O
have	O
not	O
been	O
able	O
to	O
find	O
a	O
clear	O
cut	O
answer	O
on	O
what	O
the	O
key	O
differences	O
between	O
them	O
are	O
,	O
maybe	O
I	O
have	O
missed	O
something	O
in	O
my	O
research	O
but	O
I	O
was	O
wondering	O
if	O
anyone	O
could	O
shed	O
some	O
light	O
on	O
what	O
the	O
differences	O
are	O
between	O
the	O
two	O
.	O

Thanks	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
14076772	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/14076772/	O

Typically	O
the	O
Memento	O
pattern	O
is	O
used	O
to	O
implement	O
roll-back/save	O
point	O
support	O
.	O

For	O
example	O
I	O
might	O
want	O
to	O
mark	O
the	O
state	O
of	O
an	O
object	O
at	O
a	O
point	O
in	O
time	O
,	O
do	O
some	O
work	O
and	O
then	O
decide	O
to	O
revert	O
that	O
object	O
back	O
to	O
the	O
point	O
at	O
which	O
is	O
was	O
marked	O
.	O

The	O
implementation	O
of	O
a	O
Memento	O
pattern	O
could	O
use	O
serialisation	O
,	O
which	O
would	O
involve	O
saving	O
the	O
contents	O
of	O
the	O
object	O
into	O
a	O
byte[]	B-Data_Structure
and	O
keeping	O
in	O
memory	O
or	O
writing	O
to	O
disk	O
.	O

When	O
reverting	O
the	O
content	O
of	O
the	O
object	O
would	O
be	O
rebuilt	O
from	O
the	O
serialised	O
copy	O
.	O

Conversely	O
I	O
could	O
implement	O
a	O
Memento	O
pattern	O
by	O
cloning	O
the	O
object	O
in	O
memory	O
and	O
keeping	O
a	O
reference	O
to	O
the	O
copy	O
and	O
then	O
copying	O
the	O
state	O
back	O
if	O
the	O
object	O
needs	O
reverting	O
.	O

This	O
method	O
does	O
n't	O
use	O
serialisation	O
.	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
14076772	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/14076772/	O

The	O
Memento	O
pattern	O
is	O
an	O
OO	O
design	O
pattern	O
used	O
to	O
keep	O
previous	O
states	O
of	O
an	O
object	O
in	O
memory	O
.	O

It	O
's	O
useful	O
to	O
implement	O
an	O
"	O
Undo	O
"	O
operation	O
,	O
for	O
example	O
.	O

Serialization	O
is	O
the	O
process	O
of	O
transforming	O
a	O
graph	B-Data_Structure
of	O
objects	O
to	O
a	O
byte	B-Data_Structure
array	I-Data_Structure
,	O
in	O
order	O
to	O
save	O
it	O
on	O
disk	O
,	O
or	O
send	O
it	O
to	O
another	O
JVM	O
over	O
the	O
network	O
,	O
for	O
example	O
.	O

They	O
do	O
n't	O
have	O
much	O
in	O
common	O
.	O

:	O

.	O

.	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
16350473	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/16350473/	O

The	O
purpose	O
of	O
std::condition_variable	O
is	O
to	O
wait	O
for	O
some	O
condition	O
to	O
become	O
true	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
not	O
designed	O
to	O
be	O
just	O
a	O
receiver	O
of	O
a	O
notify	O
.	O

You	O
might	O
use	O
it	O
,	O
for	O
example	O
,	O
when	O
a	O
consumer	O
thread	O
needs	O
to	O
wait	O
for	O
a	O
queue	B-Data_Structure
to	O
become	O
non-empty	O
.	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_2114	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

The	O
consumer	O
(	O
get_from_queue	O
)	O
is	O
not	O
waiting	O
for	O
the	O
condition	O
variable	O
,	O
they	O
are	O
waiting	O
for	O
the	O
condition	O
the_queue.empty()	O
.	O

The	O
condition	O
variable	O
gives	O
you	O
the	O
way	O
to	O
put	O
them	O
to	O
sleep	O
while	O
they	O
are	O
waiting	O
,	O
simultaneously	O
releasing	O
the	O
mutex	O
and	O
doing	O
so	O
in	O
a	O
way	O
that	O
avoids	O
race	O
conditions	O
where	O
you	O
miss	O
wake	O
ups	O
.	O

The	O
condition	O
you	O
are	O
waiting	O
on	O
should	O
be	O
protected	O
by	O
a	O
mutex	O
(	O
the	O
one	O
you	O
release	O
when	O
you	O
wait	O
on	O
the	O
condition	O
variable	O
.	O
)	O

This	O
means	O
that	O
the	O
condition	O
rarely	O
(	O
if	O
ever	O
)	O
needs	O
to	O
be	O
an	O
atomic	O
.	O

You	O
are	O
always	O
accessing	O
it	O
from	O
within	O
a	O
mutex	O
.	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
16350473	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/16350473/	O

You	O
can	O
code	O
this	O
either	O
way	O
:	O

Using	O
atomics	O
and	O
a	O
polling	O
loop	O
.	O

Using	O
a	O
condition_variable	O
.	O

I	O
've	O
coded	O
it	O
both	O
ways	O
for	O
you	O
below	O
.	O

On	O
my	O
system	O
I	O
can	O
monitor	O
in	O
real	O
time	O
how	O
much	O
cpu	O
any	O
given	O
process	O
is	O
using	O
.	O

First	O
with	O
the	O
polling	O
loop	O
:	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_2115	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

For	O
me	O
this	O
takes	O
30	O
seconds	O
to	O
execute	O
,	O
and	O
while	O
executing	O
the	O
process	O
takes	O
about	O
99.6	O
%	O
of	O
a	O
cpu	O
.	O

Alternatively	O
with	O
a	O
condition_variable	O
:	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_2116	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

This	O
has	O
the	O
exact	O
same	O
behavior	O
except	O
that	O
during	O
the	O
30	O
second	O
execution	O
,	O
the	O
process	O
is	O
taking	O
0.0	O
%	O
cpu	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
're	O
writing	O
an	O
app	O
that	O
might	O
execute	O
on	O
a	O
battery	O
powered	O
device	O
,	O
the	O
latter	O
is	O
nearly	O
infinitely	O
easier	O
on	O
the	O
battery	O
.	O

Now	O
admittedly	O
,	O
if	O
you	O
had	O
a	O
very	O
poor	O
implementation	O
of	O
std::condition_variable	O
,	O
it	O
could	O
have	O
the	O
same	O
inefficiency	O
as	O
the	O
polling	O
loop	O
.	O

However	O
in	O
practice	O
such	O
a	O
vendor	O
ought	O
to	O
go	O
out	O
of	O
business	O
fairly	O
quickly	O
.	O

Update	O

For	O
grins	O
I	O
augmented	O
my	O
condition_variable	O
wait	O
loop	O
with	O
a	O
spurious	O
wakeup	O
detector	O
.	O

I	O
ran	O
it	O
again	O
,	O
and	O
it	O
did	O
not	O
print	O
out	O
anything	O
.	O

Not	O
one	O
spurious	O
wakeup	O
.	O

That	O
is	O
of	O
course	O
not	O
guaranteed	O
.	O

But	O
it	O
does	O
demonstrate	O
what	O
a	O
quality	O
implementation	O
can	O
achieve	O
.	O

Question_ID	O
:	O
37291839	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/37291839/	O

How	O
to	O

URL	O
matches	O
the	O
black	O
list	O
e.g	O

http://domain.com/ads/	B-Code_Block
...	I-Code_Block
.	O

versions	O
of	O
AdBlock	O
allows	O
to	O
block	O
Flash	O
embeds	O
from	O
roll-over	O
menu	B-User_Interface_Element
.	O

,	O
expecially	O
mobile	O
ones	O
,	O
can	O

all	O

the	O

anything	O
with	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
36272581	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/36272581/	O

A	O
little	O
preamble	O
:	O
Knockback	B-Library
puts	O
the	O
model	O
in	O
MVVM	O
,	O
where	O
Knockout	B-Library
is	O
really	O
just	O
VVM	O
.	O

Knockback	B-Library
also	O
gives	O
you	O
some	O
automatic	O
synchronization	O
between	O
them	O
,	O
which	O
is	O
nice	O
.	O

But	O
you	O
still	O
need	O
to	O
keep	O
in	O
mind	O
that	O
the	O
model	O
and	O
the	O
viewmodel	O
are	O
two	O
different	O
pieces	O
of	O
your	O
app	O
.	O

The	O
viewmodel	O
is	O
n't	O
just	O
a	O
Knockout	B-Library
copy	O
of	O
the	O
Bootstrap	B-Library
model	O
.	O

Do	O
n't	O
put	O
viewmodel	O
pieces	O
in	O
the	O
model	O
.	O

So	O
you	O
need	O
to	O
decide	O
whether	O
validation	O
is	O
a	O
viewmodel	O
behavior	O
or	O
a	O
model	O
behavior	O
.	O

I	O
say	O
viewmodel	O
,	O
because	O
you	O
want	O
to	O
use	O
it	O
in	O
the	O
view	O
.	O

So	O
remove	O
it	O
from	O
the	O
model	O
and	O
define	O
a	O
computed	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
if	O
you	O
wanted	O
it	O
to	O
be	O
part	O
of	O
the	O
model	O
,	O
you	O
would	O
want	O
to	O
define	O
an	O
attribute	O
,	O
not	O
just	O
a	O
method	O
,	O
and	O
a	O
model	O
event	O
handler	O
that	O
would	O
update	O
the	O
attribute	O
on	O
change	O
.	O

Knockback	B-Library
will	O
dutifully	O
copy	O
the	O
attribute	O
into	O
the	O
viewmodel	O
,	O
and	O
you	O
can	O
use	O
it	O
there	O
.	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
Q_5182	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

Question_ID	O
:	O
6928871	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/6928871/	O

Overview	O
:	O

I	O
have	O
written	O
an	O
application	O
that	O
allows	O
a	O
user	O
to	O
define	O
a	O
query	O
,	O
submit	O
it	O
to	O
a	O
server	O
and	O
view	O
the	O
results	O
.	O

The	O
software	O
can	O
run	O
on	O
DB2	O
or	O
MySQL	O
.	O

Problem	O
:	O

We	O
've	O
had	O
issues	O
in	O
the	O
DB2	O
version	O
where	O
a	O
user	O
has	O
tried	O
to	O
run	O
a	O
query	O
,	O
and	O
found	O
that	O
it	O
has	O
failed	O
because	O
their	O
user	O
profile	O
has	O
been	O
disabled	O
.	O

In	O
order	O
to	O
run	O
a	O
query	O
on	O
DB2	O
(	O
on	O
an	O
IBM	O
i)	O
,	O
the	O
user	O
's	O
profile	O
name	O
and	O
password	O
are	O
provided	O
in	O
the	O
connection	O
string	O
.	O

Security	O
on	O
the	O
server	O
can	O
specify	O
that	O
a	O
user	O
's	O
profile	O
is	O
disabled	O
after	O
two	O
or	O
three	O
incorrect	O
logins	O
.	O

Question	O
:	O

I	O
've	O
debugged	O
the	O
application	O
and	O
found	O
that	O
the	O
problem	O
is	O
down	O
to	O
the	O
query	O
being	O
submitted	O
twice	O
.	O

If	O
the	O
user	O
's	O
password	O
is	O
wrong	O
,	O
then	O
of	O
course	O
,	O
this	O
is	O
having	O
the	O
knock-on	O
effect	O
of	O
disabling	O
their	O
profile	O
.	O

On	O
further	O
inspection	O
,	O
when	O
I	O
've	O
inspected	O
the	O
logs	O
on	O
the	O
server	O
(	O
while	O
debugging	O
line	O
by	O
line	O
)	O
,	O
I	O
've	O
found	O
that	O
the	O
query	O
is	O
submitted	O
to	O
the	O
server	O
when	O
you	O
call	O
TADOQuery.sql.add()	O
,	O
and	O
again	O
when	O
the	O
TADOQuery	O
's	O
active	O
propery	O
is	O
set	O
to	O
true	O
(	O
which	O
is	O
the	O
point	O
at	O
which	O
I	O
would	O
expect	O
the	O
query	O
to	O
be	O
submitted	O
to	O
the	O
server	O
)	O
.	O

Here	O
's	O
an	O
example	O
of	O
the	O
code	O
that	O
I	O
'm	O
using	O
to	O
run	O
the	O
query	O
:	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
Q_525	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

My	O
question	O
is	O
therefore	O
quite	O
simple	O
:	O

1	O
.	O
Why	O
does	O
the	O
TADOQuery.sql.add()	O
method	O
submit	O
the	O
query	O
(	O
when	O
it	O
should	O
just	O
be	O
adding	O
the	O
sql	O
to	O
the	O
TADOQuery	O
's	O
sql	O
property	O
)	O
?	O

2	O
.	O
What	O
can	O
I	O
do	O
to	O
prevent	O
this	O
?	O

i.e	O
.	O
is	O
there	O
any	O
way	O
to	O
prevent	O
the	O
sql	O
being	O
submitted	O
when	O
I	O
call	O
the	O
add()	O
method	O
?	O

For	O
those	O
of	O
you	O
that	O
would	O
like	O
extra	O
information	O
about	O
the	O
logs	O
,	O
the	O
exit	O
point	O
logs	O
on	O
the	O
IBM	O
i	O
show	O
that	O
when	O
I	O
call	O
adoqry.sql.add	O
in	O
the	O
above	O
example	O
,	O
the	O
query	O
is	O
run	O
through	O
the	O
"	O
Database	O
Server-SQL	O
Requests	O
"	O
exit	O
point	O
application	O
,	O
via	O
function	O
"	O
Prepare	O
and	O
Describe	O
"	O
.	O

When	O
I	O
call	O
adoqry.active	B-Code_Block
:=	I-Code_Block
true	I-Code_Block
in	O
the	O
above	O
example	O
,	O
the	O
same	O
query	O
goes	O
through	O
the	O
same	O
exit	O
point	O
application	O
,	O
but	O
via	O
the	O
"	O
Open/Describe	O
"	O
function	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
're	O
not	O
familiar	O
with	O
the	O
IBM	O
i	O
,	O
do	O
n't	O
worry	O
about	O
it	O
-	O
I	O
'm	O
just	O
including	O
that	O
information	O
as	O
proof	O
that	O
I	O
have	O
traced	O
the	O
query	O
being	O
submitted	O
twice	O
.	O

The	O
real	O
issue	O
is	O
with	O
the	O
TADOQuery	B-Library
's	O
sql.add()	O
processing	O
.	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
6928871	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/6928871/	O

From	O
your	O
description	O
of	O
your	O
problem	O
,	O
I	O
assume	O
you	O
specify	O
the	O
ConnectionString	O
of	O
the	O
ADOQuery	O
.	O

Doing	O
this	O
combines	O
the	O
database	O
login	O
with	O
the	O
running	O
of	O
the	O
query	O
.	O

You	O
have	O
found	O
that	O
this	O
has	O
undesirable	O
side	O
effects	O
when	O
the	O
user	O
's	O
credentials	O
are	O
invalid	O
.	O

Separate	O
the	O
database	O
login	O
from	O
the	O
query	O
by	O
using	O
an	O
ADOConnection	O
.	O

Specify	O
the	O
ConnectionString	O
of	O
the	O
ADOConnection	O
and	O
assign	O
the	O
ADOConnection	O
to	O
the	O
ADOQuery.Connection	O
property	O
.	O

This	O
way	O
,	O
you	O
control	O
the	O
database	O
login	O
and	O
can	O
catch	O
logins	O
with	O
bad	O
credentials	O
.	O

Additionally	O
the	O
ADOConnection.Open	O
method	O
allows	O
you	O
to	O
specify	O
the	O
username	O
and	O
password	O
so	O
you	O
do	O
not	O
have	O
to	O
put	O
them	O
in	O
the	O
ConnectionString	O
.	O

While	O
this	O
does	O
not	O
answer	O
you	O
specific	O
questions	O
,	O
this	O
approach	O
will	O
help	O
you	O
solve	O
the	O
problem	O
of	O
the	O
user	O
's	O
profile	O
being	O
disabled	O
by	O
separating	O
the	O
login	O
from	O
the	O
running	O
of	O
the	O
query	O
.	O

,	I-Code_Block
n	I-Code_Block

n	B-Code_Block
>	I-Code_Block

19332981	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/19332981/	O

Shipping	O
can	O
be	O
allowed	O
only	O
to	O
defined	O
countries	O
.	O

It	O
can	O
be	O
set	O
in	O
shipping	O
method	O
settings	O
(	O
system->configuration->shipping	O
methods->your	O
shipping	O
method->Ship	O
to	O
Applicable	O
Countries	O
)	O
.	O

There	O
are	O
couple	O
of	O
values	O
:	O
"	O
Ship	O
to	O
Applicable	O
Countries	O
"	O
and	O
"	O
Specific	O
Countries	O
"	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
set	O
up	O
second	O
value	O
,	O
shipping	O
will	O
be	O
aviable	O
only	O
to	O
that	O
countries	O
,	O
that	O
you	O
will	O
select	O
in	O
the	O
feald	O
below	O
.	O

You	O
could	O
try	O
using	O
the	O
[	B-Code_Block
ScriptIgnore	I-Code_Block
]	I-Code_Block
attribute	O
on	O
your	O
property	O
.	O

will	O
cause	O
the	O
JavaScriptSerializer	O
to	O
ignore	O
it	O
.	O

,	O
this	O
means	O
that	O
it	O
will	O
be	O
ignored	O
on	O
deserialization	O
as	O
well	O
.	O

'm	O
not	O
sure	O
whether	O
that	O
is	O
an	O
issue	O
for	O
your	O
situation	O
or	O
not	O
.	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
22498881	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/22498881/	O

Looks	O
like	O
the	O
problem	O
here	O
is	O
that	O
you	O
are	O
using	O
a	O
FLoatLayout	O
.	O

When	O
you	O
move	O
a	O
normal	O
layout	O
(	O
such	O
as	O
a	O
FloatLayout	O
)	O
,	O
it	O
does	O
not	O
automatically	O
change	O
the	O
children	O
's	O
co-ordinates	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
want	O
that	O
behavior	O
,	O
try	O
using	O
a	O
RelativeLayout	O
.	O

http://kivy.org/docs/api-kivy.uix.relativelayout.html	O

Peace	O
out	O

Question_ID	O
:	O
7148916	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/7148916/	O

I	O
have	O
a	O
table	B-Data_Structure
with	O
8.2	O
million	O
entries	O
in	O
a	O
SQL	O
Server	O
2005	O
database	O
.	O

This	O
table	B-Data_Structure
stores	O
basic	O
past	O
customer	O
details	O
(	O
referrer	O
,	O
ip	O
,	O
whether	O
they	O
entered	O
via	O
an	O
advertisement	O
,	O
etc	O
)	O
for	O
every	O
customer	O
we	O
have	O
had	O
come	O
to	O
the	O
site	O
.	O

Unfortunately	O
,	O
whoever	O
designed	O
the	O
table	B-Data_Structure
(	O
way	O
before	O
I	O
was	O
here	O
,	O
I	O
'm	O
a	O
lowly	O
intern	O
)	O
used	O
a	O
varchar(50)	O
field	O
for	O
the	O
ip	O
address	O
field	O
in	O
the	O
table	B-Data_Structure
.	O

Now	O
,	O
I	O
have	O
been	O
tasked	O
with	O
finding	O
a	O
way	O
to	O
run	O
a	O
query	O
to	O
see	O
if	O
we	O
have	O
an	O
entry	O

It	O
's	O
dangerously	O
unsafe	O
(	O
undefined	O
behavior	O
)	O
to	O
return	O
a	O
pointer	O
to	O
a	O
stack	B-Data_Structure
variable	O
.	O

That	O
includes	O
arrays	B-Data_Structure
allocated	O
on	O
the	O
stack	B-Data_Structure
.	O

The	O
memory	O
occupied	O
by	O
a	O
stack	B-Data_Structure
variable	O
is	O
essentially	O
deallocated	O
as	O
soon	O
as	O
the	O
function	O
returns	O
.	O

is	O
safer	O

.	O

can	O
only	O
do	O
1	O
.	O

do	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_1555	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block

for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

But	O
this	O
gives	O
you	O
the	O
position	O
of	O
the	O
fragment	O
in	O
screen-space	O

relative	O

:	O
12111325	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/12111325/	O

If	O
you	O
want	O
to	O
know	O
the	O
coordinate	O
within	O
the	O
quad	O
,	O
you	O
need	O
to	O
calculate	O
it	O
yourself	O
.	O

In	O
order	O
to	O
that	O
,	O
you	O
'll	O
need	O
to	O
create	O
a	O
new	O
interpolant	O
(	O
call	O
it	O
something	O
like	O
vec2	B-Code_Block
quadCoord	I-Code_Block
)	O
,	O
and	O
set	O
it	O
appropriately	O
for	O
each	O
vertex	O
,	O
which	O
means	O
you	O
'll	O
likely	O
also	O
need	O
to	O
add	O
it	O
as	O
an	O
attribute	O
and	O
pass	O
it	O
through	O
your	O
vertex	O
shader	O
.	O

eg	O
:	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_1554	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

You	O
'll	O
need	O
to	O
feed	O
in	O
this	O
attribute	O
in	O
your	O
drawing	O
code	O
when	O
drawing	O
your	O
quads	O
.	O

For	O
each	O
quad	O
,	O
the	O
vertexes	O
will	O
have	O
likely	O
have	O
quadCoordIn	O
values	O
of	O
(	O
0	O
,	O
0	O
)	O
,	O
(	O
0	O
,	O
1)	O
,	O
(	O
1	O
,	O
1)	O
and	O
(	O
1	O
,	O
0	O
)	O
-	O
-	O
you	O
could	O
use	O
some	O
other	O
coordinate	O
system	O
if	O
you	O
prefer	O
,	O
but	O
this	O
is	O
the	O
easiest	O
.	O

Then	O
,	O
in	O
your	O
fragment	O
program	O
,	O
you	O
can	O
access	O
quadCoord.xy	O
to	O
determine	O
where	O
in	O
the	O
quad	O
you	O
are	O
.	O

Your	O
suggestion	O
sounds	O
good	O
to	O
me	O
.	O

If	O
the	O
file	O
format	O
is	O
really	O
so	O
predictable	O
,	O
any	O
more	O
sophisticated	O
approaches	O
might	O
just	O
be	O
overkill	O
in	O
my	O
opinion	O
.	O

But	O
if	O
you	O
want	O
to	O
see	O
a	O
different	O
approach	O
,	O
this	O
is	O
my	O
idea	O
:	O
Every	O
line	O
that	O
does	O
not	O
start	O
with	O
an	O
%	B-Code_Block
is	O
something	O
we	O
want	O
to	O
parse	O
to	O
an	O
ArrayList	O
.	O

So	O
,	O
whenever	O
you	O
come	O
across	O
a	O
line	O
that	O
is	O
not	O
a	O
comment	O
,	O
you	O
start	O
parsing	O
the	O
following	O
lines	O
to	O
an	O
ArrayList	O
until	O
you	O
either	O
hit	O
another	O
comment	O
or	O
the	O
end	O
of	O
the	O
file	O
.	O

Both	O
options	O
mark	O
the	O
end	O
of	O
the	O
part	O
that	O
you	O
want	O
to	O
store	O
in	O
one	O
single	O
ArrayList	O
.	O

So	O
,	O
something	O
like	O
this	O
:	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_3117	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

where	O
lineIsComment	B-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
String	I-Code_Block
line	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block
returns	O
a	O
boolean	O
that	O
indicates	O
whether	O
the	O
given	O
line	O
is	O
a	O
comment	O
,	O
and	O
addToList	B-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
String	I-Code_Block
line	I-Code_Block
,	I-Code_Block
ArrayList	I-Code_Block
<Integer>	I-Code_Block
list	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block
uses	O
your	O
method	O
to	O
parse	O
a	O
line	O
of	O
numbers	O
and	O
stores	O
them	O
in	O
the	O
provided	O
list	O
.	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block

(	I-Code_Block

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
15845547	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/15845547/	O

Removing	O
a	O
display	O
object	O
from	O
the	O
display	O
list	B-Data_Structure
,	O
does	O
n't	O
stop	O
the	O
animation	O
or	O
remove	O
it	O
from	O
memory	O
.	O

It	O
just	O
removes	O
it	O
from	O
the	O
display	O
list	B-Data_Structure
.	O

Yes	O
,	O
you	O
need	O
to	O
stop	O
the	O
animation	O
and	O
remove	O
any	O
event	O
listeners	O
that	O
might	O
be	O
active	O
for	O
that	O
object	O
.	O

A	O
display	O
object	O
is	O
never	O
truly	O
gone	O
until	O
it	O
is	O
garbage	O
collected	O
.	O

But	O
that	O
will	O
not	O
happen	O
until	O
no	O
references	O
to	O
that	O
object	O
remain	O
.	O

So	O
if	O
you	O
have	O
a	O
variable	O
called	O
explosion	O
that	O
references	O
your	O
display	O
object	O
,	O
you	O
need	O
to	O
set	O
it	O
to	O
null	O
after	O
removing	O
it	O
from	O
the	O
display	O
list	B-Data_Structure
:	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_2053	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

Keep	O
in	O
mind	O
that	O
this	O
does	O
n't	O
immediately	O
remove	O
the	O
object	O
from	O
memory	O
,	O
it	O
just	O
makes	O
it	O
fair	O
game	O
for	O
the	O
garbage	O
collector	O
.	O

You	O
can	O
google	O
"	O
AS3	O
Garbage	O
Collection	O
"	O
to	O
get	O
more	O
information	O
on	O
that	O
process	O
.	O

to	O
work	O

.	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
30308968	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/30308968/	O

All	O
the	O
images	B-User_Interface_Element
are	O
getting	O
the	O
same	O
filename	O
because	O
the	O
code	O
runs	O
fast	O
enough	O
such	O
that	O
the	O
time()	O
function	O
(	O
which	O
returns	O
the	O
time	O
in	O
seconds	O
)	O
is	O
giving	O
you	O
the	O
same	O
value	O
4	O
times	O
.	O

So	O
you	O
're	O
overwriting	O
the	O
same	O
file	O
4	O
times	O
in	O
this	O
line	O
:	O

:	O
48180837	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/48180837/	O

1.You	O
are	O
not	O
using	O
Network	O
topology	O
.	O

2.Your	O
replication	O
factor	O
is	O
2	O
.	O

Simple	O
strategy	O
:	O
Use	O
only	O
for	O
a	O
single	O
datacenter	O
and	O
one	O
rack	O
.	O

SimpleStrategy	O
places	O
the	O
first	O
replica	O
on	O
a	O
node	B-Data_Structure
determined	O
by	O
the	O
partitioner	O
.	O

Additional	O
replicas	O
are	O
placed	O
on	O
the	O
next	O
nodes	B-Data_Structure
clockwise	O
in	O
the	O
ring	O
without	O
considering	O
topology	O
(	O
rack	O
or	O
datacenter	O
location	O
)	O
.	O

Go	O
to	O
this	O
link	O
:	O

https://docs.datastax.com/en/cassandra/3.0/cassandra/architecture/archDataDistributeReplication.html	O

function	O

representation	O
from	O
disk	O

converts	O

to	O

,	O
and	O
sorts	O
that	O
array	B-Data_Structure

.	O

does	O
n't	O
work	O
anymore	O
,	O
I	O

an	O
error	O
to	O

to	O

.	O

ca	O

returns	O
a	O

object	O
.	O

which	O
basically	O
tells	O
you	O
how	O
many	O
days/hours/mins/secs/milliseconds/ticks	O
that	O
occured	O
between	O
the	O
2	O
DateTimes	O
.	O

Question_ID	O
:	O
14639108	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/14639108/	O

Imagine	O
a	O
plane	O
with	O
a	O
number	O
of	O
points	O
at	O
known	O
locations	O
.	O

Most	O
are	O
clustered	O
close	O
together	O
,	O
but	O
some	O
are	O
outliers	O
,	O
and	O
there	O
are	O
large	O
areas	O
where	O
there	O
are	O
no	O
points	O
at	O
all	O
.	O

I	O
have	O
multiple	O
clients	O
who	O
can	O
view	O
the	O
plane	O
through	O
rectangular	O
viewports	O
.	O

Each	O
client	O
's	O
viewport	O
may	O
be	O
of	O
different	O
dimensions	O
,	O
and	O
can	O
be	O
moved	O
instantly	O
to	O
any	O
location	O
on	O
the	O
plane	O
.	O

The	O
clients	O
do	O
not	O
know	O
the	O
locations	O
of	O
the	O
points	O
;	O
only	O
the	O
server	O
does	O
.	O

When	O
a	O
client	O
connects	O
,	O
it	O
will	O
communicate	O
the	O
size	O
of	O
its	O
viewport	O
to	O
the	O
server	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
server	O
should	O
respond	O
with	O
a	O
location	O
where	O
one	O
or	O
more	O
points	O
will	O
be	O
visible	O
to	O
that	O
client	O
's	O
viewport	O
.	O

The	O
client	O
visits	O
that	O
location	O
,	O
collects	O
data	O
from	O
visiting	O
those	O
points	O
,	O
sends	O
that	O
data	O
back	O
to	O
the	O
server	O
,	O
then	O
requests	O
the	O
next	O
location	O
to	O
visit	O
.	O

This	O
continues	O
until	O
all	O
points	O
have	O
been	O
visited	O
by	O
at	O
least	O
one	O
client	O
.	O

I	O
need	O
an	O
efficient	O
algorithm	O
that	O
will	O
choose	O
the	O
locations	O
to	O
visit	O
.	O

An	O
ideal	O
solution	O
will	O
minimize	O
the	O
number	O
of	O
locations	O
that	O
clients	O
need	O
to	O
visit	O
by	O
including	O
as	O
many	O
unvisited	O
points	O
as	O
possible	O
within	O
a	O
viewport	O
location	O
,	O
minimizing	O
duplicate	O
visits	O
on	O
points	O
,	O
and	O
not	O
visiting	O
locations	O
with	O
no	O
unvisited	O
points	O
.	O

Can	O
you	O
recommend	O
an	O
algorithm	O
?	O

do	O
this	O
:	O

I	O
have	O
2	O
FileHandlers	O
that	O
write	O
out	O
to	O
two	O
separate	O
files	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
I/O	O
occurring	O
is	O
slowing	O
down	O
my	O
application	O
quite	O
a	O
bit	O
:	O

I	O
've	O
decided	O
to	O
have	O
the	O
FileHandlers	O
run	O
on	O
separate	O
threads	O
.	O

As	O
they	O
are	O
on	O
separate	O
threads	O
,	O
I	O
needed	O
a	O
concept	O
of	O
a	O
"	O
queue	B-Data_Structure
"	O
,	O
so	O
that	O
these	O
separate	O
threads	O
can	O
poll	O
this	O
queue	O
and	O
print	O
out	O
any	O
incoming	O
messages	O
.	O

I	O
've	O
preformatted	O
messages	O
so	O
that	O
any	O
arguments	O
used	O
do	O
not	O
change	O
before	O
they	O
actually	O
reach	O
the	O
print	O
out	O
in	O
the	O
FileHandler	O
.	O

Now	O
I	O
've	O
realised	O
that	O
I	O
ca	O
n't	O
use	O
the	O
"	O
log	O
"	O
methods	O
provided	O
by	O
the	O
logger	O
,	O
as	O
that	O
attempts	O
to	O
invoke	O
methods	O
on	O
the	O
current	O
thread	O
to	O
format	O
and	O
print	O
out	O
the	O

.	O

I	O
simply	O
call	O
a	O
method	O
that	O

trace	O
message	O
to	O
the	O
queue	O
.	O

I	O

use	O
run()	O
method	O
of	O

out	O
the	O

.	O

I	O
now	O
realise	O

only	O
takes	O
in	O
a	O

,	O

is	O
just	O
a	O
level	O
+	O
message	O
.	O

My	O
traces	O
have	O
much	O
more	O
,	O
which	O
ca	O
n't	O
simply	O
be	O
placed	O
in	O
an	O
overall	O
message	O
,	O
I	O
want	O
to	O
be	O
able	O
to	O
use	O
the	O
"	O
Formatter	O
"	O
that	O

've	O
set	O
to	O
the	O
FileHandler	O
.	O

So	O
I	O
create	O
an	O

of	O
the	O
logger	O
in	O

FileHandler	O
,	O

the	O
log	O
method	O
and	O

the	O
string	O
as	O
designed	O
in	O
the	O
Formatter	O
.	O

Which	O
works	O
,	O
kinda	O
.	O

..	O
.	O

This	O
is	O
getting	O
a	O
bit	O
silly	O
,	O
is	O
it	O
worth	O
continuing	O
on	O
like	O
this	O
,	O
working	O
AROUND	O
the	O
java.util.Logger	O
rather	O
than	O
working	O
with	O
it	O
?	O

One	O
of	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
27406632	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/27406632/	O

You	O
should	O
really	O
consider	O
using	O
SLF4J	B-Library
.	O

These	O
issues	O
you	O
are	O
describing	O
come	O
along	O
with	O
rolling	O
your	O
own	O
logger	O
.	O

SLF4J	B-Library
is	O
really	O
commonly	O
used	O
because	O
it	O
is	O
not	O
very	O
intrusive	O
,	O
should	O
you	O
decide	O
that	O
you	O
need	O
something	O
different	O
you	O
can	O
swap	O
it	O
out	O
for	O
a	O
different	O
framework	O
.	O

http://saltnlight5.blogspot.ca/2013/08/how-to-configure-slf4j-with-different.html	O

http://www.slf4j.org/manual.html	O

If	O
you	O
do	O
decide	O
to	O
stick	O
with	O
your	O
own	O
logger	O
I	O
would	O
say	O
that	O
you	O
should	O
start	O
by	O
making	O
it	O
a	O
singleton	O
with	O
several	O
logwriters	O
attached	O
to	O
log	O
levels	O
,	O
you	O
then	O
setup	O
a	O
non-blocking	O
queue	B-Data_Structure
for	O
each	O
logger	O
(	O
there	O
are	O
tons	O
of	O
examples	O
of	O
this	O
out	O
there	O
)	O
and	O
simply	O
call	O
log(logLevel,	O
logOrigin,	O
logMessage)	O
and	O
under	O
the	O
hood	O
send	O
this	O
to	O
each	O
logwriter	O
,	O
which	O
would	O
be	O
a	O
non-blocking	O
queue	B-Data_Structure
that	O
runs	O
on	O
a	O
thread	O
for	O
each	O
logwriter	O
.	O

Each	O
logwriter	O
should	O
be	O
it	O
's	O
own	O
thread	O
,	O
not	O
each	O
log	O
,	O
and	O
you	O
only	O
need	O
one	O
logger	O
as	O
all	O
it	O
is	O
is	O
a	O
short	O
hand	O
to	O
place	O
things	O
in	O
your	O
logwriter	O
's	O
queues	B-Data_Structure
from	O
anywhere	O
in	O
your	O
app	O
.	O

Question_ID	O
:	O
15729742	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/15729742/	O

I	O
'm	O
using	O
an	O
AVAssetReaderOutput	O
to	O
read	O
samples	O
from	O
an	O
AVAsset	O
,	O
do	O
some	O
processing	O
on	O
them	O
,	O
and	O
play	O
the	O
result	O
using	O
a	O
RemoteIO	O
AU	O
.	O

The	O
problem	O
is	O
that	O
after	O
calling	O
AudioOutputUnitStop	O
to	O
pause	O
the	O
playback	O
,	O
then	O
after	O
going	O
to	O
the	O
background	O
and	O
back	O
to	O
the	O
foreground	O
the	O
audio	O
wo	O
n't	O
start	O
again	O
after	O
calling	O
AudioOutputUnitStart	O
.	O

This	O
is	O
due	O
to	O
an	O
error	O
returned	O
from	O
the	O
copyNextSampleBuffer	O
method	O
of	O
AVAssetReaderOutput	O
,	O
which	O
is	O
called	O
as	O
part	O
of	O
the	O
rendering	O
pipeline	O
.	O

I	O
'm	O
looking	O
for	O
a	O
solution	O
which	O
wo	O
n't	O
force	O
me	O
to	O
reinitialize	O
the	O
entire	O
pipeline	O
after	O
coming	O
back	O
to	O
the	O
foreground	O
-	O
Hoping	O
there	O
is	O
such	O
a	O
solution	O
,	O
that	O
AVAssetReaders	O
can	O
survive	O
the	O
app	O
going	O
to	O
background	O
and	O
back.	O
.	O

Notes	O

The	O
app	O
is	O
entitled	O
to	O
play	O
audio	O
in	O
the	O
background	O
.	O

I	O
'm	O
handling	O
audio	O
interruptions	O
-	O
Setting	O
my	O
AVAudioSession	O
as	O
the	O
active	O
one	O
both	O
on	O
AVAudioSessionDelegates	O
endInterruptionWithFlags	O
:	O
event	O
and	O
whenever	O
the	O
app	O
becomes	O
active	O
.	O

Does	O

make	O
a	O
difference	O
whether	O
I	O
do	O
this	O
or	O
not	O
,	O
getting	O
the	O
same	O
error	O
.	O

Some	O
code	O
:	O

AudioPlayer	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
15729742	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/15729742/	O

The	O
graph	B-User_Interface_Element
and	O
AVReader	O
underpinnings	O
are	O
not	O
connected/linked	O
whatsoever	O
.	O

That	O
's	O
why	O
when	O
you	O
stop	O
the	O
audio	B-User_Interface_Element
graph	I-User_Interface_Element
,	O
2-3	O
minutes	O
later	O
,	O
iOS	O
will	O
background	O
your	O
process	O
(	O
as	O
of	O
iOS	O
9	O
)	O
.	O

Presumably	O
,	O
iOS	O
looks	O
at	O
what	O
's	O
going	O
on	O
in	O
your	O
process	O
and	O
decides	O
when	O
your	O
process	O
should	O
be	O
forced	O
to	O
background	O
(	O
via	O
beginBackgroundTaskWithName:expirationHandler	B-Code_Block
)	O
.	O

Apple	O
devs	O
decided	O
for	O
whatever	O
reason	O
to	O
make	O
AVReader	O
stop	O
when	O
put	O
into	O
background	O
mode	O
(	O
my	O
best	O
guess	O
is	O
QA	O
)	O
.	O

The	O
good	O
news	O
is	O
that	O
you	O
can	O
detect	O
it	O
and	O
recover	O
when	O
your	O
process	O
exits	O
background	O
mode	O
,	O
but	O
you	O
WILL	O
need	O
to	O
restart	O
your	O
reader	O
and	O
readerOutput	O
again	O
.	O

First	O
,	O
when	O
AVAssetReaderOutput	O
's	O
copyNextSampleBuffer	O
returns	O
NULL	O
,	O
check	O
AVAssetReader.error.code	O
for	O
AVErrorOperationInterrupted	O
.	O

The	O
way	O
we	O
pull	O
off	O
a	O
gapless	O
recovery	O
here	O
is	O
when	O
we	O
get	O
to	O
that	O
point	O
,	O
we	O
first	O
calculate	O
the	O
exact	O
time	O
we	O
left	O
off	O
at	O
(	O
easy	O
to	O
do	O
-	O
-	O
just	O
maintain	O
a	O
counter	O
of	O
the	O
total	O
samples	O
already	O
output	O
)	O
.	O

Then	O
,	O
you	O
WILL	O
need	O
to	O
restart	O
your	O
AVAssetReader	O
and	O
AVAssetReaderOutput	O
flow	O
.	O

But	O
that	O
's	O
no	O
problem	O
since	O
your	O
good	O
development	O
practices	O
would	O
have	O
encapsulated	O
that	O
in	O
a	O
single	O
function	O
that	O
has	O
a	O
seek	O
time	O
as	O
an	O
argument	O
.	O

In	O
that	O
function	O
,	O
use	O
AVAssetReader.timeRange	O
to	O
seek	O
to	O
that	O
time	O
you	O
need	O
to	O
resume	O
at	O
and	O
presto	O
!	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
15729742	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/15729742/	O

There	O
first	O
thing	O
I	O
would	O
try	O
is	O
:	O

Not	O
calling	O
AudioOutputUnitStop	O
?	O

Why	O
do	O
n't	O
you	O
leave	O
the	O
graph	B-User_Interface_Element
running	O
and	O
when	O
the	O
audio	O
is	O
paused	O
simply	O
not	O
call	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_2061	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

Instead	O
just	O
fill	O
the	O
buffer	B-Data_Structure
with	O
0	O
's	O
and/or	O
use	O
a	O
render	O
action	O
of	O
kAudioUnitRenderAction_OutputIsSilence	O
for	O
the	O
buffers	B-Data_Structure
.	O

Starting	O
and	O
stopping	O
the	O
graph	B-User_Interface_Element
takes	O
time	O
and	O
leads	O
to	O
an	O
unresponsive	O
graph	B-User_Interface_Element
.	O

I	O
never	O
stop	O
the	O
graph	B-User_Interface_Element
while	O
my	O
apps	O
are	O
running	O
.	O

(	O
Unless	O
some	O
serious	O
interruption	O
happens	O
)	O
This	O
may	O
keep	O
the	O
asset	O
reader	O
around	O
and	O
happy	O
.	O

But	O
I	O
have	O
a	O
hunch	O
that	O
as	O
the	O
AVAssetReader	O
is	O
not	O
directly	O
connected	O
to	O
the	O
audio	B-User_Interface_Element
graph	I-User_Interface_Element
(	O
you	O
just	O
happen	O
to	O
request	O
samples	O
and	O
place	O
them	O
in	O
the	O
buffer	B-Data_Structure
supplied	O
by	O
the	O
render	O
callback	O
)	O
the	O
problem	O
does	O
not	O
lie	O
with	O
the	O
audio	B-User_Interface_Element
graph	I-User_Interface_Element
being	O
stopped	O
and	O
restarted	O
at	O
all	O
.	O

So	O
the	O
next	O
line	O
of	O
attack	O
I	O
would	O
try	O
is	O
to	O
request	O
samples	O
from	O
an	O
AVAsset	O
,	O
put	O
the	O
app	O
into	O
the	O
background	O
and	O
bring	O
it	O
back	O
to	O
the	O
foreground	O
without	O
using	O
an	O
AUGraph	O
at	O
all	O
.	O

This	O
will	O
determine	O
if	O
the	O
problem	O
is	O
related	O
to	O
the	O
AUGraph	O
or	O
the	O
app	O
entering	O
a	O
background	O
state	O
.	O

If	O
something	O
happens	O
that	O
forces	O
you	O
to	O
tear	O
down	O
your	O
AVAssetReader	O
you	O
will	O
have	O
to	O
reconnect	O
to	O
the	O
asset	O
.	O

So	O
as	O
you	O
have	O
to	O
write	O
that	O
code	O
another	O
the	O
option	O
I	O
would	O
look	O
at	O
is	O
the	O
one	O
you	O
do	O
n't	O
want	O
to	O
do	O
.	O

Reconnect	O
to	O
the	O
AVAssetReader	O
,	O
seek	O
to	O
the	O
position	O
you	O
left	O
off	O
at	O
and	O
keep	O
going	O
.	O

Does	O
anyone	O
have	O
any	O

for	O

to	O

must	O
be	O

way	O
than	O

results	O
and	O

in	O
memory	O
.	O

an	O
inventive	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_3661	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
26514544	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/26514544/	O

You	O
ca	O
n't	O
use	O
array	B-Data_Structure
syntax	O
(array	B-Code_Block
[	I-Code_Block
index	I-Code_Block
]	I-Code_Block
)	O
for	O
stacks	O
,	O
you	O
have	O
to	O
use	O
push()	O
,	O
pop()	O
,	O
and	O
peek()	O

Stacks	O
work	O
on	O
a	O
first-in	O
,	O
last-out	O
basis	O
.	O

So	O
,	O
the	O
only	O
element	O
in	O
the	O
stack	O
that	O
is	O
accessible	O
is	O
the	O
top	O
one	O
.	O

When	O
you	O
use	O
pop()	O
,	O
you	O
remove	O
the	O
top	O
item	O
so	O
that	O
the	O
next	O
can	O
be	O
accessed	O
.	O

push()	O
is	O
used	O
to	O
put	O
a	O
value	O
on	O
the	O
top	O
and	O
peek()	O
is	O
used	O
to	O
check	O
the	O
top	O
item	O
without	O
popping	O
it	O
.	O

If	O
I	O
have	O
the	O
following	O
stack	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_3656	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

Using	O
pop()	O
,	O
will	O
return	O
"	O
Sam	O
"	O
and	O
remove	O
it	O
from	O
the	O
stack	B-Data_Structure
,	O
so	O
it	O
will	O
look	O
like	O
this	O
.	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_3657	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

Pushing	O
"	O
Charlie	O
"	O
will	O
make	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
Q_2913	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

The	O
reason	O
I	O
mentioned	O
the	O
queue	B-Data_Structure
because	O
i	O
tried	O

by	O

below	O
code	O
from	O
'	O

'	O

getcontext(&(save.context))	O
;	O

addToQueue(save)	O
;	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
25614976	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/25614976/	O

For	O
one	O
,	O
your	O
queue	B-Data_Structure
implementation	O
is	O
not	O
thread-safe	O
at	O
this	O
point	O
.	O

Your	O
question	O
strongly	O
suggests	O
that	O
this	O
code	O
will	O
be	O
used	O
in	O
a	O
multi-threaded	O
environment	O
.	O

Having	O
a	O
non	O
thread-safe	O
queue	B-Data_Structure
will	O
give	O
you	O
wrong	O
results	O
,	O
and	O
weird	O
things	O
can	O
happen	O
(	O
like	O
removeFromQueue()	O
returning	O
the	O
same	O
thing	O
to	O
two	O
different	O
threads	O
,	O
or	O
addToQueue()	O
inserting	O
two	O
items	O
in	O
the	O
same	O
position	O
)	O
.	O

Aside	O
from	O
that	O
,	O
your	O
queue	B-Data_Structure
implementation	O
would	O
never	O
work	O
.	O

You	O
are	O
not	O
using	O
front	O
and	O
rear	O
correctly	O
.	O

Look	O
carefully	O
at	O
the	O
insert	O
function	O
:	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_3531	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

You	O
check	O
if	O
rear	O
is	O
MAX	O
,	O
yet	O
,	O
you	O
write	O
into	O
queue[front]	O
and	O
increment	O
front	O
.	O

What	O
if	O
I	O
just	O
keep	O
adding	O
items	O
to	O
the	O
queue	O
,	O
eventually	O
reaching	O
the	O
buffer	O
's	O
limit	O
?	O

rear	O
will	O
always	O
be	O
0	O
,	O
front	O
will	O
grow	O
indefinitely	O
,	O
and	O
your	O
function	O
will	O
write	O
beyond	O
the	O
limits	O
of	O
queue	B-Data_Structure
.	O

I	O
think	O
you	O
wanted	O
to	O
check	O
for	O
front	O
instead	O
:	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_3532	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

The	O
code	O
for	O
removeFromQueue()	O
looks	O
superficially	O
ok	O
,	O
as	O
long	O
as	O
queue	B-Data_Structure
is	O
a	O
global	O
array	B-Data_Structure
(	O
since	O
you	O
're	O
returning	O
a	O
pointer	O
,	O
and	O
ca	O
n't	O
return	O
pointers	O
to	O
local	O
variables	O
)	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
the	O
single	O
,	O
most	O
important	O
fact	O
you	O
have	O
to	O
take	O
out	O
of	O
this	O
answer	O
,	O
is	O
that	O
your	O
queue	B-Data_Structure
implementation	O
will	O
not	O
scale	O
in	O
the	O
long-term	O
.	O

An	O
array-based	O
queue	B-Data_Structure
is	O
a	O
terrible	O
choice	O
.	O

What	O
do	O
you	O
do	O
when	O
you	O
run	O
out	O
of	O
space	O
in	O
the	O
array	B-Data_Structure
?	O

What	O
if	O
I	O
insert	O
MAX	O
elements	O
,	O
then	O
remove	O
2	O
or	O
3	O
,	O
and	O
try	O
to	O
insert	O
more	O
?	O

Your	O
code	O
will	O
say	O
the	O
queue	B-Data_Structure
is	O
full	O
,	O
because	O
it	O
only	O
ever	O
allows	O
you	O
to	O
insert	O
MAX	O
elements	O
in	O
total	O
.	O

You	O
could	O
shift	O
every	O
element	O
in	O
the	O
queue	B-Data_Structure
to	O
the	O
left	O
when	O
an	O
element	O
is	O
removed	O
,	O
but	O
that	O
's	O
crazy	O
,	O
and	O
extremely	O
inefficient	O
.	O

Or	O
you	O
could	O
increment	O
front	O
modulo	O
MAX	O
,	O
allowing	O
rear	O
to	O
be	O
ahead	O
of	O
front	O
,	O
as	O
long	O
as	O
you	O
know	O
that	O
no	O
more	O
than	O
MAX	O
elements	O
can	O
be	O
inserted	O
.	O

That	O
would	O
be	O
better	O
,	O
but	O
it	O
would	O
break	O
the	O
logic	O
in	O
removeFromQueue()	O
,	O
since	O
the	O
pointers	O
returned	O
earlier	O
will	O
possibly	O
point	O
to	O
a	O
different	O
thread	O
struct	B-Data_Structure
as	O
you	O
manipulate	O
the	O
queue	B-Data_Structure
-	O
total	O
disaster	O
.	O

Definitely	O
not	O
what	O
you	O
want	O
.	O

A	O
much	O
,	O
much	O
better	O
approach	O
would	O
be	O
to	O
implement	O
this	O
with	O
a	O
linked	B-Data_Structure
list	I-Data_Structure
where	O
you	O
keep	O
a	O
pointer	O
to	O
the	O
head	O
and	O
a	O
pointer	O
to	O
the	O
tail	O
.	O

Have	O
a	O
look	O
at	O
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Queue_(abstract_data_type)#Queue_implementation	O

:	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/48520021/	O

are	O
several	O
tools	O
for	O

in	O
either	O
graphical	O
or	O
text	O
form	O
.	O

There	O
are	O
multiple	O
issues	O
with	O
your	O
code	O
:	O

The	O
function	O
names	O
are	O
weird	O

You	O
are	O
not	O
checking	O
against	O
errors	O
after	O
the	O
write	O
system	O
call	O
.	O

You	O
are	O
not	O
checking	O
against	O
errors	O
after	O
the	O
lseek	O
system	O
call	O
.	O

You	O
are	O
not	O
checking	O
against	O
errors	O
after	O
the	O
close	O
system	O
call	O
.	O

You	O
inconsistently	O
use	O

:	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
prefix	O
for	O
the	O
close	O
system	O
call	O

not	O
the	O
rest	O
.	O

are	O

to	O

was	O

.	O

.	O

.	O

have	O

C#	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
Q_267	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

What	O
's	O
the	O
rationale	O
supporting	O
that	O
convention	O
?	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
3823913	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/3823913/	O

The	O
Microsoft	O
Guidelines	O
for	O
member	O
naming	O
specifies	O
that	O
you	O
do	O
not	O
use	O
prefixes	O
for	O
fields	O
.	O

You	O
can	O
read	O
Microsoft	O
's	O
guidelines	O
for	O
names	O
here	O
.	O

This	O
just	O
applies	O
to	O
C#	O
,	O
of	O
course	O
.	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
3823913	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/3823913/	O

In	O
C#	O
I	O
usually	O
prefix	O
with	O
_	O
private	O
fields	O
but	O
never	O
local	O
variables	O
.	O

The	O
rationale	O
behind	O
this	O
is	O
that	O
when	O
I	O
need	O
a	O
private	O
variable	O
I	O
type	O
_	O
and	O
the	O
Intellisense	O
filters	O
the	O
list	O
and	O
it	O
is	O
easier	O
to	O
find	O
.	O

This	O
way	O
I	O
am	O
also	O
able	O
to	O
distinguish	O
between	O
private	O
from	O
local	O
variables	O
and	O
I	O
no	O
longer	O
need	O
to	O
type	O
this.variablename	O
for	O
class	O
fields	O
but	O
simply	O
_variablename	O
.	O

:	O
37895444	O

:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/37895444/	O

Your	O
code	O
first	O
created	O
a	O
constant	O
:	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_5450	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

then	O
you	O
check	O
whether	O
it	O
is	O
less	O
than	O
1	O
:	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_5451	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

Since	O
it	O
is	O
a	O
constant	O
,	O
it	O
will	O
never	O
change	O
.	O

This	O
means	O
that	O
the	O
if	O
clause	O
will	O
always	O
be	O
executed	O
.	O

Thus	O
,	O
the	O
else	B-Code_Block
clause	O
will	O
never	O
be	O
executed	O
.	O

So	O
first	O
you	O
need	O
to	O
make	O
this	O
constant	O
variable	O
:	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_5452	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

Then	O
just	O
change	O
this	O
:	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_5453	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

to	O
this	O
:	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_5454	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

This	O
way	O
,	O
numberOFChannelSubscribedToIs	O
can	O
be	O
some	O

To	O
me	O
,	O
it	O
looks	O
like	O
the	O
cycles	O
are	O
determined	O
by	O
combinations	O
of	O
four	O
"	O
steps	O
"	O
with	O
the	O
same	O
tag	O
in	O
col6	O
.	O

data	O
in	O
the	O
example	O
only	O
has	O
one	O
cycle	O
per	O
code	O
,	O
but	O
the	O
comments	O
suggest	O
there	O
might	O
be	O
more	O
than	O
one	O
.	O

How	O
can	O
we	O
identify	O
which	O
cycle	O
for	O
a	O
given	O
code	O

record	O
belongs	O
to	O
?	O

is	O
to	O

that	O
all	O

cycles	O
with	O
that	O
code	O
are	O
complete	O
and	O
just	O
enumerate	O
the	O
records	O
by	O
col6	O
,	O
col5	O
.	O

This	O
additional	O
cycle	O
sequence	O
number	O
is	O
then	O
used	O
for	O
aggregation	O
.	O

enumerating	O
the	O
sequences	O
,	O
I	O
further	O
assume	O
that	O
the	O
dates	O
are	O
increasing	O
over	O
time	O
.	O

Although	O
a	O
pivot	O
can	O
be	O
used	O
in	O
this	O
case	O
,	O
I	O
think	O
the	O
aggregation	O
method	O
might	O
be	O
a	O
bit	O
clearer	O
:	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
7985704	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/7985704/	O

Start	O
your	O
debugging	O
session	O
normally	O
.	O

Then	O
once	O
it	O
is	O
started	O
,	O
use	O
Visual	O
Studio	O
,	O
File/Open	O
menu	B-User_Interface_Element
to	O
open	O
the	O
correct	O
.cs	O
file	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
have	O
a	O
corresponding	O
.pdb	O
file	O
for	O
the	O
dll	O
in	O
which	O
the	O
file	O
is	O
included	O
you	O
will	O
be	O
able	O
to	O
set	O
breakpoints	O
which	O
will	O
be	O
hit	O
in	O
your	O
debugging	O
session	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
do	O
n't	O
have	O
the	O
pdb	O
file	O
,	O
this	O
means	O
your	O
dll	O
was	O
compiled	O
in	O
Release	O
configuration	O
rather	O
than	O
debug	O
configuration	O
.	O

During	O
this	O
session	O

When	O
you	O
have	O
an	O
assignment	O
operator	O
in	O
a	O
statement	O
,	O
the	O
LHS	O
of	O
the	O
operator	O
must	O
be	O
something	O
the	O
language	O
calls	O
an	O
lvalue	O
.	O

If	O
the	O
LHS	O
of	O
the	O
operator	O
does	O
not	O
evaluate	O
to	O
an	O
lvalue	O
,	O
the	O
value	O
from	O
the	O
RHS	O
cannot	O
be	O
assigned	O
to	O
the	O
LHS	O
.	O

You	O
cannot	O
use	O
:	O

I	O
'm	O
running	O
the	O
OpenTok	B-Library
demo	O
WebRTC	O
app	O
on	O
Chrome	O
-	O
and	O
it	O
works	O
great	O
.	O

But	O
if	O
I	O
load	O
the	O
page	O
in	O
IE	O
,	O
it	O
gives	O
me	O
an	O
error	O
message	O
(	O
about	O
page	O
compatibility	O
)	O
.	O

Pretty	O
obvious	O
solution	O
is	O
to	O
use	O
the	O
old	O
(	O
Flash-based	O
)	O
OpenTok	B-Library
library	O
on	O
IE	O
-	O
but	O
do	O
I	O
have	O
to	O
do	O
it	O
"	O
manually	O
"	O
?	O

Is	O
there	O
some	O
sort	O
of	O
an	O
"	O
automatic	O
switching	O
"	O
library	O
that	O
would	O
try	O
to	O
load	O
WebRTC	O
(	O
2.0	O
)	O
TB.min.js	B-File_Name
,	O
and	O
if	O
it	O
fails	O
fall	O
back	O
to	O
Flash	O
(	O
0.9	O
)	O
version	O
?	O

Also	O
a	O
related	O
question	O
-	O
will	O
all	O
these	O
versions	O
interoperate	O
?	O

I.e	O
.	O

can	O
Chromes	O
(	O
running	O
2.0/WebRTC	O
)	O
talk	O
to	O
IE	O
(	O
running	O
0.9/Flash	O
)	O
and	O
talk	O
to	O
iOS	O
(	O
running	O
native	O
)	O
?	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
17604481	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/17604481/	O

To	O
have	O
WebRTC	O
capabilities	O
on	O
IE	O
,	O
users	O
could	O
install	O
Chrome	O
Frame	O
(	O
for	O
IE6+	O
)	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
a	O
valid	O
option	O
,	O
but	O
you	O
should	O
know	O
that	O
it	O
is	O
no	O
longer	O
being	O
actively	O
supported	O
by	O
Google	O
.	O

As	O
far	O
as	O
I	O
know	O
,	O
there	O
is	O
no	O
automatic	O
switching	O
library	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
on	O
your	O
server	O
,	O
you	O
could	O
look	O
at	O
the	O
HTTP	O
requests	O
and	O
find	O
out	O
the	O
client	O
's	O
browser	O
.	O

From	O
there	O
,	O
you	O
could	O
dynamically	O
load	O
either	O
the	O
WebRTC	O
or	O
Flash	O
library	O
depending	O
on	O
the	O
browser	O
's	O
support	O
for	O
WebRTC	O
.	O

Currently	O
,	O
the	O
OpenTok	B-Library
WebRTC	O
library	O
supports	O
:	O

Chrome	O
23+	O

Firefox	O
22+	O

Unfortunately	O
,	O
OpenTok	B-Library
does	O
not	O
interoperate	O
between	O
Flash	O
and	O
WebRTC	O
clients	O
.	O

WebRTC	O
clients	O
can	O
operate	O
with	O
other	O
WebRTC	O
clients	O
(	O
mobile	O
,	O
web	O
,	O
etc	O
.	O
)	O
,	O
just	O
like	O
Flash	O
can	O
only	O
operate	O
with	O
other	O
Flash	O
clients	O
.	O

For	O
example	O
,	O
an	O
iOS	O
client	O
would	O
have	O
to	O
use	O
the	O
WebRTC	O
SDK	O
and	O
the	O
Chrome/Firefox	O
web	O
app	O
would	O
have	O
to	O
include	O
the	O
WebRTC	O
Javascript	O
library	O
.	O

DE1-SoC	O
boards	O

i	O
looked	O
at	O
the	O
isa	O
for	O

nios	O
II	O
cpu	O
there	O
is	O
no	O
atomic	O
test-and-set	O
instruction	O
in	O
the	O
ISA	O
.	O

how	O

lock	O

we	O

gonna	O
run	O
from	O
main()	O
and	O
code	O

will	O
run	O
in	O
the	O
Interrupt	O
Service	O

,	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
33886034	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/33886034/	O

It	O
appears	O
the	O
Nios	O
II	O
architecture	O
does	O
n't	O
have	O
atomic	O
test-and-set	O
instructions	O
.	O

Instead	O
for	O
synchronization	O
of	O
shared	O
resources	O
between	O
multiple	O
Nios	O
II	O
processors	O
,	O
the	O
architecture	O
uses	O
an	O
"	O
Hardware	O
Mutex	O
Core	O
"	O
.	O

It	O
works	O
as	O
a	O
shared	O
peripheral	O
that	O
provides	O
an	O
atomic	O
test-and-test	O
operation	O
.	O

You	O
can	O
read	O
more	O
about	O
it	O
in	O
Altera	O
's	O
Creating	O
Multiprocessor	O
Nios	O
II	O
Systems	O
Tutorial	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
you	O
probably	O
do	O
n't	O
an	O
atomic	O
test-and-set	O
operation	O
.	O

You	O
can	O
make	O
any	O
sequence	O
of	O
instructions	O
atomic	O
with	O
respect	O
to	O
interrupts	O
on	O
a	O
single	O
core	O
system	O
simply	O
by	O
disabling	O
interrupts	O
.	O

There	O
are	O
multiple	O
things	O
here	O
that	O
are	O
not	O
ok	O
.	O

First	O
of	O
all	O

you	O
do	O

initialize	O
the	O
Point	O
,	O
so	O
it	O
has	O
some	O
random	O
data	O
.	O

The	O
random	O
data	O
is	O
not	O
so	O
random	O
,	O
because	O
in	O
the	O
loop	O
the	O
memory	O
allocation	O
is	O
always	O
the	O
same	O
,	O
so	O
the	O
variable	O
will	O
have	O
the	O
data	O
of	O
the	O
last	O
loop	O
.	O

In	O
operator>>(...)	B-Code_Block
here	O
you	O
have	O
a	O
"	O
return	O
is	O
"	O
,	O
if	O
the	O
first	O
char	O
is	O
not	O
a	O
'	O
(	O
'	O

so	O
you	O
jump	O
out	O
of	O
there	O
without	O
setting	O
p.x	O
and	O
p.y	O
.	O

function	O

is	O
another	O
thing	O
that	O
is	O

ok	O
,	O
besides	O
the	O
fact	O
that	O
it	O
is	O
hard	O
to	O
read	O
and	O
a	O
really	O
bad	O
way	O
to	O
use	O
a	O
for	B-Code_Block
loop	O
,	O
there	O
wo	O
n't	O
be	O
a	O
'	O
C	O
'	O
when	O
you	O
enter	O
"	O
9	O
,	O
99	O
)	O
"	O
so	O
i	O
guess	O
here	O
you	O
get	O
the	O
"	O
No	O
input	O
"	O
output	O
.	O

now	O
to	O
the	O
for	B-Code_Block
loop	O
in	O
you	O

:	O

Here	O
is	O
what	O
happens	O
:	O

you	O

a	O

p	O
without	O
initializing	O
it	O

your	O

garbage	O

wo	O

be	O

If	O
the	O
font	O
is	O
monospace	O
and	O
the	O
position	O
of	O
the	O
number	O
in	O
the	O
image	B-User_Interface_Element
is	O
constant	O

it	O
should	O
be	O
trivial	O
to	O
break	O
down	O
the	O
image	B-User_Interface_Element
into	O
individual	O
digits	O
.	O

Then	O
,	O
output	O
each	O
image	B-User_Interface_Element
to	O
some	O
format	O
(	O
PNG	O
is	O
probably	O
best	O
)	O
and	O
compare	O
the	O
files	O
.	O

This	O
works	O
best	O
if	O
you	O
have	O
the	O
same	O
script	O
save	O
known	O
digits	O
and	O
then	O
compare	O
them	O
to	O
the	O
actual	O
case	O
data	O
.	O

If	O
this	O
is	O
not	O
possible	O
,	O
you	O
will	O
have	O
to	O
do	O
a	O
pixel-for-pixel	O
comparison	O
,	O
which	O
is	O

that	O
big	O
of	O
a	O
problem	O
on	O
such	O
small	O
images	B-User_Interface_Element
.	O

that	O

what	O
the	O
digits	O

,	O
so	O

number	O
is	O
this	O
?	O
"	O

I	O
have	O
a	O

with	O

date	I-User_Interface_Element
selector	I-User_Interface_Element
.	O

When	O
I	O
click	O
on	O
the	O
date	O
box	B-User_Interface_Element

popup	B-User_Interface_Element
calendar	I-User_Interface_Element
appears	O
.	O

Then	O
I	O
can	O
either	O

a	O
date	O
.	O

date	O
appears	O
in	O
the	O
date	O
box	B-User_Interface_Element
and	O
the	O
calendar	B-User_Interface_Element
appears	O

outside	O
the	O
calendar	B-User_Interface_Element
.	O

calendar	B-User_Interface_Element
disappears	O
.	O

This	O
is	O
via	O
a	O
mouseup	O
event	O
that	O
checks	O
what	O
was	O
clicked	O
.	O

Type	O
a	O
date	O
in	O
the	O

box	B-User_Interface_Element
.	O

I	O
want	O
:	O

I	O
type	O
a	O
date	O
in	O
the	O
date	O
box	B-User_Interface_Element
and	O
tab	B-User_Interface_Element
away	O
,	O
then	O
I	O
want	O
the	O
calendar	B-User_Interface_Element
to	O

.	O

tried	O
this	O

to	O

date	O
box	B-User_Interface_Element
.	O

This	O
event	O
made	O
the	O
calendar	B-User_Interface_Element
go	O
away	O
.	O

However	O

this	O
means	O
that	O

.	O

to	O

whether	O

focus	O
.	O

Using	O
jquery	B-Library
I	O
did	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
Q_1304	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

This	O
did	O
nothing	O
useful	O
.	O

I	O

use	O
an	O

event	O

what	O
was	O

the	O

what	O

are	O

,	O

no	O

.	O

event	O

stops	O
there	O

:	O

stops	O
there	O
.	O

method	O
has	O
an	O
overload	O
which	O
takes	O
an	O

as	O
the	O
first	O
parameter	O
.	O

we	O
create	O
an	O
invisible	O
owner	O

which	O
we	O
then	O
close	O
after	O
a	O
specified	O
time	O
,	O
it	O
's	O
child	O
message	B-User_Interface_Element
box	I-User_Interface_Element
would	O
close	O
as	O
well	O
.	O

is	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
46614845	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/46614845/	O

In	O
this	O
example	O
,	O
cache	O
is	O
actually	O
useless	O
.	O

You	O
only	O
write	O
to	O
it	O
and	O
never	O
read	O
from	O
it	O
.	O

hash	O
is	O
being	O
used	O
as	O
the	O
actual	O
cache	O
here	O
.	O

If	O
an	O
image	B-User_Interface_Element
with	O
the	O
same	O
URL	O
already	O
exists	O
,	O
it	O
will	O
be	O
returned	O
from	O
the	O
hash	O
object	O
,	O
and	O
not	O
created	O
again	O
.	O

7234291	O

The	O
.Single()	O
is	O
what	O
's	O
throwing	O
the	O
exception	O
.	O

Either	O
your	O
query	O
is	O
returning	O
no	O
items	O
or	O
it	O
's	O
returning	O
>	O
1	O
item	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
're	O
not	O
sure	O
of	O
the	O
number	O
of	O
items	O
you	O
're	O
expecting	O
,	O
you	O
should	O
be	O
using	O
FirstOrDefault()	O
which	O
will	O
return	O
the	O
first	O
match	O
or	O
null	O
if	O
no	O
matches	O
are	O
found	O
.	O

The	O
non-LINQ	B-Library
equivalent	O
is	O
something	O
like	O
this	O

1)	O

can	O
then	O

this	O
with	O
the	O
type	O
to	O

.	O

:	I-Code_Block

inclined	O
to	O
go	O
with	O
the	O
former	O
as	O
it	O
looks	O
and	O
feels	O
cleaner	O
but	O
some	O
of	O
the	O
senior	O
devs	O
here	O
are	O
turning	O
their	O
nose	O
up	O
at	O
the	O
use	O
of	O
reflection	O
.	O

Is	O
there	O
a	O
case	O
to	O
be	O
made	O
for	O
the	O
first	O
option	O
or	O
is	O
it	O
just	O
better	O
to	O
go	O
with	O
option	O
2	O
?	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
37790195	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/37790195/	O

This	O
is	O
a	O
clear	O
case	O
of	O
metadata	O
vs	O
.	O
data	O
:	O

Option	O
1	O
:	O
Attributes	O
are	O
supposed	O
to	O
hold	O
metadata	O
about	O
the	O
entities	O
they	O
are	O
attached	O
to	O
.	O

Option	O
2	O
:	O
member	O
fields	O
and	O
properties	O
,	O
regardless	O
if	O
instance	O
or	O
static	O
,	O
are	O
supposed	O
to	O
hold	O
data	O
that	O
make	O
up	O
the	O
integral	O
value	O
of	O
the	O
class	O
.	O

Hence	O
,	O
option	O
1	O
,	O
attributes	O
,	O
is	O
the	O
right	O
approach	O
to	O
represent	O
metadata	O
.	O

Usage	O
of	O
reflection	O
is	O
a	O
mere	O
technicality	O
and	O
can	O
be	O
encapsulated	O
into	O
a	O
separate	O
class	O
,	O
e.g	O
.	O

an	O
AttributeManager	O
,	O
that	O
would	O
ease	O
access	O
to	O
metadata	O
and	O
cache	O
them	O
appropriately	O
to	O
avoid	O
performance	O
overhead	O
(	O
should	O
that	O
be	O
an	O
issue	O
in	O
a	O
particular	O
case	O
)	O
.	O

Any	O
of	O
the	O
libraries	O
that	O
need	O
sudo	O
permissions	O
cannot	O
be	O
installed	O
on	O
Spark	B-Library
service	O
associated	O
with	O
notebook	O
on	O
DSX	O
by	O
user	O
.	O

You	O
can	O
only	O
install	O
libraries	O
with	O
--user	B-Code_Block
flag	O
in	O
pip	B-Code_Block
.	O

Only	O
IBM	B-Library
Spark	I-Library
service	O
team	O
can	O
install	O
this	O
libraries	O
which	O
need	O
sudo	B-Code_Block
permissions	O
.	O

Please	O
raise	O
a	O
request/idea	O
here	O
to	O
get	O
this	O
library	O
installed	O
:	O
-	O

https://ibmwatsondataplatform.ideas.aha.io/?category=6441922592725708622	O

Thanks	O
,	O

Charles	O

Your	O
code	O
is	O
all	O
good	O
.	O

Just	O
one	O
mistake	O
,	O
you	O
are	O
using	O
%d	B-Code_Block
to	O
concatenate	O
the	O
decimals	O
after	O
your	O
id	O
.	O

But	O
that	O
is	O
not	O
necessary	O
since	O
%d	B-Code_Block
is	O
automatically	O
added	O
to	O
the	O
supplied	O
id	O
.	O

Please	O
find	O
codex	O
link	O
at	O
the	O
end	O
of	O
this	O
answer	O
.	O

So	O
,	O
I	O
removed	O
the	O
%d	B-Code_Block
from	O
the	O
id	O
section	O
of	O
your	O
code	O
and	O
now	O
it	O
works	O
.	O

Solution	O
:	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_5723	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

and	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_5724	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

You	O
do	O
not	O
need	O
to	O
add	O
%d	B-Code_Block
to	O
id	O
of	O
register_sidebars	O
.	O

Please	O
read	O
the	O
codex	O
,	O

it	O
says	O
:	O

"	O
%d	B-Code_Block
"	O
is	O
added	O
automatically	O
to	O
supplied	O
'	O
id	O
'	O
value	O
after	O
the	O
first	O
;	O
e.g	O
.	O
,	O

will	O
hold	O

in	O
this	O
code	O
:	O

Random	B-Code_Block
rand	I-Code_Block
=	I-Code_Block
new	I-Code_Block
Random()	I-Code_Block
;	I-Code_Block

int	B-Code_Block
x	I-Code_Block
=	I-Code_Block
1	I-Code_Block
-	I-Code_Block
rand.Next()%15	I-Code_Block
;	I-Code_Block

I	O
have	O
entered	O
this	O
and	O
receive	O
a	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
28776895	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/28776895/	O

rand.Next()	B-Code_Block
%	I-Code_Block
15	I-Code_Block
will	O
give	O
you	O
a	O
number	O
between	O
0	O
and	O
14	O
.	O

(	O
If	O
we	O
assume	O
that	O
it	O
generates	O
only	O
positive	O
integers	O
,	O
otherwise	O
you	O
can	O
use	O
do	O
it	O
with	O
a	O
negative	O
number	O
too	O
take	O
a	O
look	O
here	O
how	O
:	O

There	O
's	O
a	O
database	O
table	B-Data_Structure
with	O
tens	O
of	O
thousands	O
of	O
entries	O
.	O

Several	O
users	O
of	O
my	O
program	O
need	O
to	O
be	O
able	O
to	O

View	O
the	O
(	O
entire	O
)	O
table	B-Data_Structure
in	O
a	O
GridRow	O
,	O
which	O
implied	O
that	O
the	O
entire	O
Table	B-Data_Structure
has	O
to	O
be	O
downloaded	O
.	O

Modify	O
values	O
of	O
any	O
random	O
row	B-Data_Structure
,	O
changes	O
are	O
frequent	O
but	O
need	O
not	O
be	O
persisted	O
immediately	O
.	O

It	O
's	O
expected	O
that	O
different	O
users	O
will	O
modify	O
different	O
rows	B-Data_Structure
,	O
but	O
this	O
is	O
not	O
always	O
true	O
.	O

Some	O
loss	O
of	O
changes	O
is	O
permitted	O
,	O
as	O
users	O
will	O
most	O
likely	O
update	O
same	O
rows	B-Data_Structure
to	O
same	O
values	O
.	O

On	O
occasion	O
add	O
new	O
rows	B-Data_Structure
.	O

Sounds	O
simple	O
enough	O
.	O

My	O
initial	O
approach	O
was	O
to	O
use	O
a	O
long-running	O
DbContext	O
instance	O
.	O

This	O
one	O
DbContext	O
was	O
supposed	O
to	O
track	O
changes	O
to	O
the	O
entities	O
,	O
so	O
that	O
when	O

is	O
called	O
,	O
most	O
of	O
the	O
legwork	O
is	O
done	O
automatically	O
.	O

However	O
many	O
have	O
pointed	O
out	O
that	O
this	O
is	O
not	O
an	O
optimal	O
solution	O
in	O
the	O
long	O
run	O
,	O
notably	O
here	O
.	O

I	O
'm	O
still	O
not	O
sure	O
if	O
I	O
understand	O
the	O
reasons	O
,	O
and	O
I	O
do	O

see	O
what	O
a	O
unit-of-work	O
is	O
in	O
my	O
scenario	O
either	O
.	O

The	O
user	O
chooses	O
herself	O
when	O
to	O
persist	O
changes	O
,	O
and	O
let	O
's	O
say	O
that	O
client	O
always	O
wins	O
for	O
simplicity	O
.	O

It	O
's	O
also	O
important	O
to	O
note	O
that	O
objects	O
that	O
have	O
not	O
been	O
touched	O
do	O

overwrite	O
any	O
data	O
in	O
the	O
database	O
.	O

Another	O

would	O
be	O
to	O

changes	O

use	O
objects	O

,	O

welcome	O

.	O

What	O
's	O

to	O

this	O
problem	O
?	O

understand	O

bit	O

.	O

.	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
6008932	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/6008932/	O

Problem	O
with	O
long	O
running	O
context	O
is	O
that	O
it	O
does	O
n't	O
refresh	O
data	O
-	O
I	O
more	O
discussed	O
problems	O
here	O
.	O

So	O
if	O
your	O
user	O
opens	O
the	O
list	O
and	O
modify	O
data	O
half	O
an	O
hour	O
she	O
does	O
n't	O
know	O
about	O
changes	O
.	O

But	O
in	O
case	O
of	O
WPF	B-Library
if	O
your	O
business	O
action	O
is	O
:	O

Open	O
the	O
list	B-Data_Structure

Do	O
as	O
many	O
actions	O
as	O
you	O
want	O

Trigger	O
saving	O
changes	O

Then	O
this	O
whole	O
is	O
unit	O
of	O
work	O
and	O
you	O
can	O
use	O
single	O
context	O
instance	O
for	O
that	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
have	O
scenario	O
where	O
last	O
edit	O
wins	O
you	O
should	O
not	O
have	O
problems	O
with	O
this	O
until	O
somebody	O
else	O
deletes	O
record	O
which	O
current	O
user	O
edits	O
.	O

Additionally	O
after	O
saving	O
or	O
cancelling	O
changes	O
you	O
should	O
dispose	O
current	O
context	O
and	O
load	O
data	O
again	O
-	O
this	O
will	O
ensure	O
that	O
you	O
really	O
have	O
fresh	O
data	O
for	O
next	O
unit	O
of	O
work	O
.	O

Context	O
offers	O
some	O
features	O
to	O
refresh	O
data	O
but	O
it	O
only	O
refreshes	O
data	O
previously	O
loaded	O
(	O
without	O
relations	O
)	O
so	O
for	O
example	O
new	O
unsaved	O
records	O
will	O
be	O
still	O
included	O
.	O

Perhaps	O
you	O
can	O
also	O
read	O
about	O
MS	B-Library
Sync	I-Library
framework	O
and	O
local	O
data	O
cache	O
.	O

am	O
performing	O
a	O
custom	O
traversal	O
in	O
Neo4J	O
,	O
using	O
my	O
own	O
evaluator	O
.	O

In	O
the	O
traversal	O
are	O
two	O
nodes	O
,	O
connected	O
by	O
two	O
different	O
relationships	O
.	O

What	O
I	O
'm	O
seeing	O
is	O
that	O
only	O
one	O
of	O
the	O
two	O
relationships	O
will	O
be	O
walked	O
during	O
the	O
traversal	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
my	O
custom	O
evaluation	O
changes	O
its	O
behavior	O
based	O
on	O
whether	O
both	O
relationships	O
are	O
present	O
.	O

It	O
seems	O
like	O
during	O
a	O
traversal	O
,	O
Neo4J	O
maintains	O
a	O
set	O
of	O
visited	O
nodes	O
,	O
and	O
if	O
a	O
candidate	O
path	O
ends	O
at	O
a	O
node	O
that	O
has	O
already	O
been	O
visited	O
,	O
then	O
that	O
path	O
is	O
never	O
sent	O
to	O
my	O
evaluator	O
.	O

way	O
around	O
this	O
?	O

can	O
I	O
have	O
a	O
custom	O
evaluator	O
examine	O
every	O
possible	O
path	O
to	O
the	O
nodes	O
?	O

Here	O
's	O
a	O
quick	O
example	O
:	O

Say	O
that	O
the	O
graph	O
looks	O
like	O
this	O
:	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
Q_3164	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

The	O
traversal	O
begins	O
at	O
A	O
.	O

A	O
has	O
two	O
different	O
relationships	O
tying	O
it	O
to	O
B	O
(	O
of	O
two	O
different	O
types	O
)	O
.	O

All	O
of	O
the	O
remaining	O
nodes	O
are	O
connected	O
by	O
only	O
1	O
relationship	O
.	O

The	O
goal	O
of	O
the	O
evaluator	O
is	O
to	O
return	O
A-D	O
,	O
A-B	O
,	O
and	O

,	O
but	O
not	O

.	O

there	O

.	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
27450607	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/27450607/	O

You	O
may	O
need	O
to	O
think	O
your	O
use	O
case	O
through	O
a	O
bit	O
more	O
carefully	O
.	O

One	O
suggestion	O
is	O
that	O
when	O
you	O
use	O
the	O
traversal	B-Library
framework	I-Library
in	O
java	O
,	O
basically	O
you	O
can	O
build	O
a	O
TraversalDescription	O
and	O
then	O
iterate	O
through	O
what	O
comes	O
back	O
from	O
it	O
by	O
relationships	O
,	O
rather	O
than	O
by	O
Paths	O
or	O
by	O
Nodes	O
.	O

If	O
your	O
primary	O
complaint	O
is	O
that	O
each	O
node	O
is	O
visited	O
only	O
once	O
,	O
you	O
can	O
change	O
the	O

to	O
specify	O

that	O
all	O
relationships	O
will	O
be	O
followed	O
,	O
whether	O
or	O
not	O
that	O
causes	O
you	O
to	O
hit	O
a	O
node	O
more	O
than	O
once	O
.	O

More	O
broadly	O
,	O
traversers	O
do	O
n't	O
tend	O
to	O
go	O
over	O
the	O
same	O
material	O
more	O
than	O
once	O
because	O
if	O
they	O
did	O
,	O
you	O
'd	O
need	O
to	O
be	O
ultra	O
careful	O
about	O
specifying	O
a	O
termination	O
condition	O
.	O

?	O

up	O

,	O

n	B-Code_Block
+	I-Code_Block
"	I-Code_Block
sum	I-Code_Block
of	I-Code_Block

2	I-Code_Block

O(n^2)	O
because	O
you	O
've	O
got	O
a	O
multiplication	O
,	O
not	O
a	O
sum	O
.	O

by	O

,	O
an	O
array	B-Data_Structure
sorted	O

:	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_2513	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

This	O
gives	O
insertion	O
sort	O
a	O
quadratic	O
running	O
time	O
(	O
i.e	O
.	O
,	O
O(n2))	O
.	O

More	O
info	O

The	O
best	O
way	O
to	O
understand	O
the	O
complexity	O
is	O
trying	O
to	O
find	O
the	O
worst	O
case	O
example	O
and	O
following	O
the	O
algorithm	O
's	O
steps	O
.	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
18972385	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/18972385/	O

You	O
prove	O
big	O
O	O
complexity	O
by	O
considering	O
how	O
many	O
operations	O
are	O
performed	O
in	O
the	O
worst	O
case	O
.	O

You	O
've	O
done	O
the	O
counting	O
part	O
and	O
entered	O
the	O
results	O
in	O
the	O
right	O
hand	O
column	B-User_Interface_Element
of	O
your	O
image	B-User_Interface_Element
,	O
so	O
what	O
remains	O
to	O
be	O
proven	O
is	O
that	O
the	O
dominant	O
term	O
is	O
O(n^2)	B-Code_Block
.	O

Apart	O
from	O
the	O
terms	O
that	O
involve	O
the	O
sum	O
,	O
your	O
program	O
consists	O
of	O
instructions	O
that	O
get	O
executed	O
n-1	B-Code_Block
times	O
so	O
these	O
are	O
all	O
O(n)	B-Code_Block
terms	O
.	O

Now	O
for	O
the	O
terms	O
with	O
the	O
sum	O
.	O

In	O
the	O
worst	O
case	O
a	O
t_j	O
can	O
be	O
j	O
because	O
you	O
may	O
end	O
up	O
decrementing	O
i	O
which	O
you	O
set	O
to	O
j	O
all	O
the	O
way	O
down	O
to	O
0	O
.	O

So	O
in	O
this	O
worst	O
case	O
we	O
have	O
t_j	B-Code_Block
=	I-Code_Block
j	I-Code_Block
and	O
then	O
you	O
have	O
a	O
term	O
with	O
a	O
sum	B-Code_Block
from	I-Code_Block
2	I-Code_Block
to	I-Code_Block
n	I-Code_Block
of	I-Code_Block
j	I-Code_Block
which	O
is	O
O(n^2)	B-Code_Block
.	O

This	O
is	O
due	O
to	O
following	O
the	O
mathematical	O
identity	O
:	O

This	O
can	O
be	O
proven	O
by	O
summing	O
two	O
of	O
these	O
series	O
together	O
,	O
paying	O
attention	O
so	O
that	O
you	O
add	O
two	O
terms	O
that	O
sum	O
to	O
n+1	B-Code_Block
together	O
,	O
and	O
then	O
dividing	O
the	O
sum	O
by	O
two	O
.	O

Have	O
a	O
look	O
at	O
the	O
proof	O
in	O
wolfram	O
.	O

Finally	O
,	O
since	O
O	B-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
(	B-Code_Block
n^2	I-Code_Block
+	I-Code_Block
n	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block
/2	B-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block
=	I-Code_Block
O(n^2)	I-Code_Block
you	O
get	O
that	O
the	O
terms	O
that	O
include	O
the	O
sum	O
dominate	O
the	O
runtime	O
and	O
that	O
is	O
why	O
the	O
algorithm	O
is	O
O(n^2)	B-Code_Block

(	O

a	O

bytes	O

probably	O

.	O

an	O

folder	O
which	O
needs	O
to	O
be	O
checked	O
for	O
local	O
changes	O
during	O

.	O

does	O
not	O

that	O

files	O
would	O

faster	O
,	O

..	O
.	O

smaller	O
project	O

there	O

a	O

system	O
.	O

/	O

know	O

between	O
Javascript	O
and	O

is	O
good	O
and	O

n't	O

this	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
6947286	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/6947286/	O

Javascript	O
itself	O
does	O
n't	O
do	O
queries	O
....	O
it	O
needs	O
a	O
helper	O
like	O
PHP	O
,	O
.net	B-Library
,	O
or	O
Java	O
.	O

It	O
can	O
traverse	O
XML	O
or	O
JSON	O
just	O
fine	O
like	O
you	O
say	O
,	O
but	O
sending	O
colossal	O
XML	O
documents	O
with	O
all	O
possible	O
data	O
when	O
only	O
small	O
amounts	O
of	O
the	O
data	O
is	O
actually	O
required	O
will	O
lead	O
to	O
massive	O
overhead	O
that	O
will	O
bring	O
your	O
app	O
to	O
its	O
knees	O
.	O

It	O
's	O
the	O
definition	O
of	O
lack-of-scalability	O
.	O

My	O
personal	O
preference	O
is	O
JQuery	B-Library
Ajax	O
talking	O
to	O
a	O
PHP	O
backend	O
(	O
transactions	O
via	O
JSON	O
)	O
.	O

If	O
I	O
'm	O
dealing	O
with	O
the	O
presentation	O
of	O
large	O
datasets	O
I	O
'll	O
always	O
page	O
the	O
information	O
server-side	O
and	O
pipeline	O
it	O
(	O
load	O
data	O
ahead	O
of	O
and	O
behind	O
the	O
current	O
view	O
to	O
reduce	O
transactions	O
)	O
,	O
and	O
usually	O
present	O
in	O
via	O
jQuery	B-Library
DataTables	O
.	O

Grids	O
are	O
always	O
your	O
friend	O
with	O
large	O
amounts	O
of	O
data	O
.	O

Again	O
,	O
personal	O
preference	O
,	O
but	O
I	O
make	O
heavy	O
use	O
of	O
jQuery	B-Library
UI	O
for	O
layout	O
and	O
presentation	O
,	O
and	O
I	O
do	O
write	O
custom	O
Javascript	O
for	O
the	O
"	O
nifty	O
"	O
one-off	O
type	O
things	O
that	O
come	O
up	O
.	O

Again	O
,	O
any	O
server	O
language	O
you	O
have	O
access	O
to	O
and	O
are	O
comfortable	O
with	O
will	O
suffice	O
,	O
as	O
Javascript	O
is	O
language	O
agnostic	O
.	O

Javascript	O
can	O
get	O
out	O
of	O
hand	O
in	O
a	O
hurry	O
.	O

I	O
'd	O
recommend	O
that	O
unless	O
you	O
have	O
a	O
ton	O
of	O
time	O
on	O
your	O
hands	O
that	O
you	O
focus	O
on	O
clean	O
presentation	O
via	O
something	O
baseline	O
like	O
HTML	O
with	O
judicious	O
use	O
of	O
Javascript	O
and	O
CSS	O
for	O
progressive	O
enhancement	O
.	O

Think	O
about	O
the	O
user	O
before	O
you	O
go	O
crazy	O
with	O
motion	O
,	O
dynamic	O
elements	O
,	O
etc	O
.	O

Do	O
n't	O
forget	O
the	O
old	O
adage	O
,	O
"	O
80%	O
of	O
the	O
people	O
only	O
use	O
20%	O
of	O
the	O
functionality	O
"	O
Nail	O
that	O
20%	O
cleanly	O
before	O
going	O
to	O
town	O
on	O
flashy	O
javascript	O
fluff	O
.	O

Your	O
users	O
will	O
thank	O
you	O
!	O

:	O

:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/6947286/	O

JSON	O
is	O
by	O
far	O
the	O
fastest	O
to	O
parse	O
,	O
since	O
it	O
IS	O
JavaScript	O
.	O

Application	O
frameworks	O
like	O
EXT.JS	B-Library
are	O
already	O
doing	O
this	O
with	O
great	O
success	O
.	O

Question_ID	O
:	O
16994398	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/16994398/	O

The	O
following	O
describes	O
what	O
seems	O
to	O
be	O
a	O
bug	O
in	O
Ruby	O
1.8	O
(	O
and	O
REE	O
)	O
but	O
has	O
been	O
fixed	O
in	O
1.9	O
.	O

I	O
'd	O
like	O
to	O
know	O
:	O

Why	O
calling	O
==	O
on	O
String	O
or	O
Fixnum	O
triggers	O
calling	O
==	O
on	O
other	O
object	O
at	O
all	O
?	O

Why	O
calling	O
==	O
on	O
String	O
works	O
differently	O
depending	O
on	O
the	O
other	O
object	O
class	O
?	O

Now	O
the	O
code	O
:	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
Q_1724	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

Example	O
1	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
Q_1725	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

Nothing	O
interesting	O
here	O
,	O
move	O
along	O
.	O

Example	O
2	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
Q_1726	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

Example	O
3	O

:	I-Code_Block

(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

Calling	O
==	O
on	O
Fixnum	O
triggers	O
==	O
on	O
other	O
object	O
.	O

Example	O
4	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
Q_1728	I-Code_Block
