Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
16994398	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/16994398/	O

Ruby	O
is	O
an	O
object-oriented	O
language	O
.	O

In	O
an	O
object-oriented	O
language	O
,	O
you	O
send	O
messages	O
to	O
objects	O
and	O
those	O
objects	O
then	O
respond	O
to	O
those	O
messages	O
however	O
they	O
see	O
fit	O
.	O

This	O
means	O
that	O
the	O
receiver	O
of	O
the	O
message	O
,	O
and	O
only	O
the	O
receiver(!)	O

is	O
in	O
total	O
control	O
of	O
what	O
a	O
message	O
means	O
.	O

With	O
some	O
operators	O
,	O
however	O
,	O
there	O
are	O
certain	O
expectations	O
of	O
symmetry	O
:	O
for	O
example	O
,	O
a	B-Code_Block
==	I-Code_Block
b	I-Code_Block
is	O
expected	O
to	O
be	O
the	O
same	O
as	O
b	B-Code_Block
==	I-Code_Block
a	I-Code_Block
.	O

But	O
in	O
an	O
OO	O
language	O
that	O
is	O
impossible	O
!	O

Either	O
a	O
or	O
b	O
must	O
be	O
the	O
receiver	O
of	O
the	O
message	O
,	O
so	O
in	O
one	O
case	O
a	O
gets	O
to	O
decide	O
whether	O
a	O
and	O
b	O
are	O
equal	O
and	O
in	O
the	O
other	O
case	O
b	O
gets	O
to	O
decide	O
.	O

They	O
might	O
decide	O
differently	O
,	O
and	O
then	O
the	O
expectation	O
of	O
symmetry	O
would	O
be	O
broken	O
.	O

So	O
,	O
in	O
some	O
classes	O
equality	O
is	O
actually	O
implemented	O
something	O
like	O
this	O
:	O

Here	O
's	O
an	O
example	O
:	O
if	O
you	O
write	O
your	O
own	O
Numeric	O
class	O
(	O
say	O
,	O
a	O
Quaternion	O
class	O
)	O
,	O
then	O
the	O
system	O
builtin	O
Fixnum	O
class	O
does	O
n't	O
know	O
anything	O
about	O
Quaternions	O
.	O
So	O
,	O
when	O
you	O
ask	O
the	O
Fixnum	O
0	O
whether	O
it	O
is	O
equal	O
to	O
the	O
Quaternion	O
(	O
0	O
,	O
0	O
,	O
0	O
,	O
0	O
)	O
,	O
it	O
will	O
responds	O
false	O
,	O
even	O
though	O
that	O
's	O
wrong	O
.	O

So	O
,	O
instead	O
the	O
Fixnum	O
will	O
first	O
check	O
:	O
do	O
I	O
know	O
how	O
to	O
compare	O
myself	O
to	O
a	O
Quaternion	O
?	O

No	O
,	O
I	O
do	O
n't	O
,	O
but	O
maybe	O
a	O
Quaternion	O
knows	O
how	O
to	O
compare	O
itself	O
to	O
a	O
Fixnum	O
!	O

After	O
all	O
,	O
the	O
Quaternion	O
class	O
did	O
n't	O
exist	O
when	O
the	O
Fixnum	O
class	O
was	O
written	O
,	O
so	O
the	O
Fixnum	O
class	O
cannot	O
know	O
about	O
Quaternions	O
.	O
But	O
when	O
the	O
Quaternion	O
class	O
was	O
written	O
,	O
maybe	O
the	O
author	O
was	O
so	O
thoughtful	O
to	O
make	O
it	O
possible	O
to	O
compare	O
Quaternions	O
with	O
Fixnums	O
.	O

That	O
's	O
why	O
Fixnum#	O
==	O
reverses	O
the	O
arguments	O
and	O
tries	O
again	O
.	O

With	O
String	O
,	O
it	O
's	O
the	O
same	O
but	O
somewhat	O
more	O
complicated	O
.	O

In	O
Ruby	O
,	O
classes	O
are	O
n't	O
types	O
and	O
subtyping	O
and	O
subclassing	O
are	O
different	O
.	O

Ruby	O
itself	O
does	O
n't	O
have	O
a	O
concept	O
of	O
type	O
at	O
all	O
!	O

The	O
type	O
of	O
an	O
object	O
is	O
its	O
protocol	O
,	O
i.e	O
.	O
the	O
messages	O
it	O
understands	O
and	O
how	O
it	O
responds	O
to	O
them	O
.	O

But	O
that	O
concept	O
is	O
not	O
recorded	O
in	O
Ruby	O
(	O
unlike	O
Objective-C	O
,	O
for	O
example	O
,	O
which	O
does	O
have	O
an	O
explicit	O
notion	O
of	O
protocol	O
)	O
.	O

There	O
,	O
however	O
,	O
some	O
cases	O
,	O
where	O
you	O
want	O
to	O
break	O
OO	O
encapsulation	O
,	O
and	O
know	O
the	O
specific	O
type	O
and	O
even	O
more	O
:	O
the	O
specific	O
representation	O
of	O
the	O
type	O
.	O

(	O
Note	O
:	O
this	O
violates	O
OO	O
,	O
but	O
it	O
is	O
sometimes	O
necessary	O
for	O
performance	O
.	O
)	O

In	O
cases	O
,	O
where	O
Ruby	O
needs	O
an	O
object	O
to	O
be	O
of	O
a	O
specific	O
class	O
instead	O
of	O
just	O
responding	O
to	O
a	O
specific	O
protocol	O
,	O
you	O
would	O
lose	O
a	O
lot	O
of	O
flexibility	O
.	O

You	O
have	O
to	O
use	O
,	O
say	O
,	O
a	O
String	O
,	O
even	O
though	O
you	O
would	O
much	O
rather	O
use	O
a	O
Rope	O
instead	O
.	O

In	O
order	O
to	O
give	O
you	O
back	O
some	O
flexibility	O
,	O
Ruby	O
allows	O
you	O
to	O
pass	O
in	O
something	O
which	O
is	O
not	O
exactly	O
a	O
String	O
but	O
which	O
is	O
equivalent	O
to	O
one	O
and	O
can	O
be	O
converted	O
to	O
one	O
with	O
a	O
to_str	O
method	O
.	O

So	O
,	O
unlike	O
other	O
languages	O
,	O
where	O
A	O
IS-A	O
String	O
is	O
represented	O
by	O
A	O
being	O
a	O
subclass	O
of	O
String	O
,	O
in	O
Ruby	O
,	O
the	O
relationship	O
A	O
IS-A	O
String	O
is	O
represented	O
by	O
A	O
having	O
a	O
to_str	O
method	O
.	O

That	O
's	O
what	O
you	O
are	O
seeing	O
above	O
.	O

If	O
the	O
argument	O
to	O
String#	O
==	O
is	O
n't	O
a	O
String	O
,	O
then	O
String#	O
==	O
does	O
n't	O
know	O
what	O
to	O
do	O
with	O
it	O
.	O

But	O
if	O
it	O
is	O
"	O
string-like	O
"	O
,	O
i.e	O
.	O
it	O
implements	O
to_str	O
,	O
then	O
maybe	O
it	O
does	O
know	O
how	O
to	O
compare	O
itself	O
to	O
a	O
String	O
?	O

Note	O
that	O
equality	O
is	O
very	O
hard	O
to	O
get	O
right	O
.	O

People	O
cannot	O
even	O
agree	O
on	O
what	O
it	O
means	O
in	O
a	O
purely	O
functional	O
language	O
,	O
and	O
that	O
's	O
the	O
easy	O
case	O
!	O

In	O
Ruby	O
,	O
there	O
are	O
two	O
additional	O
complications	O
:	O
mutable	O
state	O
and	O
OO	O
.	O

Mutable	O
state	O
means	O
that	O
two	O
objects	O
that	O
were	O
equal	O
a	O
moment	O
ago	O
may	O
not	O
be	O
equal	O
anymore	O
a	O
couple	O
of	O
moments	O
later	O
.	O

Or	O
should	O
they	O
be	O
?	O

Or	O
should	O
n't	O
they	O
be	O
?	O

And	O
OO	O
means	O
that	O
equality	O
cannot	O
be	O
symmetric	O
.	O

That	O
's	O
also	O
why	O
you	O
may	O
see	O
weird	O
behavior	O
now	O
and	O
again	O
.	O

Sometimes	O
it	O
may	O
just	O
be	O
an	O
artifact	O
of	O
trying	O
to	O
get	O
equality	O
right	O
,	O
and	O
sometimes	O
it	O
might	O
just	O
simply	O
be	O
a	O
bug	O
.	O

By	O
the	O
way	O
:	O
for	O
the	O
arithmetic	O
operators	O
,	O
subclasses	O
of	O
Numeric	O
actually	O
have	O
a	O
more	O
formal	O
double-dispatch	O
protocol	O
using	O
the	O
coerce	O
method	O
.	O

If	O
a	O
Numeric	O
object	O
does	O
n't	O
know	O
what	O
to	O
do	O
with	O
another	O
Numeric	O
,	O
it	O
will	O
ask	O
that	O
other	O
object	O
to	O
coerce	O
the	O
two	O
objects	O
to	O
a	O
type	O
that	O
does	O
know	O
that	O
.	O

For	O
example	O
,	O
if	O
you	O
try	O
to	O
add	O
a	O
Quaternion	O
to	O
a	O
Fixnum	O
,	O
the	O
Fixnum	O
wo	O
n't	O
know	O
what	O
to	O
do	O
:	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_2222	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

The	O
+	O
method	O
of	O
Fixnum	O
will	O
then	O
call	O
:	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_2223	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

IOW	O
:	O
it	O
will	O
call	O
Quaternion	O
#coerce	O
with	O
the	O
equivalent	O
of	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_2224	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

to	O
which	O
Quaternion	O
will	O
respond	O
with	O
an	O
Array	B-Data_Structure
of	O
[	B-Code_Block
Quaternion.new(2,0,0,0)	I-Code_Block
,	I-Code_Block
Quaternion.new(1,0,0,0)	I-Code_Block
]	I-Code_Block

Then	O
,	O
Fixnum#+	O
will	O
try	O
again	O
by	O
simply	O
calling	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_2225	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

Which	O
will	O
now	O
work	O
because	O
a	O
is	O
a	O
Quaternion	O
also	O
and	O
knows	O
how	O
to	O
add	O
two	O
Quaternions	O
.	O

A	O
very	O
common	O
implementation	O
of	O
coerce	O
is	O
simply	O
to	O
swap	O
the	O
arguments	O
,	O
i.e	O
.	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_2226	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

That	O
's	O
equivalent	O
to	O
the	O
behavior	O
you	O
are	O
seeing	O
with	O
Fixnum#	O
==	O
.	O

Again	O
:	O
this	O
kind	O
of	O
dispatch	O
is	O
hard	O
to	O
get	O
right	O
,	O
and	O
there	O
are	O
improvements	O
being	O
made	O
to	O
the	O
coerce	O
protocol	O
.	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
16994398	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/16994398/	O

Ruby	O
has	O
four	O
levels	O
of	O
object	O
equivalence	O
:	O

#equal	O
?	O
–	O
same	O
object	O

#eql	O
?	O
–	O
highest	O
level	O
of	O
equivalence	O
below	O
same	O
object	O

#	O
==	O
–	O
"	O
standard	O
"	O
equality	O

#	O
==	O
=	O
,	O
#	O
=	O
~	O
,	O
#hash	O
,	O
etc	O
.	O

–	O
loose	O
equivalence	O
,	O
"	O
same	O
group	O
"	O
equivalence	O

Mindful	O
programmer	O
equips	O
each	O
of	O
her	O
classes	O
with	O
all	O
of	O
these	O
methods	O
except	O
#equal	O
?	O
,	O
which	O
should	O
never	O
be	O
overriden	O
.	O

Going	O
back	O
to	O
the	O
subject	O
of	O
your	O
question	O
,	O
many	O
built-in	O
Ruby	O
objects	O
have	O
their	O
share	O
of	O
idiosyncrasies	O
in	O
the	O
implementation	O
of	O
these	O
methods	O
.	O

Ruby	O
core	O
team	O
constantly	O
works	O
to	O
improve	O
them	O
,	O
so	O
you	O
should	O
make	O
your	O
way	O
from	O
1.8	O
to	O
2.0	O
,	O
which	O
fixes	O
a	O
number	O
of	O
1.8	O
problems	O
.	O

One	O
more	O
thing	O
to	O
mention	O
with	O
#	O
==	O
method	O
,	O
is	O
that	O
for	O
the	O
classes	O
that	O
represent	O
elements	O
of	O
ordered	O
sets	O
,	O
you	O
do	O
not	O
implement	O
#	O
==	O
directly	O
,	O
but	O
instead	O
you	O
provide	O
#<=>	O
three-way	O
comparison	O
method,	O
and	O
include	O
Comparable	B-Library
module,	O
which	O
gives	O
you	O
for	O
free	O
methods	O
such	O
as	O
#==,	O
#<,	O
#>	O
,	O
#sort	O
,	O
etc	O
.	O

Yet	O
one	O
more	O
thing	O
to	O
mention	O
with	O
all	O
of	O
these	O
operators	O
and	O
operator-like	O
methods	O
,	O
be	O
mindful	O
of	O
the	O
existence	O
of	O
#coerce	O
method	O
,	O
which	O
is	O
currently	O
undergoing	O
improvements	O
in	O
Ruby	O
2.0	O
.	O

Question_ID	O
:	O
36930559	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/36930559/	O

I	O
have	O
a	O
web	O
application	O
and	O
it	O
has	O
two	O
controller	O
classes	O
.	O

The	O
two	O
controllers	O
have	O
an	O
action	O
with	O
FormCollection	O
parameter	O
with	O
HTTPPost	O
attribute	O
decorated	O
.	O

If	O
I	O
click	O
on	O
Form	O
submit	O
button	B-User_Interface_Element
then	O
which	O
action	O
will	O
be	O
triggered	O
to	O
capture	O
the	O
form	O
's	O
values	O
within	O
the	O
controller	O
.	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
44664171	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/44664171/	O

When	O
you	O
use	O
server	O
side	O
rendering	O
,	O
you	O
cannot	O
close	O
the	O
"	O
chain	O
"	O
you	O
are	O
refering	O
to	O
as	O
easily	O
.	O

This	O
is	O
because	O
what	O
Django	B-Library
does	O
in	O
this	O
case	O
is	O
serve	O
all	O
the	O
HTML	O
and	O
JS	O
(	O
at	O
leas	O
the	O
JS	O
inside	O
your	O
HTML	O
view	O
)	O
in	O
a	O
single	O
initial	O
response	O
.	O

The	O
ajax	O
requests	O
you	O
do	O
after	O
that	O
will	O
not	O
be	O
bound	O
to	O
the	O
variables	O
you	O
send	O
initially	O
in	O
your	O
response	O
because	O
this	O
variables	O
are	O
populated	O
when	O
the	O
render()	O
function	O
is	O
called	O
.	O

After	O
that	O
moment	O
,	O
you	O
cannot	O
add	O
or	O
update	O
the	O
variables	O
that	O
were	O
sent	O
to	O
the	O
HTML	O
template	O
.	O

The	O
only	O
way	O
you	O
can	O
manage	O
rendering	O
small	O
parts	O
of	O
HTML	O
is	O
using	O
JQuery	B-Library
or	O
making	O
your	O
backend	O
a	O
REST	O
API	O
with	O
Django	B-Library
Rest	O
Framework	O
and	O
moving	O
to	O
a	O
more	O
complete	O
frontend	O
framework	O
like	O
Angular	B-Library
or	O
React	B-Library
.	O

The	O
are	O
many	O
discussions	O
over	O
server	O
side	O
rendering	O
vs	O
client	O
side	O
rendering	O
.	O

You	O
can	O
read	O
more	O
about	O
it	O
here	O
:	O

https://medium.com/@adamzerner/client-side-rendering-vs-server-side-rendering-a32d2cf3bfcc	O

Because	O
you	O
threw	O
string	O
literal	O
which	O
decays	O
to	O
const	O
char*	O
.	O

In	O
short	O
,	O
you	O
catch	O
what	O
you	O
throw	O
.	O

It	O
does	O
,	O
but	O
to	O
catch	O
string	O
,	O
you	O
need	O
to	O
throw	O
string	O
in	O
first	O
place	O
.	O

You	O
can	O
throw	O
literally	O
anything	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
a	O
good	O
idea	O
to	O
throw	O
special	O
exception	O
classes	O
,	O
like	O
std::exception	O
and	O
derived	O
from	O
it	O
.	O

Yes	O
,	O
it	O
does	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
want	O
,	O
you	O
can	O
do	O
that	O
.	O

There	O
are	O
not	O
much	O
cases	O
where	O
doing	O
it	O
is	O
a	O
good	O
idea	O
.	O

It	O
looks	O
like	O
you	O
need	O
to	O
get	O
a	O
good	O
book	O
and	O
read	O
chapter	O
about	O
exceptions	O
.	O

In	O
the	O
meantime	O
this	O
super-FAQ	O
entry	O
might	O
help	O
you/	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
35528780	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/35528780/	O

You	O
can	O
throw	O
an	O
object	O
of	O
any	O
type	O
.	O

EDIT	O
:	O
(	O
Hopefully	O
I	O
got	O
this	O
right	O
now	O
)	O

What	O
you	O
have	O
done	O
is	O
throw	O
a	O
C-string	B-Data_Structure
,	O
which	O
is	O
of	O
type	O
const	O
char[13]	O
in	O
this	O
case	O
.	O

C-Arrays	B-Data_Structure
will	O
decay	O
to	O
pointers	O
to	O
their	O
first	O
element	O
,	O
in	O
this	O
case	O
a	O
pointer	O
of	O
type	O
const	O
char*	O
.	O

Typically	O
what	O
you	O
want	O
to	O
do	O
is	O
throw	O
a	O
predefined	O
exception	O
object	O
.	O

They	O
can	O
be	O
found	O
in	O
header	O
<stdexcept>	O
and	O
are	O
derived	O
from	O
a	O
base	O
class	O
std::exception	O
.	O

The	O
derived	O
exception	O
classes	O
are	O
for	O
instance	O
std::logic_error	O
,	O
std::range_error	O
,	O
std::bad_alloc	O
etc	O
.	O

Their	O
constructors	O
take	O
a	O
string	O
as	O
argument	O
,	O
so	O
you	O
can	O
for	O
instance	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_5063	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

This	O
message	O
can	O
be	O
accessed	O
in	O
a	O
catch	O
statement	O
like	O
this	O
:	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_5064	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

If	O
an	O
exception	O
is	O
caught	O
,	O
so-called	O
stack	B-Data_Structure
unwinding	O
takes	O
place	O
.	O

You	O
can	O
then	O
deal	O
with	O
the	O
error	O
locally	O
,	O
or	O
rethrow	O
the	O
exception	O
.	O

Only	O
when	O
an	O
exception	O
is	O
thrown	O
and	O
never	O
caught	O
,	O
std::terminate()	O
is	O
called	O
an	O
the	O
program	O
aborted	O
.	O

You	O
can	O
put	O
try/catch	O
statements	O
anywhere	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
remember	O
what	O
the	O
term	O
"	O
exception	O
"	O
actually	O
means	O
.	O

Cases	O
that	O
can	O
easily	O
dealt	O
with	O
using	O
a	O
simple	O
conditional	O
expression	O
if	B-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
n	I-Code_Block
<	I-Code_Block
0	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block
break	B-Code_Block
;	I-Code_Block
or	O
something	O
like	O
that	O
,	O
do	O
n't	O
need	O
the	O
exception	O
treatment	O
.	O

Especially	O
if	O
you	O
can	O
realistically	O
expect	O
this	O
kind	O
of	O
unwanted	O
condition	O
to	O
be	O
true	O
often	O
.	O

Then	O
it	O
is	O
not	O
something	O
"	O
exceptional	O
"	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
decide	O
to	O
deal	O
with	O
an	O
error	O
using	O
exceptions	O
and	O
they	O
can	O
not	O
be	O
treated	O
locally	O
,	O
you	O
may	O
put	O
try/catch	O
clauses	O
around	O
the	O
beginning	O
and	O
end	O
of	O
main()	O
.	O

Since	O
you	O
can	O
put	O
several	O
catch	O
statements	O
directly	O
after	O
a	O
try	O
statement	O
,	O
you	O
can	O
then	O
begin	O
to	O
deal	O
with	O
more	O
specific	O
errors	O
,	O
or	O
simply	O
catch	O
anything	O
via	O
catch(...)	B-Code_Block
{	I-Code_Block
//..	I-Code_Block
.	I-Code_Block
}	I-Code_Block
.	O

This	O
is	O
all	O
described	O
in	O
great	O
detail	O
(	O
including	O
pointers	O
on	O
when	O
and	O
when	O
not	O
to	O
use	O
it	O
,	O
in	O
the	O
C++	O
FAQ	O
.	O

EDIT	O
:	O
Here	O
's	O
an	O
example	O
that	O
makes	O
use	O
of	O
try/catch	O
statements	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
not	O
an	O
exception	O
object	O
is	O
caught	O
,	O
but	O
an	O
int	O
(	O
errno	O
)	O
.	O

Just	O
to	O
show	O
,	O
that	O
you	O
can	O
really	O
throw/catch	O
anything	O
you	O
like	O
.	O

Let	O

be	O
a	O
function	O
somewhere	O
nested	O
in	O
your	O
code	O
:	O

:	I-Code_Block

my	O

.	O

with	O

.	O

first	O
column	O
is	O
css	O
styled	O
based	O
upon	O
data	O
that	O
is	O
passed	O
in	O
.	O

So	O
,	O
I	O
display	O
the	O
correct	O
colored	O
icon	B-User_Interface_Element
for	O
the	O
property	O
of	O
the	O
item	O
in	O
the	O
table	O
.	O

Everything	O
on	O
page	B-User_Interface_Element
1	O
displays	O
correctly	O
.	O

Just	O
doing	O
the	O
basics	O

everything	O
on	O
further	O
pages	B-User_Interface_Element
does	O

displayed	O
because	O
it	O
is	O
removed	O
from	O
the	O
DOM	B-Library
at	O
that	O
time	O
.	O

So	O
,	O
I	O
did	O
$('#my_id')	B-Code_Block
.on	I-Code_Block
(	B-Code_Block
'page	I-Code_Block
.dt	I-Code_Block
'	I-Code_Block
,	I-Code_Block
function()	I-Code_Block
{	I-Code_Block
perPageFunctionCall()	I-Code_Block
;})	I-Code_Block
.dataTable(soonansoforth)	I-Code_Block
}	I-Code_Block
;	I-Code_Block
to	O
call	O
a	O
function	O
which	O
selects	O
the	O
correct	O
colored	O
flag	O
.	O

When	O
I	O
click	O
on	O
page	B-User_Interface_Element
2	O
,	O
nothing	O
gets	O
updated	O
.	O

I	O
click	O
on	O
page	B-User_Interface_Element
1	O
again	O
and	O
it	O
redisplays	O
the	O
1st	O
page	B-User_Interface_Element
correctly	O
.	O

I	O
click	O
on	O
page	B-User_Interface_Element
2	O
a	O
second	O
time	O
now	O
and	O
it	O
displays	O
everything	O
correctly	O
this	O
time	O
.	O

So	O
what	O
is	O
causing	O
the	O
display	O
not	O
to	O
update	O
with	O
my	O
new	O
css	O
the	O
1st	O
trip	O
but	O

properly	O
on	O
subsequent	O
trips	O
?	O

there	O

to	O
refresh	O
the	O
element	O
or	O
the	O
data	O
table	O
after	O
I	O
am	O
done	O
with	O
my	O
css	O

I	O
am	O
using	O
SignalR	B-Library
Self	O
Hosted	O
Service	O
(	O
V	O
2.2.0	O
)	O
as	O
server	O
and	O
using	O
Silverlight	B-Library
as	O
SignalR	B-Library
Client	O
.	O

I	O
am	O
able	O
to	O
connect	O
to	O
the	O
server	O
and	O
able	O
to	O
exchange	O
the	O
messages	O
.	O

I	O
am	O
having	O
a	O
button	B-User_Interface_Element
to	O
stop	O
connection	O
to	O
the	O
SignalR	B-Library
service	O
.	O

What	O
I	O
want	O
is	O
,	O
When	O
I	O
click	O
this	O
button	B-User_Interface_Element
,	O
Connection	O
of	O
that	O
Client	O
should	O
get	O
disconnected	O
from	O
SignalR	B-Library
Hub	O
.	O

I	O
am	O
able	O
to	O
get	O
disconnected	O
from	O
SignalR	B-Library
Hub	O
but	O
it	O
takes	O
so	O
much	O
time	O
to	O
respond	O
and	O
my	O
Client	O
(	O
Silverlight	B-Library
Web	O
Application	O
)	O
gets	O
into	O
unresponsive	O
state	O
and	O
comes	O
back	O
after	O
around	O
28-30	O
secs	O
.	O

there	O
any	O
way	O
to	O
disconnect	O
client	O
immediately	O
once	O
the	O
button	B-User_Interface_Element

?	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
31243125	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/31243125/	O

This	O
is	O
because	O
of	O
a	O
deadlock	O
.	O

SignalR	B-Library
client	O
blocks	O
the	O
thread	O
when	O
sending	O
the	O
Abort	O
request	O
.	O

However	O
Silverlight	B-Library
wants	O
to	O
send	O
the	O
request	O
on	O
the	O
UI	O
thread	O
.	O

The	O
default	O
timeout	O
for	O
stopping	O
the	O
connection	O
is	O
30	O
seconds	O
so	O
after	O
the	O
timeout	O
the	O
thread	O
is	O
unblocked	O
and	O
execution	O
continues	O
.	O

This	O
can	O
be	O
worked	O
around	O
by	O
invoking	O
stop	O
asynchronously	O
(	O
await	B-Code_Block
Task.Factory.StartNew	I-Code_Block
(()	I-Code_Block
=>	I-Code_Block
hubConnection.Stop());)	I-Code_Block
or	O
making	O
the	O
timeout	O
smaller	O
.	O

TL	O
;D	O
R	O
;	O

https://github.com/SignalR/SignalR/issues/3102	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
31243125	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/31243125/	O

I	O
resolved	O
my	O
problem	O
by	O
calling	O
hub	O
disconnect	O
method	O
in	O
Silverlight	B-Library
Threading	O
task	O
.	O

So	O
now	O
I	O
do	O
not	O
worry	O
about	O
acknowledgement	O
of	O
hub	O
disconnect	O
from	O
SignalR	B-Library
.	O

Question_ID	O
:	O
45343442	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/45343442/	O

I	O
am	O
trying	O
to	O
scroll	O
inside	O
of	O
a	O
div	O
on	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_2192	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

The	O
reason	O
your	O
gsub	O
does	O
n't	O
work	O
is	O
because	O
.	O
has	O
a	O
special	O
meaning	O
in	O
regex	O
.	O

You	O
can	O
have	O
it	O
interpreted	O
literally	O
by	O
specifying	O
fixed	B-Code_Block
=	I-Code_Block
TRUE	I-Code_Block
.	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
16840884	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/16840884/	O

in	O
your	O
gsub	O
call	O
,	O
"	O
.	O
"	O
is	O
your	O
pattern	O
.	O

The	O
"	O
.	O
"	O
symbol	O
in	O
a	O
pattern	O
means	O
"	O
any	O
character	O
"	O
,	O
so	O
you	O
're	O
talling	O
gsub	O
to	O
replace	O
every	O
character	O
with	O
a	O
dash	O
.	O

The	O
correct	O
gsub	O
call	O
requires	O
escaping	O
the	O
period	O
so	O
R	O
knows	O
this	O
is	O
a	O

period	O
:	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
43712855	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/43712855/	O

From	O
my	O
experience	O
,	O
if	O
you	O
hit	O
Shopify	O
with	O
multiple	O
cart	O
changes	O
at	O
the	O
same	O
time	O
,	O
only	O
one	O
will	O
go	O
through	O
.	O

My	O
guess	O
is	O
that	O
Shopify	O
handles	O
the	O
cart	O
something	O
like	O
this	O
:	O

At	O
time	O
0	O
we	O
have	O
our	O
initial	O
cart	O
-	O
call	O
it	O
cart0	O

At	O
time	O
t	O
,	O
we	O
submit	O
n	O
simultaneous	O
requests	O
to	O
add/update/change	O
the	O
cart	O

Request	O
0	O
:	O
take	O
cart0	O
and	O
apply	O
request	O
,	O
return	O
result	O

Request	O
1	O
:	O
take	O
cart0	O
and	O
apply	O
request	O
,	O
return	O
result	O

..	O
.	O

Request	O
n	O
:	O
take	O
cart0	O
and	O
apply	O
request	O
,	O
return	O
result	O

This	O
seems	O
consistent	O
with	O
the	O
cart	O
return	O
values	O
that	O
I	O
got	O
when	O
I	O
tested	O
multiple	O
requests	O
at	O
the	O
same	O
time	O
-	O
each	O
callback	O
function	O
would	O
trigger	O
with	O
a	O
cart	O
that	O
had	O
a	O
single	O
change	O
applied	O
.	O

I	O
've	O
found	O
two	O
ways	O
to	O
deal	O
with	O
this	O
limitation	O
.	O

The	O
first	O
is	O
to	O
make	O
sure	O
the	O
requests	O
are	O
chained	O
so	O
that	O
we	O
wait	O
for	O
one	O
to	O
finish	O
before	O
making	O
the	O
next	O
-	O
effectively	O
turning	O
the	O
asynchronous	O
requests	O
into	O
synchronous	O
ones	O
.	O

Not	O
the	O
best	O
for	O
speed	O
.	O

The	O
other	O
method	O
only	O
works	O
if	O
we	O
do	O
n't	O
have	O
line	O
item	O
properties	O
to	O
worry	O
about	O
:	O
combining	O
all	O
the	O
additions/changes	O
into	O
one	O
call	O
to	O
/cart/update.js	B-File_Name
,	O
passing	O
the	O
variant	O
IDs	O
and	O
desired	O
quantities	O
all	O
at	O
once	O
-	O
see	O
https://help.shopify.com/themes/development/getting-started/using-ajax-api#update-cart	O
for	O
examples	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
do	O
n't	O
have	O
line	O
properties	O
to	O
worry	O
about	O
,	O
changing	O
your	O
single-line	O
additions	O
into	O
one	O
big	O
update	O
will	O
be	O
a	O
significant	O
speed	O
and	O
reliability	O
increase	O
.	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/40561979/	O

)	I-Code_Block

(	I-Code_Block

So	O
about	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
40561979	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/40561979/	O

This	O
indeed	O
seems	O
to	O
be	O
a	O
bug	O
.	O

Rather	O
surprising	O
,	O
if	O
you	O
move	O
the	O
scroll	B-User_Interface_Element
bar	I-User_Interface_Element
with	O
the	O
mouse	O
,	O
the	O
edit	O
is	O
properly	O
canceled	O
,	O
but	O
not	O
,	O
if	O
you	O
use	O
the	O
mouse	O
wheel	O
to	O
scroll	O
.	O

You	O
can	O
easily	O
create	O
a	O
workaround	O
for	O
this	O
buf	O
however	O
,	O
since	O
you	O
simply	O
have	O
to	O
cancel	O
the	O
edit	O
,	O
when	O
the	O
item	O
is	O
replaced	O
.	O

You	O
could	O
e.g	O
.	O

use	O
this	O
method	O
to	O
create	O
the	O
cellFactory	B-Code_Block
on	O
your	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
2590794	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/2590794/	O

This	O
happens	O
when	O
one	O
of	O
the	O
objects	O
you	O
're	O
linking	O
into	O
an	O
executable	O
changes	O
significantly	O
.	O

For	O
example	O
it	O
gains	O
or	O
loses	O
some	O
lines	O
of	O
profilable	O
code	O
.	O

The	O
minimal	O
case	O
to	O
produce	O
the	O
error	O
is	O
with	O
2	O
source	O
files	O
.	O

Here	O
are	O
2	O
example	O
source	O
files	O
called	O
c	B-File_Name
..	I-File_Name
.	I-File_Name

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_260	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_261	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

What	O
they	O
do	O
is	O
n't	O
important	O
.	O

To	O
build	O
them	O
,	O
here	O
is	O
a	O
simple	O
Makefile	B-File_Name
:	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_262	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

The	O
Makefile	B-File_Name
is	O
set	O
up	O
so	O
that	O
the	O
compilation	O
is	O
main.c	B-Code_Block
->	I-Code_Block
main.o	I-Code_Block
,	O
stuff.c	B-Code_Block
->	I-Code_Block
stuff.o	I-Code_Block
and	O
finally	O
stuff.o	B-Code_Block
+	I-Code_Block
main.o	I-Code_Block
->	I-Code_Block
testexe	I-Code_Block
.	O

If	O
we	O
compile	O
and	O
link	O
those	O
C	O
files	O
with	O
the	O
-fprofile-arcs	B-Code_Block
-ftest-coverage	I-Code_Block
options	O
then	O
the	O
executable	O
file	O
has	O
profiling	O
.	O

Run	O
that	O
execuatable	O
and	O
you	O
'll	O
get	O
2	O
output	O
files	O
,	O
main.gcda	B-File_Name
and	O
stuff.gcda	B-File_Name
.	O

So	O
far	O
so	O
good	O
.	O

Now	O
change	O
the	O
line	O
#if	B-Code_Block
0	I-Code_Block
to	O
#if	B-Code_Block
1	I-Code_Block
.	O

The	O
Makefile	B-File_Name
should	O
cause	O
just	O
stuff.c	B-File_Name
to	O
recompile	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
executable	O
to	O
relink	O
.	O

The	O
stuff.gcda	B-File_Name
file	O
is	O
not	O
affected	O
since	O
its	O
object	O
file	O
has	O
been	O
recreated	O
with	O
all	O
the	O
new	O
summary	O
information	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
recompile	O
main.c	B-File_Name
and	O
relink	O
the	O
executable	O
,	O
then	O
the	O
error	O
message	O
goes	O
away	O
.	O

So	O
what	O
can	O
be	O
done	O
?	O

I	O
'd	O
love	O
to	O
know	O
!	O

At	O
the	O
moment	O
I	O
run	O
find	B-Code_Block
.	I-Code_Block
-name	I-Code_Block
'	I-Code_Block
*	I-Code_Block
.gcda	I-Code_Block
'	I-Code_Block
|	I-Code_Block
xargs	I-Code_Block
rm	I-Code_Block
whenever	O
I	O
need	O
to	O
re-check	O
coverage	O
,	O
which	O
is	O
not	O
really	O
ideal	O
.	O

Another	O
solution	O
would	O
be	O
to	O
recompile	O
everything	O
when	O
using	O
profiling	O
"	O
just	O
in	O
case	O
"	O
,	O
but	O
that	O
seems	O
like	O
overkill	O
.	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
44413280	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/44413280/	O

That	O
regex	O
is	O
not	O
legal	O
in	O
sed	B-Code_Block
;	O
since	O
it	O
uses	O
Perl	O
syntax	O
,	O
my	O
recommendation	O
would	O
be	O
to	O
use	O
perl	O
instead	O
.	O

The	O
regular	O
expression	O
works	O
exactly	O
as-is	O
,	O
and	O
even	O
the	O
command	O
line	O
is	O
almost	O
the	O
same	O
;	O
you	O
just	O
need	O
to	O
add	O
the	O
-p	B-Code_Block
option	O
to	O
get	O
perl	O
to	O
operate	O
in	O
filter	O
mode	O
(	O
which	O
sed	B-Code_Block
does	O
by	O
default	O
)	O
.	O

I	O
would	O
also	O
recommend	O
adding	O
an	O
argument	O
suffix	O
to	O
the	O
-i	B-Code_Block
option	O
(	O
whether	O
using	O
sed	B-Code_Block
or	O
perl	O
)	O
,	O
so	O
that	O
you	O
have	O
a	O
backup	O
of	O
the	O
original	O
file	O
in	O
case	O
something	O
goes	O
horribly	O
wrong	O
.	O

As	O
for	O
quoting	O
,	O
all	O
you	O
need	O
to	O
do	O
is	O
put	O
the	O
substitution	O
command	O
in	O
single	O
quotation	O
marks	O
:	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
10662029	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/10662029/	O

Once	O
the	O
app	O
grows	O
and	O
you	O
start	O
separating	O
it	O
into	O
separate	O
layers	O
,	O
lazy	O
loading	O
becomes	O
less	O
useful	O
.	O

The	O
DBcontext	O
has	O
long	O
since	O
been	O
destroyed	O
by	O
the	O
time	O
the	O
data	O
gets	O
to	O
the	O
UI	O
layer	O
,	O
and	O
while	O
you	O
are	O
within	O
the	O
datalayer	O
it	O
is	O
not	O
a	O
big	O
deal	O
to	O
specify	O
the	O
properites	O
to	O
load	O
.	O

Lazy	O
loading	O
is	O
turned	O
off	O
for	O
validation	O
,	O
so	O
if	O
a	O
property	O
is	O
marked	O
as	O
required	O
and	O
you	O
have	O
only	O
loaded	O
the	O
parent	O
an	O
error	O
will	O
always	O
be	O
thrown	O
which	O
is	O
very	O
frustrating	O
.	O

Lazy	O
loading	O
also	O
makes	O
debugging	O
rather	O
tricky	O
as	O
the	O
query	O
isnt	O
executed	O
until	O
it	O
is	O
used	O
so	O
you	O
ca	O
n't	O
examine	O
the	O
results	O
of	O
the	O
query	O
as	O
easily	O
.	O

I	O
usually	O
add	O
a	O
ToList()	O
or	O
similar	O
to	O
my	O
EF	O
queries	O
so	O
I	O
can	O
easily	O
examine	O
the	O
results	O
.	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_3825	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

That	O
means	O
if	O
the	O
optional	O
contains	O
a	O
value	O
that	O
's	O
equatable	O
,	O
you	O
can	O
compare	O
two	O
optionals	O
.	O

If	O
the	O
two	O
optionals	O
are	O
both	O
nil	O
they	O
're	O
equal	O
,	O
and	O
if	O
the	O
two	O
optionals	O
wrap	O
values	O
that	O
are	O
equal	O
,	O
then	O
they	O
're	O
equal	O
.	O

So	O
if	O
you	O
do	O
n't	O
care	O
about	O
whether	O
person.name	O
is	O
nil	O
or	O
not	O
,	O
just	O
whether	O
it	O
contains	O
a	O
value	O
of	O
"	O
John	O
"	O
,	O
you	O
can	O
just	O
write	O
if	B-Code_Block
person.name	I-Code_Block
==	I-Code_Block
"	I-Code_Block
John	I-Code_Block
"	I-Code_Block
.	O

How	O
does	O
that	O
work	O
,	O
when	O
"	O
John	O
"	O
is	O
a	O
String	O
not	O
a	O
String	O
?	O
?	O

*	O
Because	O
Swift	O
will	O
implicitly	O
convert	O
any	O
type	O
to	O
an	O
optional	O
wrapping	O
that	O
type	O
if	O
that	O
's	O
what	O
an	O
argument	O
requires	O
.	O

So	O
because	O
the	O
==	B-Code_Block
function	O
for	O
comparing	O
optionals	O
requires	O
a	O
String	O
?	O
argument	O
,	O
"	O
John	O
"	O
will	O
be	O
implicitly	O
converted	O
to	O
{	B-Code_Block
Some	I-Code_Block
"	I-Code_Block
John	I-Code_Block
"	I-Code_Block
}	I-Code_Block
,	O
allowing	O
the	O
==	B-Code_Block
operator	O
between	O
two	O
optionals	O
to	O
be	O
used	O
.	O

*	O

into	O
a	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
30652409	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/30652409/	O

Operator	O
operator->	B-Code_Block
can	O
only	O
be	O
used	O
on	O
a	O
pointer	O
type	O
(	O
in	O
that	O
case	O
foo->bar	B-Code_Block
is	O
equivalent	O
to	O
(	B-Code_Block
*	I-Code_Block
ptr	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block
.bar	B-Code_Block
)	O
or	O
a	O
type	O
that	O
overloads	O
operator->	B-Code_Block
(	O
in	O
that	O
case	O
the	O
semantic	O
depends	O
on	O
the	O
overload	O
itself	O
)	O
.	O

An	O
example	O
with	O
a	O
pointer	O
type	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
6723135	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/6723135/	O

Will	O
catch	O
and	O
rethrow	O
only	O
exceptions	O
derived	O
from	O
Exception	O
.	O

Will	O
catch	O
and	O
rethrow	O
any	O
exception	O
.	O

(	O
Edit	O
:	O
Since	O
CLRv2	B-Library
,	O
all	O
exceptions	O
are	O
derived	O
from	O
Exception	O
so	O
this	O
is	O
identical	O
to	O
1	O
.	O

See	O
Eric	O
Lippert	O
's	O
comment	O
below	O
)	O
.	O

Will	O
catch	O
any	O
exception	O
derived	O
from	O
Exception	O
and	O
throw	O
it	O
again	O
,	O
thus	O
resetting	O
the	O
stack	O
trace	O
of	O
the	O
exception	O
.	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
6723135	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/6723135/	O

There	O
is	O
no	O
difference	O
between	O
example	O
1	O
and	O
2	O
.	O

Both	O
rethrows	O
the	O
original	O
exception	O
,	O
and	O
both	O
catches	O
the	O
general	O
Exception	O
.	O

You	O
would	O
use	O
example	O
1	O
if	O
you	O
wanted	O
to	O
catch	O
a	O
more	O
specific	O
exception	O
,	O
such	O
as	O
DivisionByZeroException	O
.	O

For	O
the	O
last	O
example	O
,	O
you	O
are	O
not	O
re-throwing	O
the	O
exception	O
;	O
but	O
throwing	O
the	O
same	O
exception	O
object	O
that	O
you	O
caught	O
.	O

This	O
causes	O
the	O
exception	O
stacktrace	O
to	O
be	O
re-set	O
to	O
the	O
location	O
where	O
you	O
throw	O
it	O
-	O
which	O
might	O
be	O
a	O
problem	O
because	O
the	O
stacktrace	O
then	O
does	O
not	O
point	O
to	O
the	O
location	O
in	O
code	O
,	O
where	O
the	O
error	O
actually	O
occured	O
.	O

:	O
46791815	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/46791815/	O

am	O

to	O
Durable	O
function	O
(	O
Orchestration	O
function	O
)	O
and	O
seen	O
sample	O
application	O
as	O
per	O
Microsoft	O
documentation.So	O
I	O
have	O
few	O
doubts	O
.	O

example	O
:	O

)	I-Code_Block

can	O

request	O
to	O
http	O

triggred	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
46791815	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/46791815/	O

This	O
is	O
general	O
Azure	O
Functions	O
behavior	O
.	O

The	O
reason	O
GET	O
does	O
n't	O
work	O
is	O
because	O
the	O
function	O
in	O
the	O
sample	O
is	O
only	O
configured	O
to	O
work	O

file	O

to	O

to	O

There	O
are	O
many	O
optimization	O
problems	O
that	O
are	O
known	O
to	O
be	O
NP-hard	O
,	O
such	O
as	O
the	O
traveling	O
salesman	O
problem	O
,	O
MAX-SAT	O
,	O
or	O
finding	O
the	O
minimum	O
chromatic	O
number	O
of	O
a	O
graph	B-Data_Structure
.	O

Given	O
a	O
problem	O
of	O
this	O
sort	O
,	O
I	O
'm	O
curious	O
about	O
the	O
complexity	O
of	O
the	O
following	O
problem	O
:	O

Intuitively	O
,	O
it	O
seems	O
like	O
this	O
might	O
be	O
co-NP	O
hard	O
,	O
since	O
it	O
's	O
easy	O
to	O
refute	O
an	O
answer	O
to	O
an	O
optimization	O
problem	O

guessing	O
a	O
better	O

and	O
using	O
it	O
as	O
a	O
witness	O
,	O
but	O
I	O
have	O
no	O
idea	O
how	O
to	O
show	O
this	O
.	O

In	O
fact	O
,	O
I	O
do	O

really	O
know	O
how	O
to	O
reason	O
about	O
the	O
complexity	O
of	O
this	O
problem	O
.	O

anyone	O
know	O
of	O
any	O
good	O
lower	O
bounds	O
on	O
the	O
complexity	O
of	O
this	O
decision	O

?	O

,	O

:	O
5147234	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/5147234/	O

The	O
term	O
'	O
NP-hard	O
optimization	O
problem	O
'	O
seems	O
a	O
bit	O
too	O
broad	O
to	O
let	O
a	O
satisfying	O
answer	O
be	O
found	O
.	O

For	O
instance	O
,	O
I	O
ca	O
n't	O
see	O
what	O
precludes	O
decision	O
problems	O
from	O
being	O
considered	O
NP-hard	O
optimization	O
problems	O
-	O
if	O
you	O
consider	O
,	O
say	O
,	O
the	O
MAX-CNF-SAT	O
problem	O
with	O
the	O
solutions	O
being	O
scored	O
as	O
floor(k/N)	O
,	O
where	O
k	O
is	O
the	O
number	O
of	O
satisfied	O
clauses	O
and	O
N	O
is	O
the	O
total	O
number	O
of	O
clauses	O
in	O
the	O
instance	O
(	O
which	O
is	O
clearly	O
computable	O
in	O
polynomial	O
time	O
)	O
,	O
then	O
any	O
valuation	O
which	O
yields	O
a	O
1	O
in	O
this	O
formula	O
will	O
have	O
to	O
satisfy	O
the	O
whole	O
formula	O
.	O

So	O
let	O
's	O
assume	O
that	O
we	O
are	O
maximizing	O
floor(k/N)	O
and	O
call	O
this	O
the	O
FLOOR-CNF-SAT	O
optimization	O
problem	O
:	O
)	O

Negation	O
is	O
polynomial	O
in	O
time	O
.	O

Then	O
if	O
a	O
solver	O
for	O
the	O
proposed	O
problem	O
deems	O
S	O
to	O
not	O
be	O
optimal	O
,	O
there	O
must	O
clearly	O
be	O
a	O
valuation	O
which	O
yields	O
a	O
1	O
according	O
to	O
our	O
crafted	O
function	O
and	O
thus	O
satisfies	O
the	O
whole	O
formula	O
-	O
in	O
turn	O
providing	O
a	O
valuation	O
that	O
does	O
not	O
satisfy	O
the	O
original	O
input	O
to	O
TAUTOLOGY	O
.	O

By	O
cheating	O
slightly	O
(	O
using	O
an	O
artificially	O
crafted	O
optimization	O
problem	O
)	O
we	O
have	O
established	O
the	O
'	O
is	O
optimal	O
'	O
problem	O
as	O
co-NP-complete	O
,	O
since	O
TAUTOLOGY	O
is	O
easily	O
shown	O
to	O
be	O
co-NP-complete	O
.	O

By	O
your	O
own	O
argument	O
the	O
'	O
is	O
optimal	O
'	O
decision	O
problem	O
is	O
co-NP-hard	O
,	O
since	O
as	O
a	O
witness	O
you	O
only	O
need	O
a	O
better	O
solution	O
-	O
score	O
S	O
,	O
score	O
the	O
witness	O
and	O
compare	O
.	O

I	O
do	O
n't	O
really	O
feel	O
great	O
about	O
this	O
reduction	O
but	O
I	O
ca	O
n't	O
easily	O
improve	O
on	O
the	O
problem	O
class	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
require	O
that	O
there	O
be	O
instances	O
which	O
score	O
arbitrarily	O
high	O
and	O
not	O
just	O
{	O
0	O
,	O
1}	O
,	O
I	O
could	O
just	O
use	O
N	B-Code_Block
*	I-Code_Block
floor(k/N)	I-Code_Block
.	O

An	O
improvement	O
to	O
the	O
class	O
could	O
be	O
to	O
only	O
consider	O
a	O
problem	O
an	O
NP-hard	O
optimization	O
problem	O
if	O
for	O
each	O
K	O
there	O
exists	O
an	O
instance	O
that	O
has	O
at	O
least	O
K	O
solutions	O
which	O
all	O
score	O
differently	O
.	O

I	O
think	O
I	O
can	O
still	O
cheat	O
my	O
way	O

that	O
:	O

a	O
reduction	O
that	O

N	O

TAUTOLOGY	O

Internal.Job.Filename.Directory	O
is	O
only	O
set	O
when	O
you	O
do	O
n't	O
use	O
a	O
repository	O
,	O
and	O
it	O
is	O
set	O
automatically	O
.	O

You	O
cannot	O
set	O
it	O
manually	O
.	O

How	O
not	O
to	O
use	O
an	O
repository	O
?	O

When	O
you	O
start	O
Spoon	O
,	O
you	O
get	O
a	O
dialog	B-User_Interface_Element
which	O
asks	O
for	O
a	O
repository	O
.	O

Just	O
close	O
this	O
dialog	O
with	O
cancel	O
and	O
you	O
're	O
fine	O
!	O

It	O
took	O
me	O
a	O
while	O
to	O
find	O
this	O
:	O
I	O
was	O
wondering	O
why	O
Internal.Job.Filename.Directory	O
was	O
always	O
empty	O
.	O

The	O
repository	O
was	O
the	O
cause	O
.	O

It	O
's	O
documented	O
here	O
:	O
http://jira.pentaho.com/browse/PDI-7434	O

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/40975280/	O

controller	O

is	O
no	O
exception	O
coming	O
out	O
from	O
the	O
return	O
Json()	O
call	O
.	O

There	O
is	O
no	O
chance	O
for	O
you	O
to	O
catch	O
the	O
exception	O
because	O
..	O
.	O
what	O
would	O
you	O
do	O
?	O

is	O
already	O
done	O
for	O
you	O
by	O
the	O
MVC	O
framework	O
.	O

.	O

your	O

objects	O
from	O
JSON	O
format	O
and	O

some	O
struct	B-Data_Structure

a	O

to	O

elements	O

,	O

a	O

of	O
your	O

.	O

Then	O
the	O
funny	O
thing	O
,	O
it	O
is	O
a	O
recursion	O
of	O
saves	O
..	O
.	O

I	O
created	O
model	O
CRUD_Storage	O
,	O
i	O
want	O
to	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
8770235	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/8770235/	O

Here	O
is	O
a	O
DRY	O
way	O
of	O
dismissing	O
signals	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
want	O
to	O
dismiss	O
a	O
signal	O
to	O
avoid	O
recursion	O
,	O
a	O
simple	O
way	O
to	O
go	O
is	O
to	O
set	O
an	O
attribute	O
on	O
the	O
current	O
instance	O
to	O
prevent	O
upcoming	O
signals	O
firing	O
.	O

This	O
can	O
be	O
done	O
using	O
a	O
simple	O
decorator	O
that	O
checks	O
if	O
the	O
given	O
instance	O
has	O
the	O
'	O
skip_signal	O
'	O
attribute	O
,	O
and	O
if	O
so	O
prevents	O
the	O
method	O
from	O
being	O
called	O
:	O

annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

We	O
can	O
now	O
use	O
it	O
this	O
way	O
:	O

I	O
do	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
37557116	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/37557116/	O

You	O
need	O
to	O
increase	O
the	O
length	O
of	O
your	O
varchar	O
field	O
.	O

Multibyte	O
characters	O
use	O
more	O
than	O
one	O
character	O
and	O
length	O
in	O
the	O
definition	O
of	O
varchar	O
field	O
are	O
byte	O
based	O
.	O

So	O
,	O
your	O
special	O
char	O
might	O
be	O
taking	O
more	O
than	O
a	O
byte	O
.	O

If	O
it	O
still	O
does	O
n't	O
work	O
refer	O
to	O
the	O
doc	O
page	O
for	O
Redshift	O
below	O
,	O

http://docs.aws.amazon.com/redshift/latest/dg/multi-byte-character-load-errors.html	O

I	O
know	O
how	O
to	O
detect	O
mousedown	O
event	O
on	O
a	O
directive	O
that	O
is	O
clicked	O
.	O

However	O

also	O

to	O

when	O

is	O
down	O

of	O
my	O
directive/	O
element	O
.	O

How	O
can	O
I	O
do	O
this	O
?	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
23692695	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/23692695/	O

Create	O
a	O
link	O
function	O
in	O
the	O
directive	O
which	O
binds	O
a	O
mousedown	O
event	O
handler	O
on	O
the	O
document	O
.	O

Then	O
,	O
bind	O
another	O
mousedown	O
event	O
on	O
the	O
directive	O
element	O
itself	O
.	O

The	O
latter	O
handler	O
should	O
also	O
call	O
event.stopPropagation()	O
to	O
prevent	O
the	O
event	O
from	O
bubbling	O
all	O
of	O
the	O
way	O
up	O
to	O
the	O
document	O
level	O
:	O

If	O
an	O
app	O
was	O
installed	O
on	O
a	O
device	O
and	O
then	O
uninstalled	O
,	O
is	O
there	O
a	O
way	O
of	O
determining	O
this	O
using	O
the	O
APN	O
feedback	O
service	O
?	O

The	O
feedback	O
service	O
is	O
documented	O
as	O
saying	O
its	O
possible	O
to	O
know	O
devices	O
which	O
are	O
n't	O
responding	O
to	O
notifications	O
,	O
but	O
is	O
additional	O
information	O
included	O
,	O
such	O
why	O
its	O
not	O
responding	O
and	O
when	O
it	O
first	O
started	O
non	O
responding	O
etc	O
.	O
?	O

Is	O
there	O
any	O
way	O
of	O
determining	O
if	O
an	O
app	O
has	O
been	O
uninstalled	O
?	O

Or	O
of	O
knowing	O
if	O
an	O
app	O
is	O
present	O
of	O
absent	O
from	O
a	O
device	O
?	O

Thanks	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
8883078	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/8883078/	O

In	O
short	O
,	O
no	O
there	O
is	O
n't	O
a	O
way	O
to	O
determine	O
if	O
an	O
app	O
has	O
been	O
uninstalled	O
.	O

See	O
my	O
answer	O
to	O
this	O
question	O
which	O
might	O
help	O
:	O

Basically	O
,	O
yes	O
you	O
could	O
use	O
the	O
feedback	O
service	O
of	O
APNS	O
but	O
it	O
would	O
n't	O
conclusively	O
tell	O
you	O
if	O
a	O
device	O
had	O
been	O
uninstalled	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
need	O
to	O
know	O
this	O
then	O
you	O
're	O
unfortunately	O
going	O
to	O
have	O

The	O
site	O
you	O
're	O
linking	O
to	O
uses	O
Web	B-Library
Audio	I-Library
,	O
but	O
it	O
does	O
n't	O
use	O
playbackrate	O
to	O
change	O
the	O
tempo	O
of	O
the	O
song	O
.	O

Instead	O
it	O
schedules	O
each	O
note	O
separately	O
,	O
so	O
when	O
you	O
change	O
the	O
tempo	O
,	O
what	O
you	O
're	O
really	O
doing	O
is	O
change	O
the	O
BPM	O
at	O
which	O
notes	O
are	O
scheduled	O
.	O

You	O
can	O
think	O
of	O
it	O
as	O
changing	O
this	O
:	O

I	O
think	O
it	O
is	O
because	O
the	O
MFMessageComposeViewController	O
has	O
got	O
a	O
navigation	B-User_Interface_Element
bar	I-User_Interface_Element
.	O

Your	O
application	O
should	O
be	O
a	O
navigation	O
based	O
application	O
for	O
that	O
.	O

Otherwise	O
your	O
toolbar	B-User_Interface_Element

frame	O
position	O
will	O
be	O
affected	O
.	O

I	O
had	O
this	O
kind	O
of	O
problem	O
once	O
.	O

i	O

the	O
application	O

navigation	O
based	O
but	O
hid	O
the	O
navigation	B-User_Interface_Element
controller	I-User_Interface_Element

this	O
might	O
help	O
you	O
,	O

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/37149514/	O

The	O
problem	O
is	O
that	O
you	O
are	O
linking	O
to	O
that	O
styles.css.php	B-File_Name
from	O
inside	O
the	O
rendered	O
html	O
.	O

This	O
means	O
that	O
page	O
will	O
be	O
fetched	O
in	O
a	O
separate	O
request	O
(	O
as	O
you	O
can	O
se	O
when	O
you	O
inspect	O
the	O
page	O
)	O
.	O

This	O
request	O
never	O
passes	O
trough	O
your	O
index.php	B-File_Name
,	O
and	O
so	O
the	O
$name	O
variable	O
will	O
not	O
be	O
set	O
.	O

I	O
would	O
advise	O
you	O
to	O
include	O
the	O
css	O
in	O
the	O
rendered	O
HTML	O
inside	O
a	O
style	O
block	O
.	O

It	O
should	O
be	O
as	O
easy	O
as	O
changing	O
your	O
import.php	B-File_Name
to	O
this	O
:	O

)	I-Code_Block

You	O
can	O
find	O
all	O
common	O
substrings	O
using	O
a	O
data	O
structure	O
called	O
a	O
Generalized	B-Data_Structure
suffix	I-Data_Structure
tree	I-Data_Structure

Libstree	B-Library
contains	O
some	O
example	O
code	O
for	O
finding	O
the	O
longest	O
common	O
substring	O
.	O

That	O
example	O
code	O
can	O
be	O
modified	O
to	O
obtain	O
all	O
common	O
substrings	O
.	O

:	O

I	O
need	O
a	O
way	O
to	O
be	O
able	O
to	O
read	O
from	O
a	O
UTF-8	O
encoded	O
file	O
and	O
store	O
data	O
from	O
it	O
into	O
"	O
UTF-8	O
compatible	O
strings	O
"	O
of	O
some	O
sort	O
,	O
in	O
C++	O
.	O

This	O
data	O
needs	O
to	O
be	O
written	O
back	O
to	O
a	O
UTF-8	O
encoded	O
file	O
later	O
on	O
.	O

There	O
seems	O
to	O

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
5294014	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/5294014/	O

If	O
all	O
you	O
need	O
to	O
do	O
is	O
read	O
and	O
write	O
it	O
then	O
std::string	O
is	O
fine	O
.	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_576	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

This	O
works	O
because	O
no	O
multi-character	O
UTF	O
codepoint	O
overlaps	O
with	O
an	O
an	O
ASCII	O
character	O
so	O
the	O
standard	O
processing	O
of	O
text	O
works	O
just	O
fine	O
in	O
relation	O
to	O
end	O
of	O
line	O
sequence	O
and	O
there	O
is	O
no	O
other	O
processing	O
done	O
by	O
the	O
stream	O
.	O

What	O
you	O
read	O
is	O
what	O
you	O
get	O
.	O

Outputting	O
the	O
string	O
does	O
not	O
change	O
any	O
of	O
the	O
codepoints	O
.	O

Now	O
if	O
you	O
need	O
to	O
manipulate	O
the	O
text	O
that	O
is	O
a	O
different	O
question	O
and	O
gets	O
more	O
complex	O
.	O

Usually	O
manipulating	O
UTF-8	O
is	O
way	O
to	O
hard	O
(	O
can	O
be	O
done	O
but	O
not	O
worth	O
it	O
IMO	O
)	O
.	O

When	O
it	O
comes	O
to	O
manipulating	O
the	O
text	O
you	O
want	O
to	O
convert	O
the	O
UTF-8	O
(	O
which	O
is	O
not	O
a	O
fixed	O
width	O
)	O
to	O
an	O
internal	O
fixed	O
width	O
format	O
;	O
(	O
UTF-16	O
or	O
UTF-32	O
are	O
common	O
formats	O
for	O
manipulation	O
and	O
easy	O
to	O
use	O
;	O
(	O
UTF-16	O
windows	O
,	O
UTF-32	O
for	O
most	O
*	O
nix	O
like	O
OS	O
)	O
)	O
.	O

The	O
easiest	O
way	O
to	O
do	O
this	O
is	O
to	O
imbue	O
the	O
stream	O
with	O
a	O
facet	O
that	O
knows	O
the	O
input	O
is	O
in	O
UTF-8	O
and	O
will	O
convert	O
it	O
automatically	O
.	O

There	O
are	O
a	O
couple	O
of	O
these	O
facets	O
floating	O
around	O
in	O
different	O
libraries	O
.	O

But	O
an	O
easy	O
one	O
to	O
find	O
is	O
boost	O
:	O

http://www.boost.org/doc/libs/1_38_0/libs/serialization/doc/codecvt.html	O

Note	O
:	O
It	O
is	O
also	O
in	O
the	O
latest	O
version	O
of	O
boost	B-Library
1.46	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_577	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

The	O
processes	O
is	O
the	O
same	O
for	O
writting	O
UTF-16/32	O
back	O
to	O
a	O
stream	O
and	O
converting	O
it	O
to	O
UTF-8	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
A_578	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

Note	O
.	O

You	O
should	O
imbue	O
the	O
file	O
before	O
it	O
is	O
opened	O
.	O

Different	O
implementations	O
of	O
the	O
stream	O
will	O
react	O
differently	O
if	O
you	O
imbue	O
the	O
stream	O
after	O
it	O
is	O
open	O
.	O

Thus	O
it	O
is	O
best	O
to	O
imbue	O
the	O
stream	O
before	O
opening	O
it	O
.	O

Dinkumware	O
also	O
has	O
a	O
set	O
of	O
conversion	O
facets	O
(	O
not	O
sure	O
if	O
they	O
are	O
free	O
)	O
.	O

http://www.dinkumware.com/manuals/default.aspx?manual=compleat&page=index_cvt.html#Code%20Conversions	O

Note	O
:	O
I	O
prefer	O
to	O
use	O
the	O
terms	O
UTF-X	O
rather	O
than	O
UCS-Y	O
.	O

Though	O
technically	O
there	O
are	O
very	O
minor	O
differences	O
these	O
are	O
inconsequential	O
compared	O
to	O
the	O
confusion	O
you	O
can	O
create	O
by	O
switching	O
between	O
the	O
two	O
terms	O
while	O
talking	O
about	O
the	O
subject	O
.	O

Stick	O
to	O
one	O
unless	O
you	O
need	O
to	O
talk	O
explicitly	O
about	O
a	O
feature	O
(	O
like	O
Surrogate	O
pairs	O
)	O
.	O

Question_ID	O
:	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/35136362/	O

code	O
takes	O
practically	O
no	O
time	O
at	O
all	O
when	O
optimizing	O
with	O
-O3	O

CODE_BLOCK	B-Code_Block
:	I-Code_Block
Q_4297	I-Code_Block
(	I-Code_Block
code	I-Code_Block
omitted	I-Code_Block
for	I-Code_Block
annotation	I-Code_Block
)	I-Code_Block

What	O
compiler	O
optimization	O
is	O
making	O
this	O
code	O
go	O
from	O
0.014	O
seconds	O
with	O
-O0	O
to	O
0.000000	O
with	O
-03	B-Code_Block

Answer_to_Question_ID	O
:	O
35136362	O

Question_URL	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/35136362/	O

The	O
internal	O
large	O
loop	O
has	O
no	O
side	O
effects	O
since	O
you	O
're	O
not	O
using	O
B	O
anywhere	O
,	O
so	O
any	O
decent	O
compiler	O
with	O
-O3	B-Code_Block
will	O
eliminate	O
it	O
.	O

To	O
avoid	O
that	O
,	O
you	O
could	O
try	O
to	O
summarize	O
the	O
values	O
and	O
print	O
out	O
the	O
outcome	O
at	O
the	O
end	O
.	O

Alternatively	O
,	O
printing	O
some	O
random	O
element	O
from	O
B	O
might	O
make	O
the	O
compiler	O
suspicious	O
enough	O
to	O
avoid	O
that	O
elimination	O

.	O

,	O

,	O
